Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Mys1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel for the price right in downtown Vancouver. Only problem was that the kettle in the room was an old one and wouldn't boil despite being plugged in for 20mins. Ended up with lukewarm water.

Reviews.Title: “well priced and well located comfort”
Reviews.Author: 10000elle
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy hotel but clean comfortable large rooms right on Robsons trendy shopping street. A decent choice for me for over 30 years I have stayed many times here if i need a good value within walking distance to all the sights. Higher rooms have good views. Decent breakfast in the downtstairs restaurant and covered parking at the hotel a plus in this area if you are driving.

Reviews.Title: “Best View in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: Just finished spending 3 nights on the 28th floor of the Blue Horizon Hotel. The view is magnificent and the cost is great. The hotel is clean and has free internet access (LAN connection). The area is great. We stayed in the hotel for $119/night x3 nights (not a bad rate at all). The room had 2 queen beds and was very big. When you book the hotel ask for a room on the top floors with a Bay View. We had a great view of the Bay, Stanley Park and Mountains in the distance. You are right on Robson street so you are close to great shops and restaurants and a 20 minute walk from Stanley Park, Canada Place and the Downtown district.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and clean”
Reviews.Author: happyfeet_1970
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel mainly for the view. If you can stay on the 21st floor you get a panoramic view of everything. This is not a luxury hotel but the value is nice.the rooms are very clean and big. The bathroom is small.The parking is cheaper than most hotels, $15.00. The beds are comfortable, you are on the main street, Robson. I also like that there is a refrigerator in the room. The girls at the desk are nice. I think its a nice hotel overall and it really just depends what you are looking for. All the hotels are outdated with the exception of the really luxury hotels so take your pick for that matter. Oh the one thing that was really disappointing at this hotel was no Wi fi, or free long distance/ international/local calls. I went with my teenage daughter and we enjoyed ourselves taking on the views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nibzee
Reviews.Content: A friend I was seeing in Vancouver recommended this hotel to me. Located on Robsin Street you are surrounded by shopping and restaurants. Cross the street for starbucks if you need wifi and you are set. The rooms appear to be former apartments which have had kitchenettes removed by the design of the rooms which are spacious whether as a twin or kingsize bed. There is a tourist bus circuit which stops outside for those who want to see the sites. The staff were helpful and polite. There are trolleys for your bags to take to your room as they dont have a doorman, which i personally are happier with than having somebody else do it for me. They always seem to be full and dont advertise on hotel websites so bookings are direct. I have no idea what the restaurants or bars are like as i didnt use them but I saw a number of the same people in there on different days. I will be staying there again soon when back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: Recon905
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights at the Blue Horizon while in town for a course, which was being held at the hotel. The room I had was fantastic...large, clean and with a spectacular view of the mountains, English Bay, Stanley Park and Robson Street. Every room gets its own balcony with a corner view, and if the weather is good, you will appreciate the ability to step outside and marvel at the sights. The course was held in the meeting rooms on the 31st floor of the hotel, and let me tell you, it was sometimes hard to focus because of the views. Windows on three sides offered a stunning panorama of the city, and even the locals from Vancouver were amazed that such a gem existed. I would definitely go back, and would recommend this hotel to anyone for its great downtown location, inexpensive rates, quality rooms and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: vhetu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 2407 for 40 nights during the Vancouver Olympics !!!! Yes 40 nights!! Location was great, staff was awesome, and well youre probably reading this review cause you want to know about the room..... The rooms were huge, plenty of windows usually on both corners of the room!! At first when I was told I was staying at the blue horizon I got scared but after being there and experiencing it I would go there again in a heartbeat !!!! Hands down recommended!!!! Close to everything, clean, friendly staff, and great beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kaila R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Robsin in the heart of Vancouver DT! It is close to everything - restaurants, shops, Stanley Park, and the sky trains! The price of the hotel is very reasonable. The service is great and they have a garage for your car ($15+tax per day). If you park your car there make sure to hide everything! I heard some cars got broken into... The rooms are spacious, I believe the hotel is designed so that every room are coner rooms with lots of windows. The bathrooms are a little small and the carpets are outdated. They have a pool that opens I believe until 10 or 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: LadyJeska
Reviews.Content: As we approached the front desk, the clerks were very busy. They were very kind and worked hard and efficiently to ensure accurate and friendly service. I was pleasantly surprised when I entered my room on only the 7th floor of about 23. The view was awesome, being surrounded by all the beautiful downtown buildings. The hotel was full and we were by the elevator so I was grateful it was not loud. The rooms were nice and I would be happy to stay again. The only downfall was the pool; it was much smaller than it appeared in the pictures. It was loud with the other people and kids so we decided not to go in after seeing and hearing the situation. No big deal though, they let us check out at 12 instead of eleven so we were able to relax awhile longer.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeerful customer service”
Reviews.Author: stepsilver
Reviews.Content: The online booking was effecient. We had a few questions aboutour visit and the resposnes were very timely. Upon arrival at hotel reception and parking was handled in an excellent. manner. The room was very clean and modern, very nicely appinted. The flat screen TV had great selection of channels. We were very happy with our stay. Thank you for the polite effecient service.

Reviews.Title: “very good price for the location”
Reviews.Author: mitmit0401
Reviews.Content: my friends from vancouver are amazed how big the rooms are and how convenient the hotel is. top marks for being so close to stanley park which is just 10 mins away! loads of food around to choose from, there is a large safeway towards the end of the Robson Road towards stanley park area so that's really convenient. staff are really nice and friendly. particularly love the mattress as it is just the right level of firmness for me, and it's quite lovely to have ur own balcony. unfortunately was put on a low-ish floor so can't see very far, but from photos of other travellers i got quite jealous! i will describe my room as old and in need of renovation, but still comfy. the bathtub needs to be changed as it looks so dated as if it's been there for 20 years (the only reason why i don't give it 5 stars) highly recommended if you are not after real luxury. this will still be my first choice if i come to vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, newly renovated and prime Robson St. location”
Reviews.Author: Aceone
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this wonderful hotel and using their 31st floor conference facilities since the early 1990's and the new renovations have only made it better! Over the past couple of years all rooms have been completely redone, including window replacement. Every room has a balcony and a great view of either the city or English Bay. Last time I was in Vancouver I stayed a couple of days at the Westin Bayshore for a conference then happily moved to the Blue. The rooms are at least 50% larger and the price and location are considerably better. There is a small bistro-style restaurant on the main level with an outside area in warmer months, a pool, covered parking attached to the hotel and a small business center on the main floor. Robson Street shopping and eateries are right at your doorstep and you can even catch a trolley and do a really good city tour right at the hotel. I can't think of a better place to host a meeting or small conference than the 31st floor of this hotel. The views are breathtaking, catering service is very good, and they really go out of their way to make your event a success. There is a BC liquor outlet just around the corner and a large Urban Fair facility just a block or so away ... the rooms all have fridges.

Reviews.Title: “standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: papeetee
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the blue horizon hotel for an entire week I must say that it is a standard 3,5* hotel. The huge advantage is its great location as well as the size of the room and the many windows. The decoration is kept in dark colours, but that's a matter of taste.The bathroom however was way too small. The huge disadvantage is the lack of wireless network, there's only cable internet which also wasn't working very well and also not with all computers. This shouldn't happen in my opinion. Also the staff at the reception weren't very interested in their clients...lovely and super friendly cleaning ladies though! Also try not to get a room next to the elevators, as walls and doors are very thin and sleeping, especially during the weekend is rather a challenge. There's no complimentary breakfast, you have to pay extra and only a la carte. The food was ok, nothing special, would have appreciated a wider variety of yoghurt for example. Overall it is a decent place but nothing special and next time in Vancouver I'll look for something different.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: canucknurse66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and found it a great experience both times. The hotel is located in the middle of Robson Street where great shopping is right outside the door. If you don't have a car, no problem, the bus stops right outside the hotel. It has good access to Stanley Park and English Bay beaches. The rooms are large, clean, great views and comfortable beds. Parking is onsite for $9.00/day. The restaurant in the lobby served a delicious breakfast for a reasonable price.. there is also a restaurant on the top floor that serves dinner but we didn't have a meal there. It was an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious & nicel decorated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: nm320
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January & February 2012. I saw a rate of $99/night for a 1queen bed room online & called in to get more specifics. I told the guy I'd call back to book it & when I did I got a different girl offering me their regular rate. When I said I was told $99 earlier she said she'd book it for that price. So, check online first! I'm sure if I didn't bring it up she wouldn't have mentioned the cheaper rate. Parking is $15.. $20 after taxes + fees, but it's reasonable considering you can leave your car parked till 3pm the next day (even after 11am check-out). When we arrived we were told they required a pre-auth of the total room charge + an extra $200 pre-auth. I wish I had known about this beforehand because I didn't have enough credit on my card, but luckily they accepted cash. While they are not actually charging anything they are still withholding money that I would've liked to have during our night out. We were booked into a room on the 11th floor. The view at night was great, though in the morning we realized we were looking at a building under construction. Behind it, though, was the beautful city. The rooms are VERY big & spacious. They look exactly like the pictures on the website & the traveller photos available here. The closet is amazing; it has a built-in storage unit with shelves & places to hang your cothes. There is also a desk, a flat screen tv, a fridge, & a coffee/teak maker. The bathroom itself is fairly small, but the entire room is very clean & polished nicely. The walk-out balcony is great for getting fresh air too. The service was great.. the front desk staff was extremely nice even though I showed disappointment at their pre-auth requirement. The weekend after I booked two rooms with 2 queens each ($109/night). Though I was told the hotel can't guarantee requests, I emailed & spoke to a rep about getting the highest rooms available at our rate & side by side. I was quite happy that I got exactly what I wanted- 2 rooms on the 14th floor right beside each other. Rooms up until the 14th floor are considered standard regular rooms, & anything higher is considered deluxe & more expensive. The location of the hotel is great as it's right on Robson St & beside anything you need. I'd defintely recommend this hotel, at this rate & the location it's the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place that does not hurt one's budget”
Reviews.Author: omundi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon for 4 nights during our trip through B.C. The hotel is very well upkept. The rooms are very spacious and offer a very good standard of comfort. The bed was very comfortable. Our room also featured a fridge, tea cooker and a desk. The level of service from the hotel staff is noteworthy. They were helpful and friendly. The hotel also offers a heated spa and a couple of fitness machines. We used them pretty much every day and were very happy. The location of the hotel could not be better. It is right at Robson street, Vancouver's major shopping street. Restaurants, bars and shops are at your doorstep. The only negative experience to mention is the fact that there is no Wifi in your room, except if you bring your own laptop. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel bargain”
Reviews.Author: k0ke
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through the Vancouver tourist information centre and got a great rate. The rooms are absolutely massive, clean and new and in a perfect location on Robson Street, close to all shops and transport but at half the price you will pay in the West End or on Granville St. You can pretty much walk to everything from here - trains, stores, seabus, Stanley Park. Our room had a fridge. Service was great. Small lobby but does have Internet. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Views, A Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: T&HPortland
Reviews.Content: We headed to Vancouver BC near new years 2011. We got a great deal on a 29th floor room at the Blue Horizon. The hotel is at the end of Robson Street, a shopping district with a lot of restaurants and lounges. The room was quite comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Most of the rooms are "corner rooms" with windows along two sides, allowing for a 180 degree view of Vancouver and the bay. The one complaint we had was the heating system; every couple of minutes a small "hiss" of steam would pop up, which made sleeping a little fitful. Otherwise, though, we had a lovely stay. Be sure to visit the Creperie (Cafe Bretanne) down the street for a great lunch or breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, beautiful room and comfiest beds ever...”
Reviews.Author: Fabtwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the very end of a three month trip to the States and Canada and loved every minute of it. We had a corner room on the 19th floor, which was extremely spacious with a balcony and lovely city views. The beds were probably the comfiest we have ever had. We didn't eat in the restaurant at all, but it seemed reasonably priced. The location is excellent as you are right on Robson Street, in the thick of everything and there are endless cafes, shops and bars nearby. We mostly walked everywhere, but one day we did hire bikes and went around Stanley Park, which was great fun, and within walking distance of the hotel (about 15 minutes I think). We thought the hotel was really good value, and the bonus was that the bus we got from our hotel in Seattle stopped right outside the Blue Horizon in Vancouver, which made it all very easy for us. The staff were very helpful and the rooms immaculated. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: debsCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed first week in December just for 1 night..22 floor great view beds were comfy front desk staff very friendly breakfast wasnt great but quick if your on the run perfect location for shopping walk to everything shopping at night we felt safe on the streets only negative was the parking lot was a public lot 15 dollars a day and we didnt feel safe in there after dark.. good value rooms were clean small fridge I did notice the walls seem quite thin we could hear the neighbours showering and using the biffy. Might stay again but I do prefer a little more luxury when its a girls getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Erratic internet amenities.”
Reviews.Author: PeterFasolino
Reviews.Content: I hate to be the spoiler or gadfly for Blue Horizon's rave reviews on yelp but this needs to be mentioned. The hotel is very reasonably priced and includes pool and cable flat screen TV. BUT, (this is very important), their erratic internet service is dismal AND NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED. 90% of hotels in Vancouver have wireless capacity. BLUE HORIZON has archaic outdated cable service which made me miss important Skype business internet calls. I was informed by the hotel's maintenance guy that the Hotel's owner refuses to upgrade his internet regardless of at least 2 outages a week. This review just might compel the owner to resolve this issue for many business travelers who require DEPENDABLE internet contact with their businesses. Hotel owners cannot afford to be a "luddite" when it comes to hotel amenities. They will quickly realize a drop in their occupancy rates.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything....”
Reviews.Author: QXflyer
Reviews.Content: Went with 2 teenage boys to a Canucks game and a Football game at BC Place. Parked the vehicle and walked everywhere for 2 days. Rented some bikes 1 block down Robson and biked the Seawall at Stanley Park. The room was modern, nice TV, and quite large for 3 people. Don't stay here if you need a Gym or pool - the pool was like an oversize bathtub and the Gym consisted of 3 Elipticals. The Business Center was one old computer in the hallway on the way to the Restaurant that you had to pay for. The room, location and price is why I stayed here and why I would go back. If you live in B.C. you can get an awesome B.C. Resident's rate in the off season, but you have to call them to book it - it's not on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and top floor views”
Reviews.Author: olgajane50
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights. Got a room fairly high up (20th floor and above) and views were amazing. The room was big and nicely decorated - not super fancy but clean with modern looking decorations. The bathroom shower is a bit outdated but worked fine. Hotel doesn't have fancy entrance/front desk services that you find in some other locations. However, compared to prices of hotels with those amenities, Blue Horizon offers a good deal with a good location in Vancouver. Like a lot of other reviewers noted, try to get a room on the upper floors for the view. Robson street is convenient as near sites, public transport and lots of restaurants/shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location perfect for Robson Street shopping”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamBabe
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a long weekend here - and as always - had a great time. Was celebrating a friend's 70th and had been upgraded when we booked in to a 22nd floor corner suite...nice wall to wall windows offering great views of English Bay, North Shore Mountains and beautiful skies. Great light shows too, and while far above we had a balcony to hang out on. Found a perfect spot Zeferreli's to celebrate dinner, went to The India Bistro on Davie Street for dinner on our first night, as well enjoyed lunch at Moxies and Milestones....Staff at the hotel were excellent and we are already looking to stay there in 2012.......

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chrystalkerr
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here, great rooms and super view. Ask to be upgraded, views are special. Staff wonderful. food super and pool lovely and quiet. Can`t get anything more central, easy walking distance to stroll around the beautiful west end.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: paperopoli
Reviews.Content: I had chosen the Blue Horizon after seeing various guests' photos here on Tripadvisor - the views seemed absolutely phenomenal. We arrived at about 9 PM on a Sunday night and I was slightly surprised that the receptionist asked for my credit card before even say 'hello' to me. However, my request for a room on a high floor had been satisfied (I had emailed in advance) and we were given a room on the 27th floor. The room was huge and impeccably clean, with modern decor and the most comfortable bed one could ask for. The bathroom, as some have commented, are a bit small but nothing out of the ordinary for us Europeans who are used to this. I would imagine that maybe a person of a very large size might struggle a bit. For us, it was absolutely fine. The views from the 27th floor are nothing short of spectacular, as you can see from some of the photos that I am attaching. That, in itself, is the main reason why you should stay in this hotel - because at that price, I don't think you'll be able to find anything better. The restaurant/bistro closes really early, at 9 PM - that includes the 'bar'. I think that's really too early for a hotel. We arrived at about 9 PM on a Sunday night but couldn't get anything to eat. That night we tried the 'Shenanigans' Irish Pub which is also part of the hotel, but walked straight out as it was just too depressing (it reminded me of the bar in the Simpsons) and smelt of stale beer and dirty carpets. The food at the bistro was ok - we had breakfast there every day and lunch and dinner on a couple of occasions. The staff were very attentive and friendly; the food was ok, although on one occasion in my salad I noticed that a tomato had some kind of black mould - not so good. The biggest disappointment with the Blue Horizon is that THERE IS NO WIFI. Yes, on their website they say 'Free High Speed Internet', but it's 'wired' i.e. Ethernet and it still doesn't seem to work. I had taken an old Mac laptop with me, as well as an iPod Touch and iPhone. I tried to connect the iBook to the Ethernet but it just would not work. The instructions provided were useless, not only based on Windows XP but also incomplete. I am fairly computer literate and normally, with an Ethernet connection, you just plug in the cable and it should work. But didn't. I didn't bother asking Reception because they always seemed really busy - the reception area is very small and queues seemed to be quite long. Luckily there is a Starbucks round the corner so I was able to get online from there, but I cannot believe that in 2011 a hotel still offers no wifi - making most devices like tablets pretty useless. The 'Business Centre' consists of ONE DESK with an old looking PC which at one point had a sign saying 'out of order' taped to the monitor. Although to be fair, it was then removed. The 'Business Centre' is on the narrow corridor leading to the bistro, offering no privacy whatsoever. We did not use it. Location -wise, we found Robson Street an ideal place for our stay, because it has shops, restaurants and everything else you may possibly want/need and it's within walking distance of the rest of the city. I get the impression that The Blue Horizon should be marketed more like a 'residence' or a 'motel', because you do get the impression that it is run by ghosts. You never see a housekeeper or any members of staff outside of the reception/bistro area. It shows that it used to be a block of apartments. If you are looking for a hotel that offers plenty of amenities, room service etc, this is probably not the right place for you. The bedrooms however were extremely comfortable. We went at a very quiet time of the year so we experienced little noise, except on our last morning, when some 'neighbours' were having a shower and - I swear - it sounded as if the water was coming down inside our room. But I have yet to find a hotel room that is really quiet. I would recommend this hotel for price, convenience and, above all, the absolutely fantastic views of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: sportsdad1967
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Vancouver at a convention at Canada Place. Hotel was about a 20 minute walk from the convention and right on Robson Street. Right where all the action is at night. Staff was friendly and helpful. Ask for a room from one of the higher floors, the view is amazing. It was clean and bed was good. Pillows were great and lots of them. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: amandpm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2011, before an Alaskan cruise. Had a huge room on the 28th floor, 2 Queen beds great views of the city and beyond. No noise even though it was during the Stanley cup final match !! Never thought the canadians could be so wild ! Crazy canucks.... Pity they lost ! ....Back to the blue horizon. I agree that the check-in concierge desk can be very busy, when we were checking in the staff member was trying to do 3 things at the same time which I think is ..just rude. There were constant queues at the desk 3 and 4 deep. The breakfasts were great in the bistro outside, location was excellent within walking distance of everything. The only other downside was the bathroom .. for such a large room the bathrooms were v small and could do with a makeover. But a good hotel and great location

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TheElginNobles
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel right in the middle on Robson Street in Downtown Vancouver; ideally centrally situated. The check-in experience was chaotic to say the least. The staff member dealing with us was very much overworked, trying to do 3 jobs atr once - checking us in, answering the phones (outside lines!) and dealing with queries from several other members of staff and 'managers'. It was not her fault - she managed somehow! She even managed to sort out a foul-up by 'management', in that our two rooms were on different floors in spite of requesting close-together rooms. She managed to get us together with only a couple of minutes delay - well done! Management need to seriously look at what they expect from their staff. All the 'managers' we saw seemed to be swanning around doing nothing but harrassing their staff. That apart, we had a pleasant visit; the rooms were large clean and comfortable and as with virtually everywhere we stayed in Canada, the beds were extremely comfortable. In spite of being on Robson Street and only 14 floors up, we were njot in the least bothered by noise, either from within the hotel of from the street. On the first night, we ate in the hotel's own restaurant, Inlets. We enjoyed it so much that we went back there on the last night (only stayed 2 nights). The food was excellent and the waiting staff fast and friendly. Breakfast was good too, well cooked and presenteed.On the last morning, Wilson had the fruit because he didn't want to eat too much - mistake!! he was given so much that he couldn't finish All in all, a comfortable stay in Vancouver and we would be quite happy to return to the Blue Horizon. Muriel, Ian & Wilson Elgin & Glasgow, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price, room OK”
Reviews.Author: ozpaul
Reviews.Content: We decided to reduce costs by taking the "Skytrain" from the airport to the Vancouver City Cntr station and then carried our luggage to the Blue Horizon. This last part was a bit of a hike with our bags and if you have much luggage, you might consider a cab or bus. Otherwise, the location is within easy walk of Stanley Park and other attractions as well a good selection of restaurants. There is a good "wholefoods" store and restaurant further down Robson we would recommend. The hotel itself is clean enough although feels a little cramped with small lifts, narrow corridors and low ceilings. On the other hand, our room on the 11th floor had floor to ceiling windows and a balcony with a panoramic view of the city buildings... no harbour view for us but some great reflections. The corridor and room had a slightly strange, was it a musty or a chemical smell? which was not very appealing when we were there at the end of August 2011. You know how it is often the smell which defines how you feel about a hotel? I suppose it coloured our view of this hotel. On the other hand, the staff were fine and generally we enjoyed our stay. One small thing which was not at all specific to this hotel was that I had to go and ask for milk for our tea and coffee. No problem getting it from the cafe but we did not realize how prevalent coffee whitener is in Canada. Yuk. So would I stay there again? Well, yep. As I said in the title, good location, reasonable price, room OK, oh and a view.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! And price.”
Reviews.Author: Mannie79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on numerous positive reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The location is great! And you cannot beat the price for a centrally located hotel in the heart of Vancouver. We had a room on the 28th floor and the views were spectacular. Very comfortable, spacious room that accommodated two adults and one child. The only (slightly) negative is that our room was right across from the elevators, which you could hear, especially late at night when the late crowd came back to their rooms. Staff was helpful. The front desk tended to get a little crowded at times (it's not very big), so if you're in a hurry, best to chill if there are a lot of people. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but....”
Reviews.Author: KiwiChCh
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 4 nights at The Blue Horizon at the end of an Alaskan Cruise. We were very impressed with the size of the room and the amenities, our stay was very comfortable. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful and gave good advice and instructions re catching busses etc. The only thing to spoil our stay was on the 3rd night we were woken at midnight by some very inconsiderate guests getting out of the elevator right by our door and talking very loudly. Oh well we thought inconsiderate but we were soon asleep again. On our last night we were woken again by the same people who ended up in the room next door to us. We were awake from 3.30am to after 5am because these people continued to "party up" both in their room and outside on the balcony where they were smoking (in a non smoking hotel) I was so frustrated that I complained to reception twice. The first time they sent security up and although we could hear the security guy knocking on their door the inhabitants of the room were making so much noise they couldnt hear the knocking. Security did speak to them twice regarding the noise but they took no notice and were making as much noise again before security would have got back to the elevator. I mentioned our disappointment at the front desk early the next morning when checking out, they were appologetic and could see that the night staff had noted that security had been sent to that room twice. I understand it wasnt the fault of management that these rude people chose to ruin our last nights sleep but I did think that the security staff member was very ineffective. I felt these people should have been told to shut up or pack their bags and go. It doesnt seem fair that we paid good money and certainly did not get a good nights sleep! I am sorry if I sound like a complainer but this incident marred an otherwise lovely stay at The Blue Horizon and the beautiful city of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Texasmom04
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Blue Horizon. It has a great location on Robson Street with fantastic views and small balconies. It is well worth the money to get a Superior Room on floors 15 to 30 with a waterview. We were there the last weekend of July when they did amazing fireworks over the water. Rather than fight the crowds to get to the beach to watch the display, we were able to watch from our balcony. We had large windows that wrapped around almost two entire sides of the room - the kids loved it. The breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was well priced and delicious. Fun to sit at the outside tables in the evening. Excellent service and food. We also enjoyed being close enough to walk down to Stanley Park for the horse-drawn carriage ride around the park and visiting the Aquarium - one of the best and largest in North America.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrscee
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel using reviews from online websites. We were not disappointed. Location great;professional/helpful staff; large/clean/comfortable rooms; restaurant has excellent food. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great time!”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: We loved both our stays at Blue Horizon in September. The front desk staff even helped us get priority seating at Joe Fortes for dinner to honor my birthday. We loved the balcony views and our room was clean with all the conveniences needed. We had breakfast once at the hotel and it was yummy. We would love to stay here again. Parking is expensive but all partking downtown is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Bettina”
Reviews.Author: Bettina C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location.Clean and comfortable. Staff efficient, helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonably priced, great location”
Reviews.Author: RickN99
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a cruise and flew in a day early. We chose this hotel since family members had stayed here the previous year. The hotel is small and quite comfortable. It's located in a busy part of Vancouver but the room was quiet. We ate dinner at the hotel restaurant and had a surprisingly good meal. The menu was quite varied, the beer was cold, and the service was excellent. The table was next to the sidewalk and offered good people-watching. The best part of the hotel was the location. There was many sights in the neighborhood for an entertaining walkaround, Stanley Park was a short cab-ride away, and the morning cab-ride to the cruise terminal took around 5 minutes. I don't know if I'll be back in Vancouver any time soon, but I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: beanietravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown Vancouver along Robson Street so it's convenient to do sightseeng & shopping. I can see sunset from the room. Walking distance to Stanley Park. There is also a free shuttle bus to Capilano Suspension Bridge that stops in front of the hotel. Friendly and helpful front office staff. Thanks for making my stay so memorable !

Reviews.Title: “From the 30th floor, great view, but room was just OK”
Reviews.Author: HappyToTravel_16
Reviews.Content: OK room, but great view. Bathroom needed some fixing up. Don't know how long before a pocket door had replaced previous door, but trim wasn't painted the same color. Was very odd. Had a difficult time getting Internet to work in room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good location”
Reviews.Author: FujiFab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon for four nights and found it to be well located, right at the Robson St. and just a few blocks from SkyTrain stations. Rooms were spacious and the furniture new. Very helpful and efficient front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: mkjmitch
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at the Blue Horizon. Excellent value and would stay in this hotel again. Great location and the staff very helpful. You can't go wrong staying here is you want easy access to tours and shopping etc

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dpayne1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the middle of September. I would echo all the recent reviews. We were on the 29th floor with a corner room, quiet, with great view. The reception was great and gave us maps,coupons and answered all our questions. Lots of restaurants on Robson St and Denman within walking distance. Good price for a downtown hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Bill E
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for four nights while traveling to Vancouver for the first time. We specifically requested a higher floor room and were not disappointed. We had a great view of Stanley Park, the city, and the bay to watch beautiful sunsets. It's a great location next to lots of restaurants, and within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. We didn't have lots of luggage, so it was pretty easy walking from the subway station that services the airport directly. The room could have been a bit bigger, but we weren't there except to sleep and shower so overall it was just fine. We headed to Victoria after our stay and the Pacific Coach Line bus will pick you up from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, value, service, location....”
Reviews.Author: naramatian
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our room at The Blue Horizon. It's situated perfectly on a quieter stretch of Robson St, for those who want to explore the downtown west-end on foot. We walked to the symphony, to great restaurants, to shops on Robson, to movie theatres nearby, to excellent bakeries on Davie St. The room was very spacious, with two queen size beds even though we only used one. We spent $10 more per night to upgrade to one of the higher rooms with a view of English Bay. If the weather is nice, it's worth it. . .The staff were very competent and helpful. There is a lovely restaurant in the hotel for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We didn't eat there but it was always crowded, so we imagine the food must be good. Parking is very reasonable ($15./day) for unlimited in and out priviledges. If you're looking for a nice hotel without the added glitz of a doorman, fancy lobby, flowers, etc., you'll be pleasantly surprised at the size and decor of the rooms, and the view of course (there's a fridge too!).

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbbyMarlborough_NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon Hotel in mid September and thoroughly enjoyed it. We were given a spacious, comfortable room on the 19th floor. It is located in a nice part of Robson St which is handy to most things. The restaurant was reasonable with good food and friendly efficient staff. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good location”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little strangely laid out, but large. As you enter (our room at least), the bathroom was on the left, and there was a small entry way. Turning left, straight ahead was the closet. To the left was a desk with internet connection (free, but no wifi in the hotel) and then the bed. Windows on two sides and a small balcony. There was only one nightstand on the left side of the bed, and unless you put your suitcase on the chair, desk or in the entryway, you had little room to walk around. The room & bathroom was very clean, and service was very good. They held our bags for most of the next day, and there is a direct line to order a cab. We did not try the restaurant/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms but reception poor”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: The service at reception was abrupt (the only time we experienced this in Canada) and was very crowded and small. The room was very good and spacious although only being on the 4th floor we had no view. Breakfast in the bistro was excellent value. An average city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: laureneliz
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Great View! Excellant front desk service! Very comfortable beds and pillows. Great Sleep

Reviews.Title: “Nice well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler70
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here at the end of an Alaskan cruise. It is well located on Robson Street, has large rooms (two beds), good amenities, a balcony and is reasonably priced. The HOHO trolley stop is just outside the front door. The lobby is small and can be overly crowded at times of check-in and check-out. The restaurant has a good, reasonably priced breakfast, outdoor seating and a lounge area indoors for cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Book it for the views!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: parkoSydney
Reviews.Content: We scored a room on the 29th floor. Great size rooms with a balcony & amazing views. The hotel itself is in a great spot on Robson st so we dropped in & out our whole stay plus the hop on, hop off stop was right outside. Before going to dinner we decided to have drinks & nibbles in & watch the sunset - WOW. Another night for a predinner drink, we walked down a block or so to the revolving restaurant (as suggested by locals to avoid paying the rip off cost of the Vancouver Lookout). We had a drink each & thoroughly enjoyed to view & it cost less than the other!! Would very definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Weekday Stay May Be Better Than the Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Modestotrekkerl
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 27th floor of a well maintained hotel. Our room was large, the view was tremendous, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay on the Thursday we arrived. The room had all the amenities--safe, refrigerator, a very comfortable bed and nice TV. The room looks like it had been remodeled recently. The employees were all friendly and helpful. In short, we were thrilled with our accomodations. Friday night was different. The hotel did not change. The room was still immaculate. But the clientele changed. The neighbors partied very late and we could hear the noise quite clearly. At midnight, we called the front desk to request quiet and they responded within 5 minutes. We were able to fall asleep. At about 3:30AM, the fire alarm went off. We stayed in our room, figuring that there was no hope of escaping from the 27th floor. The fire trucks came, but there was no fire. After the commotion ended, two people from two different rooms were standing in the hall have a lengthy conversation. I went out to see what the discussion was about. One lady said that earlier in the evening, someone had tried to enter her room while she was sleeping. She thinks someone got off the elevator at the wrong floor. At 4AM, all was quiet again. When I checked out, I told the clerk at the front desk my evening experience. She told me that if I ever have a problem, call the front desk and they will respond immediately. If I stay here again, it will only be during the week. It is a very nice hotel in an excellent location. If you are young and like to party, there is a lot of night life and good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great, but do something about the A/C”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for a business trip because the website looked good, and the prices were a little better than other nearby properties. Online booking was not a problem, though I had to call them later to make a change, as it could not be done online. The room was large with a great closet. The beds were comfy and the pillows very good. The lap pool is kind of small, but did the trick, and the hot tub was warm, but not hot. The sauna is not kept on so, unless you turn it on and wait an hour (maybe more), you will not enjoy your sauna. My only real complaint with the property was the heat in the hallways and elevators... bearable, but greatly uncomfortable. I hate working up a sweat just standing still.

Reviews.Title: “Once you get upstairs.......”
Reviews.Author: gailr97
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Blue Horizon between coming off a cruise and returning home. We had booked it both on price and location - downtown on trendy Robsonstrasse. I will review the room first - excellent - large, comfortable bed, bathroom is fine, large HD TV, coffee maker, quiet, corner suite - all are, I think. The negatives are in getting up there. There is a restaurant on the ground floor which takes up a lot of space and leaves very little lobby space. When you get people both checking out and trying to check in (or at least leave their luggage) there is pandemonium. Maybe Saturdays are the worst - lots of luggage belonging to people joining or leaving cruises. And not enough staff to deal with all of this. Only three elevators to serve a 25 storey hotel. One strong recommendation - try to arrive outside a peak check out/in time. We had breakfast at the restaurant - Inlets - and it was fine - good food, pleasant young staff. They can also provide good cocktails in the evening when it sort of changes character.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Vancouver Stay”
Reviews.Author: WildflowerMama
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon is an urban hotel that has great views. It is well serviced by tour buses. All the rooms are up several floors because the parking garage is on the first few levels and I think all the rooms are corner suites with lots of windows. Our room was clean and crisply appointed; the bed was mighty fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; good value.”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandJP
Reviews.Content: We were on the 25th floor (you have to pay extra to get one of the higher floors) & we had a great view. Room was spacious & comfortable, though decor seemed a little dated. However, bathroom was very, very small. Room has safe, fridge, and coffee maker. Two nearby grocery stores are handy. Garage is adjacent; parking is an extra fee (this seems common among Vancouver hotels though fee at Blue Horizon was about half of what other hotels were charging). Parking includes in/out privileges. Front desk staff seemed to be always busy and the tiny lobby was frequently crowded with people waiting. Staff was friendly. Only complaint with service: fire alarm went off at 2:00 a.m. (false alarm) and it could have been handled better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RicknElsie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nts from Sept 6 - 9, 2011 for business. Was given a nice room with a great view of English Bay. The beds were comfortable, rooms were clean and service good too. Great location to restaurants, shopping and leisure. Check in & check out were smooth. Not far from Burrard St. skytrain station to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mehilainen
Reviews.Content: Location is great Rooms are superb Staff was ok, maybe next time I will actually get that extra pillow... My only complaint (besides that pillow) would be that it would almost fell like hotel doesn't want visitors with cars. Not that the parking area wouldn't have space, but the way from our car to the lobby and from there to our room is nightmare if you have any suitcases. .We have no reason not coming back, we loved our room that much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: EKG_Brits
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Bue Horizon in August 2011. It is ideally located, a short walk from the many restaurants on Robson Street and the cruise terminal and Stanley Park. I was worried about noise from the Irish bar and club next door but even though we were overlooking the Robson Street, the windows are less insulated to keep out the noise. The room was very large with plenty of space for a family of four. I think all of the rooms are corners with a small balcony and as we were there during the Festival of Light firework competition we were able to watch from the comfort of our room. The only slight disappointment was the size of the 'spa'. A very small lap pool, sauna and a couple of exercise bikes was a bit basic. The children were able to cool off in the pool though so all was not lost.

Reviews.Title: “Cater to tour groups”
Reviews.Author: rebircs
Reviews.Content: It was a shame my experience at this hotel turned out poorly. My first few experiences were very nice and there was great potential for this to be a great part of my trip. My room was very clean and had a nice view of Robson Street (a major shopping and restaurant area of the city) from both the view from two walls of windows and a balcony. The pool was a short lap pool (for two people at most), but there was a sauna and jacuzzi -- nice perks, even if the pool was a bit smallish. I was checked in by a friendly clerk who told me I could ask the front desk at any time for any concierge-type questions, they would be happy to help me out. I wish I could have found this same clerk later on as my experiences soured from that point on. I had done a lot of my own research before visiting Vancouver, so the few questions I had were brief and to-the-point -- they could have been answered quickly. However, only two of the five days I stayed at the hotel could I get someone to help me. The first was from the clerk on the first day (as I previously mentioned) and the second was from a porter after a desk clerk decided it was more important to assist the tour group couple in line behind me. Luckily the porter saw my dropped-jaw reaction and offered to help me before I stormed off -- this wasn't the first time I had been ignored, but I was still shocked by such behaviour and I was tired of being treated in that manner. Other than those two helpful hotel employees, the staff was very rude to me by either ignoring me outright or talking to me in a dismissive manner -- they were very short with their answer (I imagine in hopes I would just go away), negative, and not at all helpful nor even made any attempt to help me out/point me in the right direction so I could get an answer to my question. I didn't expect them to have all the answers, but I did expect a friendly attitude and to at least be pointed in the right direction. Let me provide an example. While I didn't think the noise from outside the hotel could be heard at night, the noise from both the hallway and the adjacent rooms could be (significantly) -- I had to use earplugs to help me get to sleep. However, one night I awoke to a fire alarm and a lot of commotion in the hallway. As I got up and ready to evacuate the building, the alarm turned off. I wasn't sure if it was a false alarm or not, but I could still hear lots of people in the hallway trying to get down the steps. I went out onto the balcony and saw two fire trucks. The second truck was leaving. Another person was out on her balcony and asked me if it was a false alarm or if we should evacuate. I said I didn't know. I called down to the front desk to find out what should be done. No one answered. So, I started down the steps to evacuate -- I figured better safe than sorry. I made it most of the way down when a couple coming up the steps told me it was a false alarm and that there were throngs of people waiting for the elevator to get back up, so they had decided to take the stairs. I walked up several flights of stairs with them and they commented that they were not with a tour group and having a bad experience at the hotel as well and wanted to know what my experience was like. I told them it was souring. Once I got back to my room, I tried for another hour to contact the front desk (I couldn't get back to sleep with all the noise) and still no one would answer the phone. I had been able to put together that it was most likely a false alarm, but I was still a little shook up after having been awoken in that manner and wanted some confirmation. I tried the next morning to ask the front desk what had happened, but again, like what had happened to me so many times before, once it was my turn to be waited on in the queue, the front desk person decided the tour group people behind me were more important and completely ignored me (as if I wasn't even standing in the queue). If the couple I talked to in the stair way hadn't mentioned they had had the same experience, I might have been a bit paranoid and thought I was in an episode of the twilight zone or something! I found the way I was ignored to be that bizarre. My best suggestion to the hotel management would be to get a dedicated concierge. Maybe that will help alleviate some of the burden on the other desk staff and they could better do what they seem to want to really do -- check in and cater to tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “NO WI-FI. What the...?”
Reviews.Author: tangochucks
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, this hotel has a great location, with good views and clean, quiet rooms. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. But for the money, I was expecting more. The room was pretty average overall -- nothing special, including the toiletries provided (not a big fan of a wall-mounted liquid soap thing that is supposed to double as shampoo). But the reason I will never stay there again: absolutely no wi-fi anywhere in the hotel, and no mention of it on the hotel's website. Yes, there is a plug-in for high-speed. But I was travelling light with my iPad -- and like many smart device users -- unwilling to pay data roaming charges from my home country. So every time I wanted to check email or video call, it was off to the very public cafe at the corner to buy something in exchange for wireless internet access.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time round, still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brizzyguy
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel a couple of years ago, and decided to stay here again this year, as it is in an ideal location. Last time, I was placed in a room on a lower floor, with no views, so this time I decided to pay a bit extra for a higher floor room with views. Well, I certainly got what I asked for! The 26th floor room had fantastic views over Vancouver and English Bay. It was a nice large corner room, with two very comfortable queen beds. This time round, they have upgraded the TVs to large LCD flat screen with nice HD picture. Pity about the in-room internet. It is quite bad, slow performance, and they still use those old power line modems, which frequently require re-setting. The color choice for the carpet was unfortunate - brown and blue strips. Other than those minor issues, a very nice room - a bit expensive, but worth the extra cost for the convenience of such a good location with everything in downtown Vancouver a short walk away. Breakfast at the hotel's restaurant is simply superb, inexpensive, and very nice staff. I used the parking in the hotel, and it was $15 per day, and on the last day. dropped off my Avis rental car at 757 Hornby St , and it was an easy walk back to the hotel in Robson St. One good feature that impressed me - there is a nice large electronic safe in the closet, it can fit laptops, cameras, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic but fine room, reasonable price for area.”
Reviews.Author: RoamingJuggler
Reviews.Content: Nothing super fancy, but very reasonable rate and great central location. Nice little balcony. If you're just looking for a good place to stay at a reasonable price and don't need the extras of a fancy, high-end hotel, this will do the trick. Note: some of the free tourist buses stop here, which is handy, but since it's later in their route, consider just walking over to the convention center (15 mins) and getting the bus there, to avoid it already being full and passing you by at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Cara48302
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Interesting shops nearby and within walking distance of Stanley Park and the cruise terminal. We stayed there for three days, before our Holland America cruise to Alaska. The staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were immaculate and the hotel restaurant has great food. There is a lap pool and hot tub in the Fitness Center, also immaculate. This is also the pickup point for many Vancouver attraction tours.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swansong004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue Horizon Hotel the last day of the fireworks. When we arrived they were very busy with a fully booked hotel so we couldn't check in early. They did offer to take our bags up to our room for us while we enjoyed Vancouver. The location was amazing with being close to all the shops and restaurants. Once we were in our room we were pleasantly surprised. The room was on a higher floor overlooking English Bay. Rooms were clean and nice size. Only down side were small washrooms but who spends lots of time in the bathroom. That night we were able to enjoy an amazing view of the fireworks from our balcony with a glass of wine and no crowds. After staying here it is our preffered hotel and have booked every time we are in Vancouver. Great service, location, rooms and price. Couldn't get better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: Eileen887
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in August. It was my first visit to Vancouver and the location was perfect for me. It's centrally located to be able to catch public transportation and to walk to Stanley Park and museums. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. My room was lovely - on an upper floor with a view of English Bay. It was quiet, clean and had everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the city and close to Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: LothiansJack
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good location allowing access to the city, Stanley Park and the waterfront areas. Rooms are spacious with really comfortable beds. All rooms have a balcony which is a nice touch. The staff were friendly, lifts extremely efficient and the overall ambience is congenial. Took a look at the pool but have not used it, strong smell of chemicals put me off. Gym equipment is squashed into this area. If a proper fitness suite is what you are hoping for this will not be up to scratch. If all you want is a short workout on familiar equipment you will be fine. The restaurant and street cafe areas are clean and appear popular. In room facilities are good with a good selection of movies to watch when you need to rest after seeing all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for pre cruise or extended stay.”
Reviews.Author: herbalsoaplady
Reviews.Content: Our second pre cruise stay at this hotel. The hotel has new drapes, carpet and really wowed us on this stay. Front desk mentioned that all new windows have been added to cut down on traffic noise. We love the high floors for the views of the city. Location is great for dining and walking about - not far from Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Meg2979
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a lovely trip to Vancouver. Blue Horizon was a dependable, clean, fully accessible hotel in a GREAT location. I was able to walk all over the city from the location on Robson (including great shops and restaurants down the street). The room was very spacious with a huge closet, coffee maker, refrigerator, safe, and a decent view (from the 11th floor). The staff was friendly (especially the doormen), and helpful. Overall, a comfortable, "good nights sleep" stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franzdorette
Reviews.Content: Blue Horizon – A Hotel worth considering We enjoyed a warm welcome on our arrival at the hotel. Although the person on duty at the front desk was effective in registering new arrivals and checking them in, I must admit, his talked fast and neither me noir my wife were able to follow his communication. Our room was a pleasant surprise. It was spacious, neat and the lay out was sound. The bar fridge and coffee maker was hidden in a part of the room that is ideally suited for it. The desk and chair in the room was large and comfortable. Lighting was well balanced. We occupied a corner room and the windows let more than enough sun light in. The small balcony was to our taste as we were able to enjoy city as well as harbour views. We were able to enjoy the beautiful and colourful sun sets at the end of each day. The hotel is well located and transport by taxi is no problem. A walk of about 10 minutes gets you to an elaborate shopping centre. The hotel creates the impression that it is cutting costs in certain areas. There was doorman available on our arrival. They do not offer room service and ice machines are available only on certain floors. We were on a 5 week holiday en route to Alaska. Laundry facilities were important to us. Although the hotel do offer such a service it was somewhat disappointing that I had to enquire about the return of our laundry instead of having it delivered to our room. The hotel is close to several good restaurants and a coffee shop. Less than 5 minutes walk front the main entrance to the hotel is a famous coffee shop that seems to be very popular with guests and Canadian people in Vancouver. Auto banks are close in close proximity. The front desk staff were all helpful and friendly. The in room internet service was unavailable for a day but one was able to use the internet facility in the business centre at a fee. All in all, a good hotel, well priced and recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Very attractive room”
Reviews.Author: Rt66tbird
Reviews.Content: Location on Robson is perfect. Everything about the hotel is attractive. Especially the room which was spacious and well decorated in a relaxing blue. Good bell service. Desk personnel ok but not great. Off lobby, restaurant very good for breakfast and priced well. The exterior walling of the building has a glazed blue shaded material. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience is a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vancouver and I've fallen in love with this city. The Blue Horizon Hotel is what every boutique hotel should be. Beautiful rooms, friendly staff and a great location. . The hotel's central location was perfect for exploring every area of the city-many on foot. The hotel is surrounded by dozens of great restaurants many of them of varying Asian cuisine. My room was lovely appointed in a sleek minimalist style that fits this sleek modern city. The room had a gorgeous view facing Robson Street from which the entire city could be viewed. I can't wait to stay at this hotel again when I visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: CTTravelersRus
Reviews.Content: Located on Robson St. in the heart of downtown Vancouver, The Blue Horizon Hotel was near everything! We could walk to Stanley Park and the Aquarium. Granville Island and Gastown were a short taxi ride away. A variety of quality restaurants are located nearby. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating. The room was spacious and comfortable. We definitely recommend The Blue Horizon.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints with this nice, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael336
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel and found it to be very clean, friendly staff, and well-appointed. The room was not huge but was modern and up-to-date with a very comfortable bed and pillows, plus the usual flat-screen, fridge, coffee, tea, etc. A nice touch was the bathrobes to use when going to the pool and hot tub. Our room was on the 20th floor which afforded us a great view of the city and water. We'd stay here again; great location; never had to take the car out of the garage; plus not expensive for downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: momof3sonsnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to an Alaskan cruise with our 3 boys ages 7-11. Hotel was in a great location, clean nice size rooms and the staff was VERY helpful. For the price you could not beat this hotel. The restaurant downstairs was very good and reasonably priced for the area. There are several shuttles that leave right in front of the hotel (some free and some hop on hop off trolley rides). Many restaurants in the area and an easy walk to the train station. The Capilano Suspension Bridge has a free shuttle right in front of this hotel...this is a must see attraction if you have the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff who will go out of their way to help you”
Reviews.Author: CareyGLondon
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, good views, nice, helpful staff. Located on the most central street in the city but peaceful enough (rooms on higher floors better for this).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Fishandbeer
Reviews.Content: Our group of seven stayed at the Blue Horizon for two nights on our pre-cruise visit to Vancouver and were very pleased with the accomodations and service. The rooms were spacious, conmfortable and all had nice views. Rooms on the upper floors cost a little more but the views are worth it. There is a nice restaurant with outside seating and very reasonable prices. The location is perfect for walking to shops, restaurants and interesting neighborhoods. The hop on-hop off trolley tour (highly recommeded) stop is outside the hotel lobby. We looked online at other hotels and selected the Blue Horizon because of the price and the great reviews. We're so glad we did and will definitely be repeat guests on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel already recommended it”
Reviews.Author: KillBur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our return visit to Vancouver after travelling for two weeks while on our honeymoon from Ireland. They gave us a room on the 29th floor with an excellent view of the city as we were on our honeymoon. The balcony and view was class while also the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean and i would definately recommend, also it is the heart of the city for shopping and plenty of restaurants close by:):)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an "acceptable" rate”
Reviews.Author: NotTooLate
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel in a good area of downtown Vancouver, the Blue Horizon Hotel is an excellent choice. Considering its location and pretty good quality features, the prices are very acceptable for Vancouver. It is on Robson Street which can be a bit noisy - particularly on a summer weekend night - but it's very close to the main features and shopping of downtown. Definitely recommended choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: vegablue16
Reviews.Content: Recently in Vancouver visiting with a friend of mine and we needed to book a hotel at the last minute. The staff at the Blue Horizon were very helpful in assisting with the booking. Upon arrival, found the hotel to have great atmosphere and friendly staff. The room itself was great - amazing views from the 15th floor, beautifully decorated with funky and modern decor, clean, comfortable and safe. The hotel is close to lots of tourist attractions (art gallery, Stanley Park, etc.) and walking distance to the Vancouver City Centre train station where you can catch the Canada Line direct to and from the airport (which, in itself, is super convenient.) The only thing to note is that they don't have room service - not a big deal, but it's worth knowing. You can call down to the restaurant and order food. They'll call you when it's ready and you can go downstairs to get it. (Great food, by the way!) All in all, it's a little pricey, but that could be a reflection of booking last minute and during the summer. The fireworks festival was also on when I was in Vancouver, and the proximity of the hotel to Stanley Park may also inflate the price. Still - I'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms with great view”
Reviews.Author: RoeschMadison_Wi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon while attending a conference in Vancouver and chose this hotel over the recommended ones near the center to save a bit of money. We were given a spacious room on the 21st floor, corner room as all are, that was clean and comfortable. Centrally located we walked to most places including Stanley Park. The front dest was very helpful; they even uncorked a bottle of wine we brought back for no charge. Next time we are in Vancouver, we will stay at the Blue Horizon.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible, comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Kat21_9
Reviews.Content: First time in Vancouver so we had lots to explore. The hotel is linked with the excellent public transport system and close enough to the busy centre and port to have a comfortable stroll to both.

Reviews.Title: “Good with limitations”
Reviews.Author: krut30
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Large rooms with good space to move around. Make sure to get a room on an upper floor (there are 31 I believe) for a better view - higher the better. You have a choice of city or harbor - I like the harbor because you see the mountains as well. Limitations are the eating facility which is small, as is the lobby and both get easily crowded. This is a very popular hotel because of its prime location and generally modest rates (by comparison). Be prepared for 11% tax on everything you buy with a hotel tax on top of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SizzlingSkies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here before taking an Alaskan cruise. I am very paranoid about germs and cleanliness and squeamish about things like "stray" hairs or stains on hotel sheets. In fact, I dread staying at hotels. The Blue Horizon was excellent. The room was clean and I felt very comfortable. The bathroom was small as other reviews have mentioned, but this is pretty typical for a hotel room. We were on the 24th floor and the view was okay, but we were not high enough to see above the other buildings, so we were right across from an apartment building. As the other reviews stated, it is a very noisy street and was very noisy into the early morning; I cannot imagine how loud it is in the lower-down rooms. Also, the staff at the desk was very nice and accommodating, unlike what previous reviews state. Our room was ready for us at 1am after our late night flight and on the morning we had to check-out, the staff allowed us to check-out an hour late, free of charge (we couldn't get on the ship until noon).

Reviews.Title: “Basic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: klb72
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon Hotel is an average hotel. They have an empty fridge in the room with a fancy TV. The hotel is narrow and tall with a bistro on the lobby level. The food in the bistro was good. I generally ate there for breakfast every morning. They do not have wifi. They do have a computer in the lobby for guests to use. if you need wifi go to the Starbucks a few steps away on Robson. This place is fine if you want value in a popular location.

Reviews.Title: “My only complaint is the poor internet connection”
Reviews.Author: azzure
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and competitively priced. Views are incredible from the higher floors and rooms are clean and well-decorated with nice fluffy bathrobes. I would have given this hotel 5 stars if the internet connection had not been so intermittent. We really needed internet to help us discover Vancouver restaurants and attractions, so it was annoying to have it be so undependable. Also, Robson Street seems to have a bit of a problem with panhandlers/vagrants these days. Not a big issue, but be alert and keep an eye on your valuables. We were warned about leaving ANYTHING of value in the car in the hotel's parking garage...apparently windows have been broken for loose change.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice - not any problems.”
Reviews.Author: OnOurWay038
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for Vancouver. The location gives easy access to many sites, although not many sites in the exact location of the hotel, except lots of shopping. (Note: we did the hop-on/hop-off “Big Pink Bus” tour option which had a stop right in front of the hotel.) The hotel has recently been renovated so rooms were gorgeous although bathroom was tight for two. Bed was great, and room was very clean. We opted to pay the extra for a higher room which improved the view. Room was very quiet with windows shut so you would probably be ok on a lower floor, but the view was pretty spectacular. The hallway sounds, however, did penetrate especially when someone clunked a door shut; this was really not a problem since there are only 8 rooms per floor. Building is angled so all rooms have corner windows. PS. Staff was very helpful, and the restaurant was a perfect option for tired feet – with reasonable breakfast and dinner options.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: LauraJane83
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Blue Horizon in July. Our room was on the 20th floor and had great views from the balcony. We booked through expedia and got a slightly better rate, although had a smaller room (the elevator cut into our room). We didnt go in the pool/jaccuzi but did visit them; they looked a bit grotty to be honest so I would suggest visiting the outside pool by Stanley Park/the sea wall instead. Breakfast at the hotel was nice but pricey. The hotel has a great location; right by the shopping district and we walked to Stanley Park. There are plenty of restaurants right on the doorstep. Compared to other hotels in Vancouver this hotel was reasonably priced for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Suite was okay”
Reviews.Author: Live_frm_AsiaPac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in the Executive Suite. For our use, 5 people (2 adults/3 children) it wasn't an optimal experience. I think it would be well suited for a business stay or a couple who want high quality and designer accommodations. The suite was very clean and well appointed with designer wall coverings and color coordination. Oddly the decoration didn't extend into the main bathroom which was circa 1970 tile and tub, although clean and well kept. We were on the 30th floor which has a balcony and an awesome view. Our largest complaint was the reception lobby is *tiny*. There is room for about two parties at a time. Get 4 or 5 going and we were pretty much on the public street waiting our turn. Seems like a nice place, but we wouldn't stay there again either as a family or as a couple. There just wasn't anything special about it.... Oh and it is too far from Stanley Park to walk it (with kids). The walk isn't so far but it is hilly and there were lots of piggy backs involved.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea088
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful. It was right downtown so you could walk to all the shopping. There is alot of traffic in that area. They do have a parking garage but you have to pay for it. Their restaurant was very good and priced right. We were on the 17th floor and the view was fantastic. Every room has a corner window. The rooms are quite spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: T W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Robson Street and caters mainly to business travelers. The rooms were clean and comfortable and had nice views. We could walked to Stanley Park and the aquarium. There are a lot of shops and restaurants in the area. There are no laundry facilities in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mejolo_3
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, huge rooms,very very comfy beds, good value breakfast . Vancouver looked amazing, shame we only had an overnight stay in this City

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced, and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Electrostatic
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in a shopping district in downtown Vancouver. The rooms were clean and comfortable. When our a/c was broken and they quickly fixed it. The people in the front desk were very nice. They spa area was compact and small, but we had an enjoyable stay and would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: Kemax
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a centrally located hotel with nice bedrooms, helpful staff and a restaurant serving good quality food then this fits the bill perfectly. It's also reasonably priced. Our large bedroom was on the 8th floor, we didn't suffer from any street noise and found all the staff very helpful indeed, always willing to go out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Their breakfasts are delicious too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: LoriGuelph
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 were at the Blue Horizon for 5 days and it was a very positive experience. We had a recently renovated room on the 19th floor with wonderful views of the harbour and Robson street. The room was immaculate when we arrived and we received excellent cleaning throughout the vacation. The beds were also very comfortable and I am very picky when it comes to bed comfort! As mentioned, the bathroom was small but with lots of counter space and the room had a whole wall of closets which was awesome for a family of 4! The staff were very helpful whenever we had a question and check in and check out was smooth. They even provided us with a room at 11:00 a.m. when we arrived early. The pool is very small but clean and it was not busy so my kids enjoyed it. The hot tub and sauna are a nice addition. We never had an issue with the elevators and usually did not have to wait long for one. As also mentioned, the location for the price is very good and you are within easy walking distance of anything you need. Tons of great restaurants less than 5 mins away. Try the Mongolian Grill right across the street, it was great value and wonderful food! The only negative is the lack of Wfi and we did have trouble with our internet connection but it was a small annoyance next to all of the many positive things mentioned. We would highly recommend and would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldSparky
Reviews.Content: Large high rise hotel , with views of other high rise apartments and offices with glimpses of the parks and waterfront Very central location, walk out of the main door straight onto a busy shopping street in vancouver, close to everything and within 10mins walk to shore/docks we had a large corner suite , well equiped , soft robes, balcony and very clean request higher floor to avoid constant road noise, plenty of parking but charged, decent hotel but not the cheapest

Reviews.Title: “brilliant room on 25th floor”
Reviews.Author: Hazel_Mike
