Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Great large room with fabulous views of Robson Street and across bay. Very quiet with no noticeable city noise Breakfasts and one dinner in the hotel were good. Lovely place to finish off our visit to Canada. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “SAfety of elevators”
Reviews.Author: Mike5645
Reviews.Content: The location and rooms and service are satisfactory... However one occurrence shattered my positive impression, My colleague was stuck in an elevator for one hour until the maintenance team of the company that provides technical support for the hotel elevators arrived to rescue her. The sales manager of the hotel maintained that this is a rare occurrence and said this is the modus - operandi in Canada. Now we are scared to use the elevator in the 24 floors building.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, view and location”
Reviews.Author: Hildegull
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel! Location was as central as it could be, the room was large and the view beautiful in two directions from inside and from the rather large balcony (that all rooms have!). The drawback was that wifi was not wifi, but rather a fairly unstable cable connection. Restaurant was ok, but expensive, but from the location you could easily find another alternative for eating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: SpecialK01030
Reviews.Content: Had 2 king rooms on 23rd floor pre-cruise. Spacious rooms, spotlessly clean with small frig, work area and comfy chair. Large flat screen TV. We faced Coal Harbor (about a 3-block walk); buildings largely block the waterfront but we could see a little of Stanley Park/harbor, and the city view was fantastic. We found the king bed very comfortable. Small balcony - just enough to stand and gaze. Very little city noise at night. Towels were large and fluffy. Wired in-room Internet was fast and reliable. In-laws had ice machine outside their door (2308), which they actually liked but be warned; they're on floors 7, 16, 23, 26 and 29. Restaurant quality and service both good; we had breakfast there both mornings. Prices comparable to other places nearby. Very friendly staff. Shenanigans, the bar next door, sells beer, wine and hard cider for off-premise consumption until 11pm. Large liquor store in the next block, also a Scotia Bank with an ATM next door which is where we got Canadian cash. Loads of restaurants nearby. Vancouver Trolley picks up outside, as does a free shuttle to Grouse Mountain. Pool/jacuzzi area is tiny and smelled strongly of chlorine - that and the small, slow elevators are really the only negatives. This was a great hotel for the price, and the location is excellent for touring or pre/post cruise. We were very satisfied with the Blue Horizon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great views!”
Reviews.Author: zaranna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Vancouver for two nights and had a great time. Our room was huge and in really good condition. It had a lovely balcony (we were on the 20th floor) with amazing views of the city. The staff were polite and helpful and we would definitely stay here again - it's in a great location for town, shopping, sightseeing and going out in the evenings. The only small drawback was the size of the pool and gym. If you're desperate to work out, then they will do, but you're probably better off going for a run along the beautiful water front!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver008
Reviews.Content: Great location right on Robson Street, great shopping, restaurants, walked to Stanley Park, Pacific shopping centre, and harbour centre. Were upgraded to a higher level for standard price and pleasantly surprised with the great view of the city and Grouse Mountain. Queen beds are a great feature for a family of four, and the 300 sq.ft. rooms are very comfortable. Unfortunately they do charge for parking, and the pool is smaller than usual, but acceptable. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: ColinMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Got in to Vancouver at 6.15am and found my way to the Blue Horizon and they were immediately able to check me in which was a huge bonus considering how tired I was after my flight. Checked in and the rooms were nice and clean and had everything you could want. They stored my bags the next day while I was waiting for friends on our drive to Pemberton. 11am checkout was a bit early. Would have nice to have been 12pm but overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kunaldg
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon Hotel can probably be summed up in one line : Value for money. It is not a fancy hotel. But it is comfortable and has a great location - it is close to hundreds of restaurants and shops. We were living pretty high up and the view from our room was breathtaking. Would probably stay there if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be rated higher”
Reviews.Author: BJWca
Reviews.Content: 2nd time we've stayed here and both times we have been very pleased. Try to get a room on a higher floor, it's so very nice having a great view. Room was spacious, beds comfy, and price was decent. Location right on the busy Robson Street, but you can walk to anywhere on side streets (Stanley Park, Granville Island, Coal Harbor, etc). ALL employees are very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: HayleyAnn88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Blue Horizon for four nights in June 2011. The location was ideal - right in the middle of everything, only about 15 minutes walk from Stanley Park. The room was lovely and very big - it had two double beds, no idea why. We had paid extra for a delux room which is on the top few floors and were on floor 26. I'm glad we did as the view was beautiful and the best part of the hotel. We could hear some slight road noise so if you stayed on one of the lower floors I imagine that might be a problem but didn't disturb us. One problem we did have was that the hotel didn't have wifi. Their website and the website that we booked from both advertised free internet connection and we assumed that this meant wifi as with the vast majority of hotels these days. When we got there and explained that we needed wifi for work reasons we were merely told they didn't have wifi and to go to a coffee place. I later learnt that there was a computer for guest use in the lobby which you had to pay to use and given that it was important to us I thought they could have offered to allow us to use this for free occasionally. That would have made our stay much easier and made us far more satisfied for little cost to them. That said the room was lovely and clean and the majority of staff were friendly. I would just be sure not to book if you require wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cymro33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to a cruise to Alaska. Hotel is in avery good location on Robson street and within walking distance of all the shops and other attractions of central Vancouver. Our room was huge and on the 16th. floor which provided excellent views of the city. The staff were all extremely helpful and the meals in the hotel were excellent. Beds were very big and extremely comfortable, rooms also provided very comfy dressing gowns. Transfer to Canada Place for the cruise ships was very easy by taxi and cost 10 dollars incl. tip for a taxi from outside the hotel to a drop off inside Canada Place right next to the ship luggage handlers, couldn't be easier, Would definetely recommend this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no wifi !”
Reviews.Author: KMM14a
Reviews.Content: Good location, good size rooms , comfortable beds. Decor fine despite other posted comments . Would recommend. Shame about no wifi

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiner721
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, but we were very happy with this hotel. It was very clean & the staff helpful & friendly. The rooms were roomy & up to date. We ate breakfast at the restaurant. The service & food was good. It is in a great location with walking distance to many shops, restaurants, & Stanley Park. We will look into staying here again whenever we will return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dancinrainbow
Reviews.Content: My companion and I just returned from Vancouver. We stayed at the Blue Horizon Hotel and really enjoyed it. The room was located on the back corner, 21st floor, allowing a glimse of the water from both the room and private balcony. The room was very clean, quite and has a safe in the closet. I was not disappointed, this is coming from a person who is VERYparticular. We were in town the week the Vancouver Canucks beat Boston. There was unbelievable, fun-hearted celebrations in the streets and all around us. You can't beat the price for the location of this hotel. You are in the heart of downtown and you can actually walk to Stanley park. Vancouver is an expensive city for tourist, many of the attractions are quite pricey. Tip: If you wish to visit Vancouver from Seattle and not drive. I highly recommend "Quick Shuttle" charter bus service. They are affordable, convenient, clean and the drivers are very friendly. They drop you off at your hotel and pick you up there. Can't beat it! We boarded the bus at the Seattle airport.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price but no frills”
Reviews.Author: smac5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Blue Horizon. This is actually our second visit to this hotel. We visited last summer with our son and were upgraded from a 2 queen bed room to a family suite which was awesome. This time we had a regular room with a king bed. This is a very nice, centrally located hotel. It is right on Robson Street downtown Vancouver. It is very reasonably priced for the area that it is in. We are from British Columbia, so we had our car, but you can walk to many great shopping areas and Stanley Park very easily. We also noticed there are free shuttle buses that stop in front of the hotel that will take you to various attractions. Capilano Suspension Bridge, and Grouse Mountain were two that we saw. If you do have a vehicle, parking is both underground or above ground right on site for 15$ per day. It seems to be a safe area, and there is a security guard in the parking area during the day... not sure about the night. There was no valet service and you can come and go as you please. I would recommend requesting an upper floor as this is a downtown area and is very busy and bustling. We were on the 28th floor and it was fairly quiet, but you do still hear traffic noise. The hotel itself was very quiet. It is not a fancy upscale hotel, but it is kept spotlessly clean. There was no wireless internet in our room, we had to plug into an ethernet connection. The internet was a bit sketchy, had a few problems getting online a couple of times, but it did work. The only other complaint I had was the fitness room is small. One treadmill, one elliptical and one exercise bike. The machines are in the same room as the lap pool, so it is VERY hot while exercising. This is a very nice place to stay if you want to be in the heart of the action, and don't expect fancy decor. One other tip I can offer is you may wish to bring your own shampoo and conditioner . There is a body gel/ shampoo dispenser in the shower but no separate bottles of shampoo. There are bottles of body lotion, hairdryer, and bathrobes in the room. Also a coffee maker. We bought our own instant coffee from Starbucks as we find hotel coffee is usually nasty. If you are planning a trip to downtown Vancouver, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in central Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Safad0
Reviews.Content: We stayed herd for tree nights on the first leg if our holiday to Canada in June. We choose the hotel based on location and the reviews on trip advisor and where not dissapointed. The location of the hotel was excellent. Located about 10mins walk from Stanley Park, right on Robson Street, which is the main shopping street in downtown Vancouver. Although very central, our room on the 23rd floor was very quiet. The room we had was huge, although for the size if the room the bathroom was quiet small. We had breakfast in the hotel one day, which cost around $10 each, which was average price in downtown. We used the parking lot on our last night, which cost us $15 dollars (fairly expensive). Staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful when we had a few questions about directions and bus routes etc. All in all a good stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored, great locale, incredibly unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mpmalone
Reviews.Content: Great location and beautiful rooms with a view. Every room is a corner room, so each one has huge windows with wonderful 270 degree views, and a balcony. Right in the heart of the shopping district, with tons to do within walking distance. Just restored and rooms are HUGE and pretty. Parking is easy. Only problem was the staff. All but one of them seemed to have next to no knowledge of the city, or at least if they did, they certainly didn't want to share it with us. I often look to hotel staff for recommendations, but they had none. Thought Canadians were nicer than this...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Upgraded Room”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel on Robson street near all of the shopping & night scene on Davie street. They upgraded me to a King Room which was on a higher floor. The only problem was with the Air cond & Heating for the first couple of nights it did not work. They did fix it but the Heat never got very warm. The room however was very large and had nice views of Robson Street & Downtown. It did rain a lot when I was there so a nice bed was welcoming. All in all I may stay there again. However I like to try different hotels and Vancouver has some others that I am curious about. It was however very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring the city, good stay despite odd check in experience”
Reviews.Author: HazeAus
Reviews.Content: As others have said the location of the hotel is great. Very walkable to Stanley Park and as an added bonus is right opposite to Hon's Wun Tun House (think potstickers and noodles galore) amongst other good food places. The hotel, with its excellent rooms, was the best value I could find for the several rooms my party needed last June. The only sour note we had was with the check in itself - the front desk manager demurred and repeatedly queried the scanned and reprinted (to 2-a-page format, since we had several rooms) hotel booking emails we presented, even suggesting outright that we might have typed the quoted pricing in them ourselves. The suggestion however was rather absurd as by then the hotel's system itself was showing lower prices for our rooms than we had in our printouts from months before. We didn't appreciate the condescending treatment and the attendant delays by this one manager, but thankfully all the other staff (including another abashed front desk staff at the time) we'd encountered were friendly and pleasant. For example, as soon as we made it to our rooms, a passing maid who overheard our conversations very helpfully pointed out good places to grab dinner that night. Despite the bizarre initial experience, overall I'd recommend this place for a good value, pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: Redizzywizz
Reviews.Content: Blue Horizon is a typical city hotel, it offers a great central location and if you want to take the Trolly tour it stops right outside. The breakfast was good and reasonable and sidewalk cafe is a nice place for a coffee. The rooms were clean and spacious, so a good place to choose for time in the city. There is parking onsite but you have to pay around $20 per day, so make sure you keep this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, quiet, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: actempe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several nights after a cruise to Alaska. The rooms are very spacious with windows on two sides, and a shallow balcony. Rooms on the higher floors must have spectacular views. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful; the bed was wonderful; the room was very quiet, despite the central location in a bustling neighborhood; rooms facing the street, in the front, might be more subject to street noise; our room faced northwest. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Service at the put next door, Flannigans (?), was extremely slow; service in the lobby restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fudgebucket
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very comfortable place to stay with a fantastic view of the city lights. It is close to shopping and restaurants. You can walk to the Sky Train station to visit other areas of the city. City bus stops right at front door if you prefer to travel by bus. The Inlets restaurant located in hotel had very good food at a reasonable price. The room furnished soft comfy robes to wear and a large flat screen t.v. I look forward to returning to this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant hotel if you don`t mind heights!”
Reviews.Author: dipsygreencat
Reviews.Content: I was with a group and the hotel is a sky scaper. I was on the 24th floor. Hudge big room with a double bed just for me. Tea and cofee facilities. Large balcony and can see a lot of Vacouver from there.Restarunt is resonable when it is open. Lot`s of other restraunts and cafes near by. Shopping right outside the hotel and many shops just a short sistance away.

Reviews.Title: “Night of luxury for reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: gde2032
Reviews.Content: This was our night of luxury on a budget holiday and didn't disappoint. Got rooms on the 22nd floor with excellent views of the mountains, downtown and ships. Underground car park on site which was available to us until 3pm allowing us to leave car after check out to explore downtown. Very good sized rooms, quality finishes (nice curtains for those of you who like that sort of thing). With the poor exchange rate we paid c£100 for the night which seemed pricey, however when compared to others of similar rating it's about average. One of only two hotels that didn't provide complimentary continental breakfast (the two most expensive!). The only small downside was that the lady on reception wasn't dressed smartly, didn't match the quality/price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best combination of location and price”
Reviews.Author: figlia79
Reviews.Content: I first booked this hotel when trying to keep costs down for a work trip to Vancouver, and it was a very good decision indeed! The hotel itself is right on Robson St, so it's literally in the heart of the city making it easy to get to the convention centre, train station or anywhere in the centre on foot, plus there are bus stops all along the road to take you to places further away. The room itself was large, clean and well-maintained and had good tea/coffee facilities in the room. While there is a restaurant in the hotel, I only used this for breakfast (tasty)although there is a REALLY good cafe just across the road which does great fresh pastries, coffees, juices and sandwiches etc. This is built as a sort of skyscraper so you don't have access to endless communal facilities, but free internet was a plus. I thought this was great for finding somewhere safe, modern, clean and central to sleep, and still being in the heart of all the action. I have been to this hotel twice and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient choice in Vancouver + great views from balcony”
Reviews.Author: JPIowa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located on Robson St, about a 10 min walk from a train station that can take you to/from YVR airport. It was a about a 15 min walk to the Vancouver Convention Center. The hotel is a skyscraper with only eight rooms per floor. Each room has a balcony and you can get great views of the city from them. The hotel and room were clean and overall quiet (it depends on who your nextdoor neighbors are). It had free Internet; the ethernet connection worked fairly well (they provide a cable), not so the wifi. The room had a flat screen TV and a coffee maker + free coffee. All the furniture and other appliances were in good working order and good shape. I didn't get to interact much with the front desk but they were nice and helpful when I spoke with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Get location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: TereseW
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of our friends and family that went on a cruise together and the last stop was Vancover so we decided to spend an extra 2 days there. We stayed on the 17th floor with a beautiful view of the city. The rooms are hugh and the bed and pillows were so comfortable. You get a small frig, coffee, iron, blow dryer and a safe. The only weird thing we had in the room is the TV was on a small dresser and we didn't realize if the drawer wasn't left about a half an inch open the TV would go out. The location of the hotel is fabulous you are right in the middle of everything from great shopping to restaurants. The best restaurant we ate at was right in the hotel. Also tour buses stop right in front of the hotel. I would definitely stay there again. Some of the staff at the front desk were very nice but a few didn't seem to know much about the city or even when the restaurant opened in the morning when we asked but it was just a minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best around”
Reviews.Author: GCHHawaii
Reviews.Content: Our 5th visit in about as many years still shows this hotel as the best all around. Perfectly located within walking distance of virtually everything worth seeing, shopping and dining. (Including a huge new liquor store now just around the corner. Some people at the hotel deserve special mentioning as they do make your stay as enjoyable as possible: The General Manager, Dannette Kynoch, runs a great show from the professional reception, even with some men (some smiles could make it perfect) to the large, clean, airy rooms, almost suites. Dee Montero, the Reservations Coordinator, who has done a great job over all those years to get us the room we like best to Loretta, the Maid, who greeted us by saying, "I missed you last year." And the year before she remembered us even with the room we had stayed in. Wow. A great staff. A sign of a well-run operation. The only suggestion: The entrance hall would benefit from some re-doing. Can highly recommend the hotel. Will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and rather old-smelling hotel”
Reviews.Author: bazandbabs24
Reviews.Content: Very big rooms with balcony and OK views. However, hotel seriously needs updating - corridors are from the 1970s and there is an odd smell throughout the place that you can't describe. Rooms are comfortable although we were woken up early one day with very noisy demolition works going on next door. The internet was not easy to work so gave up and had to use nearby Starbucks

Reviews.Title: “great reno's,great views,great service!”
Reviews.Author: sabresgirl2
Reviews.Content: have stayed here on many trips,am really impressed by all the recent updates.new windows,carpets and wall treatments really make this beautiful older hotel look completely updated.as usual the service is excellent and robson street is the heart of vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and clean hotel for a short break away!”
Reviews.Author: glg2580
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is going through a refurbishment at the moment. We were lucky enough to stay in one of the newly refurbished rooms, which are well appointed with fridge, tea and coffee makers, flat-screen TV and balcony. I must say the hotel was very nice and conveniently located to explore the whole city! I would recommend this hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and spacious. I would definitely stay here again, and for the price and location I would recommend this! the only slight downside to this hotel is that the sauna/jacuzzi, which are slightly tired.... I assume will be refurbished along with the remainder of the rooms and that during the renovation (hence 4 stars rather than the 5 i believe this hotel is worthy of). Expect some slight workman noises which stirred my sleep around the 9am mark... but then... if your not as lazy as me.... it wont be a problem at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely one night stay”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireladBradford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night which was unplanned. We had looked at the prices on line for hotels in the centre of Vancouver and this 1 seemed reasonable for the location. We didnt book on line, as we wanted to see it first hand. We were walk-ins and they asked us what rate we had seen it at, and that they would match it. The price we saw was for a basic, low level room. We decided to upgrade from that room, though we didnt see it. The room we were allocated was newly upgraded and very spacious, with fantastic views over the city on the 31 floor. This hotel would be the perfect base for a city break. The location is spot on for downtown and its easy to explore the rest of the city on foot from here. There is also a lap pool(small), hot tub and sauna, though they all appear a bit dated. A really enjoyable stay, though i think breakfast could be included for the price we paid. It was elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: magster50
Reviews.Content: A very central hotel on Robson St. And the food in the restaurant was REALLY good. We could not get hockey tickets, so we watched the game from the restaurant-bar TV. Quieter and more pleasant than the big bar next door. Check-in was speedy and easy. No frills hotel. No concierge, no bell-boys. We had a 25th floor corner room and a view to English Bay on one side and Vancouver harbour on the other. Not too shabby! A balcony with sliding doors and lots of fresh air. Our only complaint was that the dead bolt lock on our door did not work. We complained, but it was not remedied. The door locked okay, but not bolted.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: kris621
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, and the price couldn't be beat. Yes, the rooms are a bit dated, but we were smack dab in the middle of everything. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, the breakfast downstairs was great with fantastic service. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Obrigs
Reviews.Content: Great location and the price was very good for this downtown spot. Nice and friendly staff, had a great view room. Even the housekeepers were all smiles . Check in and checkout process was easy and fast which is what I always like. I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a prime Robson Street Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Miramichiriver
Reviews.Content: I have been a frequent guest at this hotel since the 1990's. Some of the comments say that it is out dated, but for the price it would be difficult to find a hotel in such a prime location with patio doors that open to a balcony, views of English Bay from floors above #12, a decent restaurant with EXCELLENT service and food at reasonable prices and it is so clean! As for out-dated, the hotel is currently undergoing major renovations to all guest rooms. I stayed at the Westin Bayshore for a conference last week and the room that cost me more than twice as much was half the size of the one I am now in at BH. The conference facilities on the 31st have a world-class view that would be hard to beat. So many excellent restaurants, great shopping and about a 15 minute walk to English Bay and a terrific beach walk make this hotel one of my favourites in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennibenni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Locations was great, so close to everything, and it also had parking. Room was big, bathroom had everything that was needed, bed was comfy. I had read on here people saying that the outside noise could be heard, and we found that it could, but for a hotel in the middle of downtown we are not shocked by this. We had a good stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: ManuChau
Reviews.Content: Location, location is what would bring me back to this hotel. Very comfortable and price is unbeateable for the $$$$ standards of Vancouver. I was accomodated in a very nice room with a great view!! Common areas are small but who needs them when you have Vancouver as your playground? Do not expect luxury details, very modest environment and decor, yet clean and well mantained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Street Noise”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that appears created from am apartment building many years ago. This is a basic hotel, with a restaurant and bar area and not much else. We stayed 4 nights, booked direct on the hotel website without any discount. Room was large, has a coffee machine with cheap filter packs that when brewed were undrinkable - slop really. Tea kettle provided but no tea bags. No bar bridge. Large room safe that worked well. Small bathroom. Beds were comfortable, linens of a good quality as were pillows and we might have slept well were it not the noise from the street and groups of drunks leaving bars at 2am- shouting and screaming (we were on the 9th floor) facing Robson. Windows are 1 pane - and noise goes right through. We would stay elsewhere next trip to have more amenities and ensure our room is soundproof. There is no wi-fi (free or paid) and rooms have a cable for ethernet only - a real inconvenience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bameshi
Reviews.Content: We liked it! It is close to the water front and shops. Nice staff, not BAD rooms, big but out dated!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great view, questionable sleep”
Reviews.Author: Winesoakedjourney
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious with rooms situated on corners of the building. Each room has two walls of windows and a balcony, which gives a great view. Recently updated, there are a few details that gives flashbacks to the original design. (For example, the pink tub) Still, it is clean and more than adequate in functionality. The beds are firm, but the pillows are soft, which for me resulted in poor sleeping and a stiff neck. Throughout the night I was woken up by screaming public, even though I was 15 floors up. I am not a light sleeper, but the noise was enough to disrupt my sleep. The location is central and pricing good, but the lack of sleep quality was critical for me. Hotels where others stayed seemed to fare better. Also, internet was only through plug-in (free) and there were some problems with service during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, helpful & friendly staff, not for the noise intolerant”
Reviews.Author: TonyL_Brisbane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location on Robson Street in the heart of Vancouver, the staff always gave us great tips and advice on where to eat or how to get around, the rooms were super spacious (the biggest we had on our entire trip!) and the beds very, very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a central location. The main advice I would give other travelers (as I am very noise intolerant) would be that the constant traffic noise/sirens/rooftop extractor fans from surrounding buildings were a real issue for me at night when trying to sleep (the glass on the windows and balcony door is single pane, so they don't block any noise whatsoever). The other was the heating and cooling system which required the constant switching on and off of the fan heater during the night (it was also very loud). If you can handle the noise issues, then this hotel represents great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: chrisbhall
Reviews.Content: This is a *slightly* older hotel (built in the 1960s but certainly updated sometime since then) but it is well kept up and very clean. The room was huge and had great views of the city. The location was convenient to shopping and other activities. We stayed for 5 nights and were extremely satisfied at the quality in relation to the lower cost (around $100/night). The staff were very helpful when asked for tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location!”
Reviews.Author: MsPollyC
Reviews.Content: This is a high-rise and getting an upper floor is especially nice. We got the top floor (30th) and a corner room, which meant a view from two sides. We had a balcony with a fabulous view of the city and the harbour. Our room was quite nice, large and comfortable with a large flat-screen tv. The beds were very comfortable. They have an indoor pool and whirlpool, which was nice after lots of walking. AND they provided soft, comfy robes for going to the pool floor! We were also impressed with their energy efficieny--when you opened the sliding door to the balcony, the heat and ac would turn off. They also followed through on leaving our towels alone if we didn't need them washed every day. There was a restaurant and bar on the lobby level, but we didn't use them. The location was on the West End, close to Downtown and right on Robson Street--great street for shopping and restaurants. We walked everywhere from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointing service at the end of an already long day.”
Reviews.Author: Jtru
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are quite large, I must say I did not experience the same level of service other travelers have attested to. I called earlier in the day to check rates and was told $99, and that there was plenty of availability. Since I was checking in same day, the lady recommended that I NOT reserve a room in case I had to cancel for any reason. When I arrived I was first told there were no rooms available by the front desk clerk, Jason. Then I was told, there was a room, but for $120/night. When I explained my earlier conversation, a room for the rate listed earlier "magically" appeared on his screen and he checked me in. Then, after taking my card, he tells me I needed to put down a $200 deposit. Since it was already midnight by this time, I didn't argue, but I have NEVER been asked to front money for a deposit. I am a 30-something business traveler, not a 20 year old partier!!! I will triple check my bill to ensure I was not charged extra, but I cannot express how disappointing this experience was after reading all the other great reviews. It's a shame, and I will definitely not return to this establishment during any of my frequent business trips back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: jent103
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blue Horizon for four nights during a conference at the Vancouver convention center. All the "official" conference hotels were in the neighborhood of $300, but I found the Blue Horizon for under $200/night. The hotel was an easy ten-minute walk to the convention center, and right in the middle of Robson Street. As a woman traveling alone, I wanted to be in the middle of things so as not to be walking alone on empty streets at night, and this was perfect. At least one bus route stops very close to the hotel (very possibly more), and the metro line is about a 5- or 10-minute walk. The hotel staff was great. My airline lost a poster I was scheduled to present at the conference, but when it was finally found, the front desk staff was great about accepting it for me (I went to Victoria first, so was not at the hotel to receive it myself). The room had two double beds, a bathroom with full bathtub, a flat screen TV with good channel selection, a desk and a great view of the harbor. There was free internet, though it was wired, not wifi. My only complaint is the decor; it seems like the hotel was decorated in about 1992 and has not been redone - blue wallpaper, pink bathtub, old flyers in the elevator, etc. However, if that is indeed the case, the decor is definitely not as bad as it could have been, and for me this was a minor consideration. I would absolutely recommend this for business travelers or vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great value”
Reviews.Author: Sagebrush
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Blue Horizon in about a year. This time I travelled with my family. This is not a new property but the rooms are roomy with lots of windows. The views are great and it represents very good value for downtown Vancouver. Wireless internet would be nice, but the wired internet worked fine. It's tough to beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “really good choice”
Reviews.Author: 2_auf_reisen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the city of Vancouver at one of the main shooping streets. The house can be reached easily by bus. Choose a room above level 15 and you will earn the moste wonderful view of the city. A bike rental is around the corner (the perfect way for exploring the city). Breakfast at the hotel is good, but there are some other nice places next to the hotel too (try the Asian snack restaurant Donburi Ya just a few meters north on Robson Street). The Blue Horizon offers free use of the spa and fitness facilities, unfortunately we had no time to use it. Vancouver is a beautiful city and this hotel is the perfect base!

Reviews.Title: “good value but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: CMM-LA
Reviews.Content: This would be a great hotel for a casual weekend trip to Vancouver if you are on a bit of a budget but want to stay in a central location. It's not the best hotel if you are looking for something special or are entertaining clients on a business trip. Pros: 1) Extremely clean 2) large rooms 3) friendly helpful staff 4) reasonably central location although not very near to the main train stations 5) view from many rooms 6) entirely non smoking (even on balconies) 7) balconies 8) comfortable beds 9) very easy to get a taxi or a sight seeing bus from right out front, also can walk many places Cons: 1) this hotel is basically an old run down hotel that got a very cheap facelift, and it shows it in a very strong way 2) no amenities- the pool is pretty sad, there is no wifi even in lobby, the bath items are as utilitarian as it gets (a big shampoo dispenser in the shower, one bar of soap and a tube of lotion), no mini bar or similar type of additions to room, no morning paper, no express checkout, no water or mini bar available 3) thumping nightclub somewhere near hotel permeated the 30 year old (not sound resistant) windows even on the 8th floor and kept me up until 2AM Friday and Saturday even with earplugs. 4) very disappointing bar/cafe attached to the property. Skip it and go elsewhere in the area where you will get better service and better choices I would stay here again if it were just I and my husband or a friend looking to enjoy Vancouver for a weekend. Not recommended for business travel or a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: PRC0809
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon on Robson Street for 2 nights over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel is located at the beginning of the the shopping district on Robson street about a 15 minute walk from Stanley Park and 10 minutes from the Olympic torch. The hotel staff was very efficient and courteous. Our room was a king size room on the 22nd floor facing the mountains, the view was mostly blocked by buildings but still nice. The room had been mostly updated (except for the old bathtub - which was still very nice) and was very clean and well layed out. The pool/hot tub/sauna area were older but still ok, the pool is more of a lap pool than a "play" pool. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and it's location and would defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done”
Reviews.Author: thatkatcal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way to visiting family. Had a room on the 25th floor with a balcony and a lovely view. The hotel is well located although we could not get shuttle service after 8 AM to take us to the ferry dock to head to Sydney - we had to walk 6 blocks to catch the light rail train. I thought the room was spacious for a downtown hotel, nicely decorated and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. For the price, I thought it was a good value. Lots of restaurants and shopping around the hotel. We walked to Stanley Park from there.

Reviews.Title: “High-rise hotel, excellent location in the city.”
Reviews.Author: 9999DotJPG
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Blue Horizon around 1:30 p.m. and were able to check in right away to our room on the 22nd floor. The room was large and the beds were comfortable. The room had a coffee maker and also a small fridge which was convenient. There was balcony where we could see a glimpse of the harbor and some other high-rise buildings nearby. Despite being a 100% non-smoking hotel, the room had a hint of leftover cigarette smoke smell but it was not overpowering. The only other con was that we would have liked Wi-Fi since we had portable devices that did not have an ethernet plug. We were able to use Wi-Fi at several of the nearby restaurants so it was not really a problem. The lively neighborhood has a variety of restaurants and shops and it was a short walk to Stanley Park. There are many transportation options including bus, trolley, boat, and skytrain but we chose to walk to Yaletown for supper and to Chinatown for sightseeing the next day. After we checked out, the hotel stored our bags for us until we were ready to leave town. For the price and location we were very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Allburn
Reviews.Content: Cannot find fault with this hotel perfect location for getting around the city and the rooms are spacious with really comfortable beds. All corner rooms so you have brilliant views from your windows and balcony of either the city or English Bay. We ate breakfast here several times too and think this hotel is excellent value for money. The staff were also very helpful and there is a car hire business just along the road called Riz rentals where we got a very good deal and he drove us back to the airport for our return flight no charge.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cmiller387
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the weekend at the Blue Horizon in Vancouver and loved it! The room was very large, nicely appointed and very clean. We were on the 29th floor and the views were amazing. The staff was very nice and helpful, the restaurant in the hotel was super - one of our best meals was the salmon one evening. The location was great, shopping, touring, and eating! We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a do-over. Roomy with great views.”
Reviews.Author: MarkTatham
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious and the service was professional and efficient. The restaurant at the hotel has a really good breakfast and the staff were freindly. The internet service at the hotel is via ethernet cable which didn't work well for my iPad. WiFi would have been very nice. In terms of accomodation it was perfect tho. Great location and I would not hesitate to stay there again when I am in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at great location!”
Reviews.Author: mafo_1011
Reviews.Content: Blue Horizon is a fantastic hotel: rooms are very spacious, all have balconies with great views and the hotel's location is perfect: around the hotel there are many dining options and the nearest sky train station is only about 3 minutes away too! The entire downtown section can easily be explored by foot starting from the central location of Blue Horizon hotel. Oh n last but not least I think this hotel is an excellent value for its price. If I ever return to Vancouver then surely this is going to be the place where I will stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, spacious and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: I found Blue Horizon on Trip Advisor and was impressed with some of the comments, so decided to give it a go and was not dissapointed at all. The service at the front desk was fine, although there were a few people checking in at the same time as us, but this did not faze us at all and they apologised for taking so long. The rooms are so spacious and the views from our room over Robson St were fantastic. I would definately stay here again as this is perfectly located. We had a tour on the Hop On Hop Off bus and this was located right at the front entrance, which was fantastic. Loved Blue Horizon so thank you to all the staff and if we ever come back to Vancouver, would definately have no hesitation in staying here again

Reviews.Title: “I was recommened it by a friend and a very good recommendation it was too”
Reviews.Author: Neil-from-Nottingham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blue Horizon for 3 nights (18, 19 & 20 September 2010). It was recommended to me by a Canadian friend who had stayed there before. I can't complain about her choice. It was a really nice hotel. I booked it through Hotels.com and paid for a superior room which meant I was on the 21st floor and the view from the balcony was amazing. As a single traveller I had loads of space. The safe in the wardrobe was great peace of mind to keep my laptop, passport and valueables. Free cabled internet connection was great and was quite speedy too. I had read on Trip Advisor that peole had complained about noise from the street below but that worry was put the rest once I got there. Yes, there was a bit of noise from the street below but only when the balcony door was open, and besides the hotel is located in the heart of downtown on Robson Street so how people can't expect to have some street noise is just not thinking sensibly. The location was perfect for exploring the city. The SkyTrain station (to get the train to and from the airport) was only 5 blocks away which is walkable but I had loads of luggage so got a cab and it was only $8! I would recommend renting a bike to explore Stanley Park - there is a rental shop just a few blocks away from the hotel too. Cycling round the entire sea wall was an amazing way to spend 5 hours. There is also a free shuttle bus from the hotel to Capilano Suspension Bridge which I would recommend as another trip out. I ate at the hotel restaurant only once and the food was very good quality and reasonable priced. Plenty of places to eat surrounding the hotel and a convenience store (London Drugs) the next block over if you want some snacks/drinks/fruit etc for your room. I made use of the coffee filter machine in the room each morning which was nice. The reception staff where very friendly and welcoming from the moment I checked in, and helping with any questiions I had about where to go and how to get there. If I stay in Vancouver again - and I hope to sometime - I will be staying at the Blue Horizon for sure :-)).

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: GDRODER
Reviews.Content: The room hotel was clean. Everything worked. The beds were clean and soft. The TV was large with cable-vision included. Nothing amazing stood out. Nothing bad that didn't get resolved happened either. The price was average for what was given. Not a great deal, but not really over priced. Your really paying for the location if not anything else. I was given the 30th floor. Got to see the harbor. They only have wired internet, not wireless. I assume it is due to the size and age of the building. It would take a lot to put wireless all threw-out. It was the type of wired internet that goes threw the electrical plugs. I knew this existed, but never really seen it used until now. To clarify some of the earlier conceptions on here. It is not all corner rooms, or 4 rooms to a floor. There are 8 rooms to a floor from what I seen and could tell. So 4 corner rooms and 1 room between each corner room. A few bus loads of tourists came threw the hotel. So I assume this hotel is on a tour bus route.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for my first time in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BigBoyAntioch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends on our first visit to Vancouver and I'm glad we made this our stop. We stayed for 2 nights, but we wanted to stay for 4. The view of greater Vancouver from the balcony is sublime. The rooms were large, spacious, clean, and accommodating. The adjacent shopping and restaurants make its location invaluable. This is the only place I have stayed at in Vancouver and I'll be back next year for 4 nights instead of 2.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: viv033
Reviews.Content: Situated in down town Vancouver..room well furnished,clean. Recommend to anyone.Stanley Park and Gas Town well worth a visit. Found Canada on the whole quite an expensive city. Wish they would tell you on booking that you have to have $100 c.c deposit even though we where paying our bill in cash.Just hope my cc has been refunded...watch this space!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccomended!”
Reviews.Author: hotpink_flipflop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the labour day long weekend, have only positive things to say ! We upgraded to the rooms on the upper floors so we would ahve a great view, which only cost about 10$ extra per night. 2 of the 4 walls were mostly windows, and you have a gorgeous view of the water as well as downtown and robson street ! We had just the basic room on the upper levels, and it was still quite spacious and roomy. Hotel is clean and well kept, rooms were your average hotel room. The pool/extercise area was very small and outdated, we didnt use it but went to take a look. This hotel is very conviently located close to every amenity. I am a huge shopper, and I found it awesome i could go shopping on robson street, go up to my room and drop off some bags, and continue on my spree ! It was also very close to many resturaunts (we tried earls on the roof across from the hotel) as well as starbucks, tim hortons, etc. If you are a tourist this hotel is also convience as the tourist trolley stops to pick people up here, which takes you to many sightseeing attractions such as the aquarium. The staff are very friendly, however our room wasnt cleaned until 6pm the first day, but housekeeping came and did our room very early the following day. The view from the hotel as well as the location were the best part of this hotel! I would highly reccomend it to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhotTraveler
Reviews.Content: its located right on Robson St. so there are a lot of things to do and see. The lobby/downstairs area is very small. This causes some problems when bus tours are checking in/out. The room we had was very nice, clean, and quiet. The on-site restaurant had good food that was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kms61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon on Robson Street, for 3 nights. Accommodation was of excellent standard. Very large rooms and beds extremely comfortable. Ate breakfast & lunch at their restaurant. Meals reasonably priced and food great. 10min Walk to Canada Place and Stanley Park and hotel staff very helpful & polite. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great price for under $200 in downtown Vancouver. Felt very safe walking around hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced... with cheap parking!”
Reviews.Author: essicaJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights during our ten-day honeymoon in BC, and we really loved it. We were on the 10th floor in a corner room and had a great view of Robson St and the mountains in the distance. The room was really spacious and very clean, and the service was great. We had a rental car and kept it in the hotel garage for $14 a day, but you don't really need a car since you can walk to everything! The hotel location really could not have been better, and it's considerably cheaper than other hotels in the area. There were a ridiculous number of restaurants on Robson St, Denman St, and Davie St that were all within a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Our favorite was Banana Leaf, a Malaysian restaurant on Denman St, which was also next to a great gelato place. It's a great city for people who love walking everywhere, and the hotel is in a perfect spot for exploring. If you walk to the end of Denman up past Davie St., there's a beach with a great view of the mountains (great sunset spot).If you take a right out of the hotel and walk down Robson St, it'll bring you to Stanley Park. If you'd rather not walk everywhere, the public transportation is very reliable, with buses stopping right at the hotel every five minutes for Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: MLewis_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon from September 2 to 8, through the Labour Day Weekend. The hotel is located on Robson Street, about six blocks from the harbour at Burrard Inlet and in the middle of a very good shopping district. There are easily a dozen small restauran, inexpensive restaurants within a block. Stanley Park is about a half mile away. In other words, the location is very good for walking around the city. The hotel has about 34 floors with 8 rooms per floor, each with its own small balcony. The rooms are very large with 2 twin beds, though there is room for 4 of them, I'm sure. There is a small restaurant on the ground floor. The staff are efficient, friendly, and helpful and the price is moderate.

Reviews.Title: “Value and location are good, but hotel only has basic amentities”
Reviews.Author: MckenziesHalifax
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and have most of the conveniences one would need. Our room on the 27th floor had a great view toward the water and Stanley Park; however, parts of the room had been updated whereas others had not. For example in the bathroom there was a new corian-type counter top and vessel sink, but a old pink bath tub. I would recommend this hotel for those who want a budget friendly hotel in a fabulous location. I trusted the reviews on this site, but was disappointed when I got there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect, in the middle of evereything!”
Reviews.Author: mwissmann
Reviews.Content: great place to stay, 2nd time, a few blocks to the shopping district, and many restaurants nearby, the place has a great view, book the upper rooms, great view of English Bay. Reasonable Parking as well, very comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travellerb138
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from London and were very pleased with our accommodation at the Blue Horizon. We had a 6th floor room over looking Robson St and had some concern that it might be noisy - but the double glazing was very good - and it wasn't. The room was very large and windows on two sides excellent. We enjoyed the (small pool) in the early morning - waking up very early due to jet lag! We did not eat at the hotel - as there are so many excellent places nearby. Hotel excellent for all the sightseeing we did either on foot or by the local buses. We were joined by my sister and daughter after two days and their room was on the same floor and to the same standard. The lifts were very slow and had a mind of their own. Once we pressed the button for the 6th floor we where taken passed our destination and transported to the 21st floor ! We would recommend this to anyone who wants somewhere central to stay in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter4
Reviews.Content: The price is excellent considering the cost of other hotels in the area. The hotel is right near downtown and an easy walk to Stanley Park, the waterfront, Gastown and all the downtown amenities. The rooms are huge. Our room was on a corner and had windows facing two directions. The rooms almost gave the appearance that they might have once been bachelor apartments. The building clearly is not new, but everything was clean. Perhaps a bit of paint and touch up here and there would be in order, but nothing that was a problem. The pool is a small lap pool, not really meant for kids, but we all still had a swim as it was not busy. We had breakfast in the hotel resataurant which was fine - a bit pricy, but maybe any other breakfast in downtown Vancouver would have been the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great value is a great location, only wired internet”
Reviews.Author: Xman_7
Reviews.Content: This is pencil-like vertical hotel, at the edge of Vancouver downtown and near the West End and Stanley Park. The location is excellent. Our room was very large, and had big windows, nice views, and a tiny balcony. The beds were very comfortable, and we slept well. The room was well cleaned every day. This hotel was clearly built in the 60's. It has been mostly but not completely updated, in a style consistent with the original construction. The air conditioner was a bit loud and had a funky old (but perfectly functional) pneumatic thermostat. A stretch of heating baseboard was out of position, revealing a few pipes behind. The fan in the bathroom was also a bit loud. We had some problems getting the sink drain stopper to stay in place, but it was promptly fixed when we mentioned the issue. There was always plenty of hot water, at a consistent temperature, regardless of time of day. So overall I would say maintenance was fine with a few quibbles. We were staying for 10 nights and they gave us a room on the 24th floor, which I suspect reduces street noise considerably. The lower floors might be noisier. There are only 8 rooms per floor, which keeps corridor noise to a minimum. The elevators were very slow around 9:30 AM when people tend to check out; otherwise they were good. The pool is small but OK, and there is a jacuzzi (not the hottest, but fine). Internet is free, but is not wireless -- they provide a short ethernet cable and that is it. So, if you depend on an iPad or other wireless-only device you will be out of luck. They use a power-line based system, which is a bit slow, but frankly faster than I have experienced in some higher-priced hotels. Towards the start of our stay, there were a few hour-plus internet outages. Later on, outages seemed limited to a few seconds. Self-parking is available for a reasonable price. We tried the restaurant only once (for breakfast), and it was good. The exercise area is very small. The "business center" is a single PC and printer in the lobby for which they charge $3 for 10 or 15 minutes. Overall, you could easily pay $100 more per night in this area, and have an only marginally better experience, so I highly recommend this hotel if the facilities are sufficient for your needs.

Reviews.Title: “SILVER FISH”
Reviews.Author: indalac
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel ever. I had stayed at this hotel a few years back and had a great experience, but now.......to say the least it was horrific. I don't think i'll ever stay there again, acutally I know I'll never stay there again. I found silver fish in my bed, got moved to another room, it was filthy, urine all over the bathroom, garbage hadn't been removed from prev. guests, hair in the bed. We told the front desk, they did nothing at that time. We ended up sleeping in filth. The next day was no better, the manager was repeatley caught in lies, trying to cover up for the hotel. In my opinion I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Felt a bit cheated”
Reviews.Author: deltic
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon is a good city centre hotel, clean and comfortable with incredibly spacious rooms. We paid a premium for a room above the 15th floor expecting a great view of Vancouver, but all we could see was the nearby, surrounding taller hotels. Save your money if you're expecting a view and go for a lower floor at a cheaper price The shower here was superb - we'd just completed a long motorcycle tour of BC and Alberta and had stayed in quite a few hotels and guest houses, but this was by far the best shower. No breakfast included in the room price here but they do have a restaurant on the ground floor that serves a very good, reasonably priced breakfast on the ground. The location of the Blue Horizon is perfect for exploring "downtown" Vancouver. It's on Robson St, one of the main shopping thoroughfares so there are plenty of places to eat / drink here. It's also handy for walking to Coal Harbour and lots of other Vancouver attractions. We stayed here for four nights, and I'd booked the hotel because it stated that the price quoted included taxes - something to be aware of in BC as the HST tax can raise the price of goods / services dramatically. When we came to pay the bill on leaving, the invoice showed an additional HST tax. I commented to the (quite rude) reception clerk that the price included taxes. He then pointed me towards the small print which said that "additional taxes" could be charged. Aparently the taxes that were included are "Hotel Taxes", we still had to pay the HST which added a fair amount to the bill - far more than we''d budgeted for. For that reason alone I wouldn't ever stay at the Blue Horizon again, they should make it crystal clear just what taxes are and are not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Confirming the Other Good Reviews”
Reviews.Author: caromex13
Reviews.Content: Many others have detailed the reasons for their positive responses, and I'd like to second them. Location is great, and having a balcony for people-watching is an extra benefit (and I even had a seagull visit me, but he was probably looking for food--not human companionship). The electric kettle and Bigelow English Breakfast tea is a nice British-Canadian touch. Good front desk staff. Did not try restaurant or bar because there are too many really interesting international places nearby. When I return to Vancouver I plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in central location, view great from higher rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bucksen
Reviews.Content: Floor 28 had fantastic view over harbour. Rooms big and clean although could do with a toaster and sink in kitchen. Great location, centre of downtown. Public car park so not secure. Breakfast not included. Pool ok but shallow and indoors. Hot tub and sauna good but was not working on one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, great location, terrific price!”
Reviews.Author: greenrooms
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Blue Horizon Hotel in Vancouver before our cruise to Alaska. The hotel is centrally located in Vancouver right in the middle of the shopping district on Robson and not far from Canada Place or Stanley Park. We did walk from Canada Place one afternoon but took a cab the day of our cruise because of our luggage. The room that we had on the 25th floor faced east onto a side street and we later realized we wish we had requested a room facing west. This would have helped us see the fireworks on English Bay. The balcony was awesome (except for my husband who is afraid of heights). The room was not only bright and beautiful from the walls of windows and doors but also it was clean, comfortable and spacious. We were extremely pleased. We also went to the patio restaurant out front after a long day of sightseeing including a 6- mile bike trek in Stanley Park, a 4- mile walk to the water taxi, browsing through Granville Island (loved that), Gastown and Chinatown! We were exhausted and happy to be back at the Blue Horizon. We realized that we didn't have a shower curtain but when I called the front desk to let them know, there was a knock on our door within minutes to put it up. When we were checking out we noticed that several people were leaving their bags behind until their flight left. This is a really nice amenity from the hotel so people don't have to drag their luggage through town while sightseeing after checking out! Again, we would definitely stay here the next time we have the privilege of spending time in Vancouver !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and outstanding views”
Reviews.Author: Alex450212
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel three times in as many years and have not been disappointed. The higher rooms have outstanding views and rooms are spacious. Aircon, tea/coffee facilities, ethernet internet. Unpretentious restaurant but good value. Try to get a room on the Robson St side of the street for your first visit - views of English Bay and the mountains. Close to Stanley Park, shops and Skytrain. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view, HUGE room!”
Reviews.Author: mslamin
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled on a short trip with my sister to Vancouver. After reading reviews of the Blue Horizon Hotel, located on the trendy, busy Robson Street, we booked and were very, very happy with our choice. Initially, we were given a room on the third floor--where the view was the top of the parking garage--rather disappointing. But when my sister asked the front desk if we could have a better view, the staff accommodated us with alacrity. For an additional $10 nightly charge, we had an amazing 22nd floor room, overlooking the harbor. But the best part? The SPACE! Only one other time have I stayed in a larger room---and that was at a MUCH higher price! The two queen-sized beds--and the four fluffy pillows each--made our evening's rest a given. (I must admit that the bathroom was small, however.)The balcony afforded us spectacular photographs...and we were visited by an friendly seagull, who loved the nuts and seeds we gave him! Our only disappointment?? It was that we were not staying at the Blue Horizon--or Vancouver---longer than our three days!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views from upper floors, great staff”
Reviews.Author: GoPittPanthers
Reviews.Content: We passed through Vancouver twice, and stayed at the Blue Horizon both times. Both rooms were very clean, attractive, and functionally laid out. One of the best features was the view -- the building is one of the highest in the area, and the rooms have banks of windows and a balcony. We thought the 15th floor was nice, until we had one on the 26th floor during one of the special firework nights. Fantastic! The desk staff were wonderful. Very friendly, helpful, and efficient. The location was convenient -- about a 10 minute walk from the SkyTrain from the airport, and in the middle of the general downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: teechur
Reviews.Content: Large room, frig (no microwave), free wi-fi in room. No breakfast offered, but 2 cups of coffee offered in room (charge for extra coffees); however, there are 2 corner coffee shops very nearby and the hotel has it's own restaurant which offers all 3 meals. Robes were in rooms to use. There was a bank right next door and a money changing place across the street to convert American $ to Canadian $. The bed was comfy & lots of pillows available. However, the best thing about the Blue Horizon is its location. Very close to lots of things including the subway; plus one of the main tour busses (hop on/hop off) has a stop at this hotel. We had a room on the upper levels and the view from our private balcony was FANTASTIC...bays, ships, other high rises. We were very happy with our selection. (Even though their website is pretty lame, not user-friendly and I didn't get an email confirmation from them for 2 days from booking with my credit card.)

Reviews.Title: “seemed good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: janevdp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights before getting Rocky Mountaineer to Calgary. It was clean and bright and had big windows on 2 sides. We got upgraded to a bigger room. Could see bits of water and mountains through gaps in buildings. It was boiling hot, but AC worked well. It was a bit strange for us not getting breakfast thrown in, but we got fresh fruit and yoghurt from Capers ( the deli down the road) and kept it in the fridge. One of us nipped out for coffee and croissants in the mornings - most acceptable. We also got lovely salads from the deli a couple of evenings and had it in our room with a bottle of wine. The staff from thre restaurant were more than happy to lend us some plates and glasses etc. The room was spacious enough to chill out in of an evening. The fitness suite and swimming pool were a bit grim, but I had seen that on other reviews so wasn't dissappointed. Fortunately it was 30 degrees a couple of days so we went to the massive open air pool at second beach. Oh yes and the internet worked great - you had to plug it in - wire supplied.

Reviews.Title: “A highlight of the trip”
Reviews.Author: MTteacher
Reviews.Content: I thought the Blue Horizon hotel was wonderful for all the same reasons as others: amazing view (yes, you do have to have to pay more to be at floor 15 and above), great restaurant (Sebastian was a fabulous server), excellent front desk (very helpful and courteous), lovely room and bed. Parking was on site, although navigating the one way streets to get to the hotel was tricky for this rural girl.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: carriglio
Reviews.Content: Very confortable hotel in downtown vancouver at reasonable price Very spacious rooms with great view on the bay. I suggest highest floors due to the view Parking available just below reception.

Reviews.Title: “A great value, with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Danna_G4
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the value of our stay at the Blue Horizon. The rooms were nicely decorated, the beds quite comfortable, and it felt very clean and fairly spacious. The best thing was the gorgeous view of the skyline and the water from our corner room. An outstanding value in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, misleading advertising. Wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: ColHeightsChic
Reviews.Content: I am a bit perplexed by all the reviews stating what an amazing value this hotel is. I live in Washington, DC, where $150 gets you a much nicer room with far better amenities. First, the positive: The bed was very comfortable (a big plus), the room was spacious, the view was lovely. If you want to be in the middle of a Western shopping area, then it is well located. If you want a bit more character, head to Yaletown or other neighborhoods. Now, for the cons: The website advertises a fitness center, which is one of the reasons I chose this hotel. This is a gross overstatement. There are two, old treadmills and an old bike in the corner of the swimming area, where it is humid and stinks of chlorine. It was absolutely not conducive to working out, and four different front desk employees all admitted they would never claim their hotel has a fitness center. BUT, nobody offered me any compensation for this misleading advertising, and the hotel manager even defended this ridiculous excuse of a "fitness center". Noise: This is not the hotel's fault, necessarily, but the hotel was very noisy. I was on the 30th floor and was still constantly woken up by sirens. I live in DC, but I have NEVER heard police sirens that loud! The walls are also paper thin, so be prepared to hear every word your neighbor says. One more thing that I think is misleading: these are not all "corner rooms". Yes, the rooms jut out a few feet so you have a view from two sides. But "all corner rooms" implies only four rooms per floor. I was right in the middle of the hall, not in the corner at all. In a nutshell: this hotel is fine if you are not a light sleeper and are looking for a centrally located place with no frills. But there is nothing special about it, and the website exaggerates the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellersBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, the room was very spacious, with 2 queen beds, we had a room on the 25th flr which had a lovely view, but had to go onto the balcony to really see sunset beach. Rooms on the higher floors cost extra. Even on the 25th flr we could still hear very noisy cars and sirens. Location was great, easy to explore Vancouver. I felt the room didnt offer value for money, but not sure there were any better options. We hired bikes about 2 blocks down Robson st, away from the city and they were only $20 per day (new bikes including helmets & locks), the bike hire is at the back of an internet cafe. But we certainly enjoyed our stay at the Blue Horizon and in Vancouver eh!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: TLAM99
Reviews.Content: Blue Horizon is an excellent hotel for the value. We only paid $154 for one night. The room was very clean, with a 32 inch flat screen TV, refrigerator, and nice furniture. There is parking directly under the hotel. The location is excellent, as the hotel is right on Robson street near the main walking area. Directly across from the hotel are several nice eateries, including an Indian restaurant and a creperie that had great breakfasts. One can easily walk anywhere in DT Vancouver from the hotel, including the Art Gallery, Gas Town, Canada Place, and so on. I will definitely plan on staying here if I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great option on Robson!!”
Reviews.Author: PharmaNetBD
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Blue Horizon, and honestly it was a nice change. Usually stay at Westin or Marriott or Sheraton but htey were all well over $200/night...Blue Horizon came in at under 180$. Nothing really bad to say, all worked and was as mentioned on their website. Practical parking on site, plenty of food options in immediate area, great coffee places on the same block. If noise at night keeps you up, ask for a room facing away from Robson. Nice views, nocompliants on the service. Internet worked great. The only slight annoyance i had was that the elevators were a bit slow on occassion.....but hey, this is far from being a true problem. This is not a 5 star hotel, nor do they say they are, but it was more than adequate and acceptable. Will definitely stay there again. The jacuzzi in the fitness center was out of order, wanted to take a soak but this didnt really bug me too much.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dkent91326
Reviews.Content: We were there for two days at the end of an Alaska cruise. We, of course, stayed on the ship (not great), and stayed at the Anchorage Hilton for two days before the cruise. This was far better than either. We've stayed at many other hotels over the years, as well. This tops them. Vancouver is expensive no matter where you stay, but this was not the priciest of the bunch and we were both very pleased with it. When you make a reservation there be sure to ask for a high floor with a view of English Bay. That makes it all worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Vonrich
Reviews.Content: PROS: Large, tastefully-appointed room with huge, comfortable king bed, wide-screen tv, small patio. Rooms on opposite side from street have a nice view of mountains and harbor if you're high enough. Nice looking lobby and mostly friendly staff. CONS: The hallways have an odd mildew odor; rooms okay though with patio door opened. Restaurant food is poor, based on one meal: Why try another? Parking is $14 plus parking tax; along with other taxes added to room rate, the actual cost of room/stay is about 33% higher; something to factor. The location on Robson Street is good if you're into shopping at small boutique stores or drinking coffee; there are Starbucks across the street from each other along with other chain coffee shops. People watching at the hotel patio bar is not very interesting nor are the bar's patrons. The other huge bar at the hotel is virtually empty, even late at night. Robson street becomes quite dead at night; not very interesting in the day either. Not really any good pubs/taverns on Robson. A lot more activity on Grenville at night, which is about a 10-15 minute walk away; it comes to life after 10pm. Try Doolin's Irish Pub on Grenville. It's a big place, after 10pm it has acoustic music upstairs and a rock band downstairs; wide variety of people. Still, Grenville is a bit rough on the edges and doesn't have a lot of decent options. I wasn't able to find a central nightlife area in Vancouver. The city really comes up short in this area. Other things to do: visit Gastown area; some interesting private art galleries, a couple of nice street patio taverns. Ride a bike around Stanley Park. High-end shopping at the mall at Granville/Robson; not my thing. A few other interesting private art galleries scattered about town. Since I'm not into shopping or fine-dining experiences, for me, 2 days in Vancouver were plenty; one might have sufficed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, View and Value”
Reviews.Author: SojournSister
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best values I found in Vancouver. Great price for a wonderful location, large and clean room, and best of all, a terrific view of Vancouver. Although the decor is a bit "tired" and needs some updating...because the room has lots of space, windows and sunlight...it more than makes up for the older decor. So if you are looking for a room with a great view and location at a good price (including Free Parking), this may be for you. Paying a little more $ for a room on the higher floors is worth it. Please note, we were only there for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “great view, location, service”
Reviews.Author: Kelbridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue for 5 days in July just as beautiful, warm sunny weather hit Vancouver. Our room was on the 29th floor with a fantastic view of English Bay. The hotel is not 5 star in terms of plushness/amenities etc. but it is outstanding in location, views, comfort----not the ritz but who cares? The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, we ate breakfast in the outdoor cafe every morning---easy, great eggs bendict, great place to people watch. The Trolley stops in front of the hotel frequently, the free shuttle to Capilano picks up at the Blue daily and even the Pacific Coach Bus to Victoria picked us up at the hotel and returned us---this is not true of most other hotels in Vancouver. We could easily walk to wherever we wanted or hop on the trolley----Canada Place, Stanley Park, English Bay---all walkable distances. We thought it was great as a home base. We also went ot Whistler for a few days and returned and stayed at the Sylvia--a completely different vibe there. I would recommend the Blue wholeheartedly if comfort and cleanliness is what you care about over fancy stuff---also we used the pool and hotub--very clean, spotless bathrooms etc. Gastown had the best food, souvenirs etc. Wouldn't bother with the Chinese garden--touristy. Capilano was fun, Stanley Park phenominal..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: SBSilky
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon is in a great location. So many things within walking distance, and several great places to eat and drink in the immediate area. It looked like the perfect place to stay! We arrived very late at night, and the check-in was fine, with a warm welcome. The room was much bigger than expected, and we dropped our bags and went out for a late night supper. Even though it was after 11:00 PM, we still had a choice of places just steps from the hotel.
