When we went to bed I noticed that the lamp on my side wasn't working. Oh well, no biggy. The next morning we tried to use the in-room coffe maker, but it wouldn't work. We wanted to watch teh early news on TV, but there was no remote in the room. After calling service someone came with aremote and a replacement coffee maker. We now had TV, but still no coffee. The outlet was defective, so the coffe maker was moved to the desk, where there was a working outlet. All in all, we lost about 45 minutes we would have liked to use exploring Vancouver. We did finally get out to see the town, which was helped by the great location. We got back to the hotel tired and satisfied shortly after 4:00 PM, only to find our room had not been made up! Shortly after we were asked to leave the room so it could be serviced. It could have been a great stay, but it turned into a bomb.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nacyr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 9 year old granddaughter and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was large with 2 queen sized beds. We had wall to wall windows overlooking Robson Street, the mountains and the water. 2 phones, 2 terry robes, free internet and a great price. What more could you want??

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: playaguya
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay. Clean, comfortable, and quiet, with friendly service from the staff. Make sure you book a 'superior" room though, which will put you on the upper half of the hotel. That's where the Wow! factor is with that fantastic view of the city, park, and water. We spent a good deal of time out there, with coffee in the morning and wine at night. Showed pictures to a friend and they asked if we'd been up in a plane - but no, it was just the view from our balcony! Our room had a comfy bed and pillows, a small refrigerator, coffee maker, and enough space to feel comfortable. Great location too, right on Robson, and very easy to get around. The only complaint I'd have would be the lack of free internet, but since we were on vacation, it wasn't nescessarily a bad thing, and if we ever make it back to Vncouver, we sure would stay at Blue Horizon again. With the price, location, and that balcony, it's very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: sirfartalot
Reviews.Content: The blue horizon is a good hotel, located downtown on Robson Street. I was lucky enough to be on the 29th floor so had reasonable views and little noise. The room doesn’t appear that large but I think this is mostly down to the way it is laid out. There is a balcony with a large sliding door to access. Now to the drawbacks: The hotel does NOT have wi-fi, it has free wired internet which was of no use to me as I was travelling with a tablet PC which had no Ethernet socket. They do have a computer you can use but it is $3 for 15 minutes. There was no fridge in the room but ice was available. The room looked a little tatty with a large section of brown metal trunking running along the wall which was bashed in at some points and missing at others - didn’t really affect the use of the hotel room in anyway, just wasn’t pretty. The main drawback from my point of view was that I was looking forward to a hot bath and found that mechanism that operated the plug didn’t work. I tried to push the plug down manually and found it wasn’t connected! It had obviously broken away a long time ago judging by the hair etc grafted onto the broken end (unpleasant ...). With a little more maintenance and investment, the Blue Horizon would be an excellent hotel, as it is though it is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view out our window at night!”
Reviews.Author: monicarichards
Reviews.Content: We booked the Blue Horizon the night before our Alaska cruise, previously we had been at the Sylvia and in Victoria. The lobby and service were a bit generic, but the room was really great especially the City view at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pick the Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: blackdress
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed. They allowed an early check-in and we had a room on the 28th floor (out of 31). Our room faced the mountains and water,, and the room had large windows on two sides. You can lay in bed and gaze out at the beautiful view with the sliding door open. The balcony was large enough to bring 2 chairs out and sit. The beds are firm and linens clean and crisp. All the employees we ran into and interacted with were helpful and pleasant. There is wi-fi in the room and we had no trouble using it. You can hear noise from Robson street below even with the windows closed and up so high, but a small price for being in the heart of the action. ANd it didn't affect our sleeping anyway. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cant believe they do not charge more!”
Reviews.Author: Hagarr
Reviews.Content: Not suggesting they increase the price- but with the location, clean updated rooms- I was surprised we paid what we paid to stay there. We took a trip through the mountains starting in Jasper, Alberta- and to stay on Robson so close to everything, this hotel is a bargain (we paid more for less throughout the trip). The hotel is missing a few very important amenities (like Wi-Fi?????????????) or a pool (I do not believe they have the room for one) but I need to give them an A+ for the simple fact that the price was awesome for what you get. The service was great, the rooms were always clean, and the access to the entertainment near by was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and surprisingly spacious room”
Reviews.Author: momoftiffy
Reviews.Content: Located right on Robson Street, in the heart of shopping. So many restaurants in the area we had a hard time deciding where to go. Once we had decided, we walked there and easily passed 40 other restaurants on the way. Decent price for a downtown hotel, room was spacious, lots of windows and a little balcony, comfy beds. Not too noisy for downtown either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in West End”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSheltieGirl
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay at Blue Horizon and liked the hotel very much. The staff were friendly and helpful and my room was spotless and well maintained. The "hop off hop on" bus stopped at the hotel and I had a pleasant trip around Vancouver. The hotel is located on Robson Street, one of the longest shopping streets in North America. At night it is very busy and most shops are open till 10pm (it was light there till 11pm) so it might be a little noisy for sleeping. I would ask for a room that does not overlook Robson Street. In a large city where some areas are not very safe, I felt very safe in the West End and at the hotel. Also, if you go and feel adventuresome, try the Capilano Suspension Bridge for some great trails and a real thrill!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Value Among Vancouver hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jaquesspratt
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the action in Vancouver - central Robson street - the Blue Horizon hotel was booked when our first choice in the sparse Vancouver value segment - the Sylvia - was full. What a fortunate turn of events. The Blue Horizon is a 31 story hotel, featuring very large suites with balconies. Each has a commanding view of one major segment of the city, especially from the upper floors. The spectacular views from our room were over Robson street and English Bay, stretching amazingly over parts of West Vancouver as well. We were once residents of Vancouver but have never experienced such a dramatic view. You are within 10 minutes walk of all the major downtown attractions, including great shopping and restaurants. There is a pool, hot tub and restaurant on the premises. For coffee addicts, Starbucks is 50 feet away. The downside of choosing the Westerly suite orientation is the noise. Vancouver is a big city and Robson street is likely the busiest place in it. Despite our 30 story elevation, we followed police and ambulance sirens, among other entertaining noises, into the wee hours. Once we figured out that turning the air conditioning unit on and shutting the balcony doors and drapes helped considerably, we had a reasonable night. The room is exceedingly large for a hotel, suggesting it had been built for apartment/condo dwellers. Well and comfortably furnished with a modern if small bathroom. No hand grips on the tub area but the hotel has some rooms with these features on request. The hotel does supply shampoo, despite statements from other reviewers, but it is in a dispenser in the tub area so might be missed. The queen bed was comfortable but missing a night table on one side. This was easily rectified by moving a table initially placed between two comfy chairs in the room. The staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was convenient and reasonable for Vancouver - perhaps one of the most unfriendly places ever for autos. It's impossible to beat the combination of features this hotel offers, and it's THE bargain in Vancouver. For those requiring a very quiet place however, this property may not deliver, at least not in rooms facing the busiest parts of this dynamic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DottyNC
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor did it again! We could not have found a better location or a better value for our Vancouver vacation. We bicycled in Stanley Park, took the city bus to Granville Island, and rode the free shuttle (which picks up right in front of the hotel) to Capilano Suspension Bridge. One thing to know is that the City bus (#50 which stops at Howe and Robson Street) takes only Canadian coins.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vancouver, Loved Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: emmmceee
Reviews.Content: Huge Room. Huge Bed. Huge View! Great location! Tasty pancakes! Decor maybe a little dated, but I'm just looking for something bad. Apart from that, I could not fault the hotel. 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Best view on Robson!!”
Reviews.Author: TammyHap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon Hotel on Robson Street for two days to celebrate our 20th anniversary. I'd booked a week or so ahead of time, with the hotel directly and they matched a lower price I'd found online for a superior room with a queen bed. We arrived at 4pm and were given the best available room at the time of check in. Well, we were thrilled, the room was on the top floor and had a stunning view of the city and English Bay. All the rooms are corner rooms and have small balconys, and we spent a lot of time gazing out at the city from ours. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the room was very clean and comfortable. The location on Robson can't be beat, and the price was great for the spectacular view, under $160 per night. I would definately stay here again, and highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very large clean room, comfortable beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: Val245
Reviews.Content: Good central location, about 15 minutes walk to Canada Place, always a taxi outside, bus-stop nearby, friendly, helpful staff, pool and hot-tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great downtown view”
Reviews.Author: Marjoon
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price for the location. It is located middle of down town. We were able to see downtown view from our room. Bright room with huge glass windows. The service was fine. The hotel is not luxury at all. It is clean though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCalgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver for 3 days at the Blue Horizon after debarking from an Alaska cruise. Due to reviews on this site I requested an upper floor (I got the 23rd) and wasn't bothered with any noise during our stay. There are only 4 rooms per floor, so each one is a corner room with its own balcony. It was very large, with 2 queen beds and an enormous closet with a safe. The beds were comfy and I slept well (I often have trouble sleeping if it's noisy). We ate breakfast every morning at the Inlet restaurant on the first floor and it was a good value for the money. Although we didn't eat any other meal at this restaurant, I noticed that it was always busy, which I thought was a good indication of the food quality. The location of this hotel can't be beat as it is close to everything, with several good restaurants within walking distance. The views from the room are great! The fitness center and pool are OK, but very small due to the size of the hotel floors.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a ten, close.”
Reviews.Author: GCHHawaii
Reviews.Content: Re: Blue Horizon Hotel This hotel has to be one of the best values in Vancouver. It’s ideally located within walking distance to almost everything. Countless restaurants of all palates and pocketbooks are up and down the street. Also high-priced fashion names and low-priced daily wear. The reception is professional. The rooms are big, and airy, and clean. From the upper levels the views are superb. Ask for an upper 06 room. You just want to stay there. Beds are comfortable and bathrooms sparkling clean. Room maintenance prompt and cheerful. The seasonal prices are reasonable. The reservation gal, Dee, is a gem. This is our fifth visit, and everything is always a consistent pleasure of staying there. The only but…. A front gal lacked some enthusiasm arranging for a late check-out, and the lobby could benefit from a re-do. Otherwise it would be a clear ten.

Reviews.Title: “All Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Gblyn
Reviews.Content: Room was huge - great views of above city and glimpse of water between buildings. Great location. Cafe just around corner is open 24 hours which came in handy, as we arrived late and hotel restaurant was closed. Only minor criticism was at check in and other times when we needed some information, we had a new staff member, who didn't have the knowledge required. I would definitely recommend this hotel - and would stay there again. It also had a pool and spa which my husband used. There was no free Wifi in the room (only internet connection for a computer - I had an iphone), but the cafe around the corner had free wifi. Also found another cafe - Cactus something, which also had free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: CalCoast
Reviews.Content: While no five star this hotel is tops for location and reasonable pricing. Corner rooms were worth the extra cost. Parking was accessible and fairly priced. Vancouver is a home to terrific food, museums, parks, University and a wonderfully welcoming community.

Reviews.Title: “They love to keep all your money”
Reviews.Author: ChristineRG
Reviews.Content: I did a reservation under a groups registration, but I never got a confirmation number so I called a couple of days later to confirm it and they advised me there was no reservation for me, so I was like crazy trying to get a room for those days, finally I got an expensive room in another hotel. After my trip I realized Blue Horizon charged me one night and called to have my money back because they advised me there was no reservation under my name. The answered I got was, "We don't care if you didn't write down your confirmation number, we don't have the policy to send you a confirmation email", you gave us a credit card and we charged it. OMG this is insane, how does a service provider answer like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1345309Cass
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here!! Little far from GM place compared to The Sandman, but MUCH BETTER value! Room was large, the bed was amazing and we had a balcony!!! Not super high class but no budget motel its the perfect middle class hotel. I will definiatly stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: spence3787
Reviews.Content: had a very nice stay there - rooms for 2 are small but very comfortable and well-maintained. All have balconies with great views. Parking was 14 per day with unlimited in and out. Excellent location for wandering around the city from Stanley Park to the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to End a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: DenverSwede
Reviews.Content: We finished a cruise and stayed in Vancouver one night before returning home. The Blue Horizon is in a perfect location convenient to restaurants, shops and the Waterfront. Check-in tool longer than we wanted but when we were upgraded to a suite, all was forgiven. It was a great room with a wonderful view of the city. We regretted that we didn't stay longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Perfect hotel for a visit”
Reviews.Author: leighxwhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of may and it was perfect. This is not luxury but it is very nice indeed. This is a spot on place to stay to visit the city. Great shops and restaurants near by too. We really liked here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: fluffybundles
Reviews.Content: We choose this location based on its location and reviews. We were upgraded to a King room which had a small mountain view (between two other buildings). The room was well appointed and very quiet and the beds were very comfortable. The internet access was free but wired which really didn’t suit us that much with us having two laptops. The bathroom is small but livable. Parking is extra and the area isn’t too big so I can imagine it gets a little difficult to park in busier times. We ate one meal in the hotel’s Inlet’s Bistro & Lounge. It is a lovely location with a lot of glass so you can watch those passing by as you eat. The food was delicious and not too pricy. The desk chair in the room was the most uncomfortable chair I have ever sat in in my life and the ones in the restaurant came a close second. The Vancouver Trolley Tour stops right outside which was a great plus. Avoid the Mexican restaurant directly across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Huge Room,Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: akanakagawa
Reviews.Content: I picked Blue Horizon based on Trip Advisor reviews as a low-cost alternative to the much pricier hotels offered by my professional society for our annual meeting. I was not disappointed. Despite being located on busy Ronson St., the room was very quiet and the 2 queen sized beds were very comfortable. The room was huge with a lounge area, large flat screen TV and the 2 large beds. The bathroom though was a bit tight and definitely was not roomy enough to hold more than one person at a time. There also were minimal toiletries available in the bathroom-just soap, shower gel and skin lotion, so bring your own shampoo. In-room Internet was free. For the price, this was definitely a winner!!

Reviews.Title: “location, value & service”
Reviews.Author: plbeary
Reviews.Content: you know by now that the blue horizon is a high rise right in the middle of Robson street. right where you want to be if you prefer walking to pubs, restaurants, stanley park and shopping over being in a remote, quiet location. we were on the 18th floor and with a great view facing down Robson towards the water. the room was very comfortable and spacious for two of us. we could hear a little street noise early morning. the room costs us $119 with $18 in taxes. Parking would be additional but we opted for bus service from whistler and a cab to the airport. we rented bikes on denman street & rode around the waters edge. many neighborhoods. beautiful. i would that again. we walked to granville street, stopped at the Lennox pub to people watch and then on to Doolin's to watch some hockey (with Vancouver in play-offs) and a casual dinner. We also enjoyed three places very near the Blue Horizon: Miko Sushi, Don Guacamole and Fogg n & Suds (for a great selection of beer). the front desk staff was professional & friendly - they answered all questions and provided excellent directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Catie_42
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reviews, location and price and stayed there prior to our cruise to Alaska. We thoroughly enjoyed it to the extent that we stayed there again on our return to Vancouver. Also stayed at a 5-star hotel in Vancouver as part of our tour package and found the Blue Horizon compared very favourably. The location was excellent and service good; our superior room was high up and had spectacular views. It was also well-appointed, spacious and very clean - and isn't that the most important thing? We also visited the restaurant for several meals and found the food good and reasonably priced. Couldn't quite get our heads around "soup and salad" though! All in all a very pleasing experience and we would certainly go back. Catie. Perth, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Great-Stay Away from Inlet Restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: 1ezlife
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice place in a great location on Robson. Rooms are spacious and ours had a great view. All rooms are corner units which makes them feel even bigger. The only negative with the place was that the hot tub was not functioning during our stay, One of the main reasons we chose BH was because of the pool/spa facilities. Of course we did not find this out until we had our suits on and were ready for a soak. I went to the front dest to inquire about the ETA on repair and was told. "We hope to have it fixed this afternoon" This was at 4:30! Pretty obvious it was NOT getting fixed that day. We just think it would have been nice if they mentioned this during check-in. At that point we could have made another choice. I would definitely stay there again. Some late night noise on the street but beds super firm and comfortable, Be sure to stay away from the Inlet Restaurant attched to the hotel. They even give you a $5 coupon. The food was terrible! Over cooked and over priced! Many better options on Robson. Didn't make it to the affliated bar Shennanigan's but would have my doubts.

Reviews.Title: “good service, reasonable rates for location but needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Special_K_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Bit of a walk from SkyTrain station but otherwise good location for street shopping. Fantastic service from front desk. Decor needs updating. Beds are comfortable although a little firm. Would rate it 3.5/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: place-name-here
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Blue Horizon for 8 yrs now and even after all these years the quality and care has yet to falter. The hotel is smack center of Robson street where if you're lucky you can get a higher rise room and have the view of the city center to your left while the majestic mountains and sea is to your right. Location isn't the only reason i choose to be loyal to this hotel, the room rate is great and the hotel is super clean and well maintained. The beds are comfortable and you can tell the linens are crisp. The swimming pool is laughable (reminds me of a large bathtub) but I don't see why this would deter folks from staying here. Parking has a small fee which i find very reasonable esp for the in and out privileges--if you think you can save a few dollars by street parking you're wrong. This hotel is ideal for folks who enjoy shopping and food since that's what you're essentially surrounded by but the hotel location is also a short distance to major tourist attractions; i usually walk to Gastown and if I am not feeling lazy to Stanley Park. Bottom line is this is a great hotel to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: abarliakos
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful with getting around city using public transportation. All the rooms have balcony. Rooms are very large too. Beds were comfortable and hotel was clean. The location is fantastic dozens of restaurants and shops within a short walk. We had an appetizer in hotel restsurant which was tasty. They give you a 5.00 coupon at check in for the restaurant. Would definately stay here again. Only reason not to give a perfect score was the sauna was out of order on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: tvfoley
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed at the Blue Horizon a number of times for both work and leisure. Everytime it suits my needs and is good value. Of all the hotels downtown, I can count on the Blue Horizon to always be one of the most affordable. As there are only 4 rooms per floor, each one is very large with a seating area and bar. It was perfect for myself, two kids and grandma. As well, it is central to everything. It is a 5 minute walk approx. to the waterfront and the Sea Wall and about a 15 minutes to the Stanley Park Aquarium. You are right on Robson Street too so there is always a good place to eat. The staff were very courteous and helpful and the beds are super comfy! I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “I tried to like it i really did!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here on my final leg of a month long Cross Canadian trip, Picked it due to the reviews and the location, Took the Airport shuttle from YVR which drops you at Palisades which is literally within a blocks walk, Got into reception and "Randy" checked me in, At first he was polite and pleasant until i used my Visa Card, Unbeknownst to me my bank had put a hold on my card the previous day as i'd been to a store in Montreal, used the card and they had fradulently changed the amount into something quite substantial! Anyway the card declined and his attitude changed to rude, i'm freaking out thinking where has all my funds gone and he suggests i try the ATM next door,???? Good thinking since my card wasnt working! Luckily i had enough cash on me to pay for one night! So i did that and told them i would call my bank and sort out the other 2 nights once i knew what was going on, They then took my passport to copy it, made me pay a $100 fee as a "Deposit" for the room and truth be told i felt like a criminal! I realise they have to protect themselves and make sure rooms are paid for etc but i am not the kind of guy who would ever contemplate leaving without first settling the bill and whilst i realise my bank situation had nothing to do with them i felt they handled it a little poorly and could have been a little more sympathetic. He issued me a room on the 17th floor, The room was clean, Had a blue feature wall, bed was comfortable and i had a beautiful view of the mountains and ocean, The balcony was dirty and littered with cigarette butts, I immediately went back down to report the balcony as they clearly state there are fines for smoking on balconies and i didnt want a charge going onto my bill for something someone else had done, Also gave me an indication on how well they clean things. The bathroom was average, Had a wall dispenser with shampoo/shower gel, and a little body lotion. Finally got onto family who wired me money, and my bank who by then had explained the situation so i knew what was going on, Once the money had been transferred i went down and immediately paid the other 2 nights, Didnt really use the facilities for the rest of my stay, They had a small gym and pool, When i was checking out the girl asked me if i could wait whilst they checked my room, never had to do that in any other hotel including 5 star that i have stayed in, Vancouver is a fantastic city with very friendly people, Unfortunately the staff are clearly not from vancouver! I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Is street noise still a problem?”
Reviews.Author: Lovetostayeat
Reviews.Content: It is a long time since I stayed at the Blue Horizon and I cannot say enough nice things about it. Everything was perfect except for one thing which hopefully may have been corrected. Our room was on the 17th floor facing on Robson St. with fantastic views of the city, water, and mountains. However, motorcycles apparently with no mufflers were racing up and down Robson St. all night. Our room had single pane windows and no blackout drapes, so I did not sleep very much at least the first night. When I filled out a comment card at checkout, I suggested double pane windows and blackout drapes to deaden some of this excessive noise. Hopefully, in the years since I stayed there, management has added these, but if anyone else is as annoyed by motorcycle noise as I am, you should ask if these improve- ments have been made. Other than this one problem, you cannot find a better value or a better hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spacious rooms, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: emdavis
Reviews.Content: On a recent stay in Vancouver we chose to stay at the Blue Horizon. we loved it! We were given a great room on the 25th floor looking down on busy Robson st - amazing views of the mountains also. Great central location, the staff were great at providing direction and maps etc. We ate breakfast one morning in the hotel cafe and it was very nice. Overall, loved the massive rooms and the view and I would return And the pool/spa were great ..!

Reviews.Title: “What's so special about this place?”
Reviews.Author: bertnspike
Reviews.Content: Pre and post cruise stay. Nothing to complain about; clean, easy to find, good location, accessible, okay restaurant. In a city just full of nice hotels and good dining, it's just another one of the herd. Perfect for our purposes and easy walking everywhere. Maybe it was a tad expensive for what they had to offer, but quite adequate and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: u2addict
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here after reading all the reviews here on Tripadvisor. We got a package deal through WestJet Vacations for a flight & hotel and got to stay on the 29th floor at no extra charge. The room was spacious and very clean, the staff was friendly and very helpful. The view was fantastic, overlooking Robson Street and the bay. We ate a few times at the Inlets Bistro, pretty good food around $10-$15 per person. We did use the pool and hot tub area. If the hotel is wondering where to spend their money it should be here for upgrades. The hot tub had peeling paint and the pink tiles around the pool could be replaced. Overall it was a great stay, the staff were very accommodating and friendly, and it's in a great location, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a few setbacks”
Reviews.Author: mkdenver1
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent 3 nights last week (week of October 12) in Vancouver and our accomodations were the Blue Horizon on Robson Street right in the middle of downtown Vancouver. This was a very nice hotel and even though it was built in the 60s (estimated) it was very easy to tell they work hard to keep the place updated and maintained. The staff is awesome and were extremely responsive for requests like extra towels and pillows. I think they brought those things to our door within two minutes after we called! Talk about service! Our king size bed was very comfortable and a main reason why we slept in a couple mornings and they did include a mini-fridge in our room which was really needed. I also really liked the balconies that were outside every room. Really nice touch. The hotel does lack a few areas and one of those is a free breakfast. Hello guys, this is 2009; even the cheapy interstate hotels offer a free breakfast. They also charge $.50 for local calls! What's up with that? Also there are no microwaves in the rooms. This would have really helped us out as we had a few items with us that required a microwave for us to enjoy those things. Also the TV, while having an extensive selection of channels, has no local channels and if you want local TV, you have to watch Seattle stations! I know there are TV stations in Vancouver, but you could not watch any of them at this hotel. Parking is also an expensive $14/day plus taxes, but at least you get a covered garage onsite. Aside from those, the Blue Horizon is a very nice hotel and can be well worth it. You just have to dig deeper to pay for the extra conveniences and ammenities that other hotels usually just throw in.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CENTRAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Bonmilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel 10 nights, great central location to walk to downtown, Gastown and Stanley Park. Bus stops outside hotel main entrance. Inlet Restaurant excellent value for money and economical. We were upgraded to the 29th Floor, good sized rooms and 2 bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: skidney_8
Reviews.Content: Blue Horizon is in a great location on Robson Street within easy walking distance of the main shopping area, Stanley Park and most of the other great places in Vancouver. The rooms were well priced fairly modern and had a great view of the hustle and bustle of the city without too much noise. We arrived on the Canadian very early in the morning after travelling cross country from Jasper and we went there to drop off our cases before going to see the sites. Even though it was still well before the check-in time we were allowed to check in and to be able to relax and grab a shower was a god send! Vancouver is rightly regarded as one of the finest cities in the world and when I come back I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jan30London
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed in a premium room with two massive queen size double beds. The room was spacious and clean with a fantastic view over the harbour. There is a restaurant on the ground floor that serves a decent breakfast. But we preferred to go to Blenz just a minute away for morning cakes and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, nice view & great value for the $$”
Reviews.Author: ClassieLassie
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Blue Horizon to anyone seeking a centrally-located hotel in Vancouver in the mid-price range. The rooms were fairly modern and the view from the balcony was very nice. We were on a higher floor in a corner room with giant windows. Pluses included the bed with its comfy duvet and the mini-fridge (which came in handy). It's close enough to walk to Stanley Park (a must!!) and most of all the sites on the island. There is even a trolley/bus that will pick you up and take you to Capilano suspension bridge for free. We did not rent a car, which is good because parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Vancover before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: smurfarita1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night before departing on an Alaska cruise. I loved the location! My husband and I walked to Stanley Park during the day and then spent the evening shopping on Robson street. The hotel itself was clean but seemed a little bit dated, we had a corner room that was very quiet and comfortable and the staff was very helpful in getting us a cab when we left as well as recommending places to eat. (there is a great walk up crepe place down the street good for a quick bite)

Reviews.Title: “great intro to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: totarapom
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for new to Canada visitors. Helpful staff, good value in house dining, so no hassle to eat out. in heart of down town so easy access to all amenities yet rooms quiet and god views of city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: envy4u
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights pre cruise. Great location. Room was large bathroom rather small. Air conditoner so loud we had to turn it off but that did not bother us as we like it warm. Don't pay extra for a view as most rooms have an obstructed view. We got upgraded as our room was not ready. If you get a good deal book here.

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all.”
Reviews.Author: dancingrhino
Reviews.Content: There is no better overall value for a Vancouver, B.C. hotel. We have stayed at the Blue Horizon twice in the last 6 months. The location on Robson simply cannot be beat. If you are a walker, everything is within reach from here. Quality restaurants, shopping, Stanley Park, night clubs, the business district are all steps away. The hotel itself is certainly somewhat dated, however, it is clean, the rooms are large and well maintained, the service is excellent and the view is a spectacular aphrodisiac. Pay the extra $10 Canadian for a room above the 15th floor. You will not regret it. The front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MrsRachaelB
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel on our trip through Canada. The room was very spacious and comfortable with an amazing view over Vancouver (we were on the 28th floor). We ate in the restaurant for lunch and the service and food was excellent. The staff were very helpful and all together a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay --- Definitely will return”
Reviews.Author: CACAtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Blue Horizon and I will definitely come back. Good value. Good staff. Spotlessly clean rooms. Great location. Awesome views from the rooms. Yes, this isn't the Grand Hyatt and it could use a little modernization in spots, but it's really an excellent and comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LauraUK
Reviews.Content: I can only echo what other positive reviewers have said about this hotel. We arrived at about 9.30 am following an Alaska cruise and were surprised and delighted that we were able to check in immediately. The following day we asked if we could keep the room a little later (as we had hire car issues) and this was also accommodated without any problem. The room was huge with a balcony with amazing views, extremely comfortable beds, a fridge, very modern bathroom and free internet. The location is excellent and we were able to walk to Stanley Park easily. The breakfast was excellent - the best pancakes and Canadian bacon I've ever had. I would return just for the breakfast! Two small niggles - the lifts were quite small, and slow and the indoor pool was very small and shallow. But there is a decent hot tub and a sauna so the overall experience was good. A gem in the heart of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town”
Reviews.Author: JerVan11
Reviews.Content: It's fair to say we did our homework here. It was our wedding and we had 20 out of towners needing a hotel to satisfy both budget and quality. Having viewed nearly every other hotel in its class we went with the BH. Rooms were huge and most had a fantastic view - we preferred the southern rooms as these provided uninterupted views (and were actually cheaper than the northern rooms which had restricted mountian views). If you are not familiar with the city and are looking for central location - look no further Thumbs up all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tycl516
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and found it to be quite comfortable. The view was awesome, as we were on the 21st floor. The added balcony was nice. The free internet was a nice amenity but at times it was glitchy so it would either be ridiculously slow or not work at all, but most of the time it was fine. We weren't in our room much as we were out and about so it worked well for us. The hotel is a nice walking distance to Stanley Park, which is a MUST see. Around the corner is a crepe place that looked really busy but we never actually tried it. It is central to the Vancouver Art Gallery, and the Pacific Centre. Since it's located on Robson Street, you are in the center of all the shopping, so if you like shopping, this hotel is in the perfect location. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, and would recommend it to anybody who wants to be central to a lot of Downtown sights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TinkToo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older hotel that has been redone very nicely. It is right on Robson street which is an excellent location, and they had a promotion so our room was not super expensive like some other hotels downtown Vancouver. The hotel does not look like much from outside, but the rooms are large and very nicely done. There is a charge for parking, but that is expected downtown. We travelled with a group of 10 people, 6 adults and 4 children and all of us were extremely happy with our rooms. The bathrooms are a little small, but this did not cause any issues. There is free internet connections which was nice also. The hotel is within walking distance to Stanley Park. We did not use the pool because it was very small and just over 3 feet deep the whole length which was kind of weird. I imagine it is just for lane swimming. We would definitely stay at the Blue Horizon again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: redpeny1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Blue Horizon in Vancouver after a 7 day Alaska cruise. We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 AM and they had our room ready, plus we got an upgrade to a larger room with a balcony. The front desk personnel were courteous & helpful with restaurants & sightseeing. Beds are very comfortable. We had breakfast at the hotel and had the best scrambled eggs ever. We also had a great internet rate of $139.00/night. This hotel is perfectly located for shopping and attractions. I would hightly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always consistent”
Reviews.Author: flipflop22Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good sized rooms, awesome views & location is the BEST !! Breakfast in the restaurant is good, pub next door ... prime Robson Street location, easy walk to restaurants, shopping, sightseeing plus #5 bus is at your door

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but couple of points...”
Reviews.Author: lochnagar
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent with plenty of good quality restaurants nearby. The staff were particularly helpful when we wished to change rooms (ended up not doing so !). We had two rooms on the third floor and could not hear any street noise at night but...the air con unit in one of our rooms was quite useless and so the room was uncomfortable during the night (when temepratures in Vancouver were unusually high). We had breakfast every day in the bistro/restaurant part of the hotel but, sometimes, the waiting staff were not as efficient as they should have been and our orders arrived incomplete. The rooms themselves are quite spacious, clean and comfortable (apart from the aircon). We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ShaneL79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Vancouver at least 5 times a year, and each time we stay at Blue Horizon. We call in advance and ask to have an upper floor with a king size bed and have got what we requested every single time. We noticed there isn't much advantage of having an ocean view because the hotel is in the middle of downtown which is surrounded by water. As long as you have an upper floor you get an ocean view. We have had great service at the front desk and in the lounge for breakfast. Best part is, it is a nice hotel in a perfect location. A short walk to Stanley Park, or even Granville Island. Pretty much in the centre of everything if you don't mind a short walk. If you are lazy then there is always cabs around and not too pricey. We tend to be very clean people and don't spend a whole lot of time in our room, so we put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door for the entire week we were there and never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Irishwannabe
Reviews.Content: Found it through Trip Advisor and must say the location, the bed, the room, the view, the wonderful staff, breakfast, EVERYTHING was great! I'll be there next time as well, whenever that will be. I did stay high in the building though. Floor 29, and it costs more to be above the 14th but oh so worth it. Both for the unbeatable views and it helps with the noise from Robson St below. The whole city has a hum of traffic though, due to the fact that there is no freeway so when you're going anywhere, you're going through city. Makes for congestion. Not the Hotel's fault, and frankly if I'd stayed at Hotel Vancouver (much more than the 169.00 I spent per night) it would have been just as noisy. It's like NYC that way, there's always traffic. But really, the bed and linens, the staff, wow! Blue Horizon don't change a thing. You felt like a luxury hotel even though I only paid a moderate price. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, comfortable, clean, great location in the city...”
Reviews.Author: Love2Trek
Reviews.Content: We (self, spouse, teenager) shared a superior, two queen size beds, room in July arriving on Canada Day (July 1). The room was spacious and very clean. We did not feel crowded after six nights. The views were good. The higher up the room, the better the view. Also, you may want to select the side of the building so that you have a view of Stanley Park and the water. We were on the 24th floor, and we did not really hear noise while sleeping with open windows. The room had a small fridge so you could store some things, but no microwave. We had no problem connecting to the internet from our room. The workout facilitiies were really nothing. I swam laps in the pool one day, but it is very small. There is also a hot tub and sauna. The hotel has a decent breakfast at a reasonable price. The location is such that you can walk everywhere. The only time we used public transportation was to go to Lynn Canyon and the airport. We found we could go everywhere on foot and enjoyed it. We walked the entire Stanley Park as well as to Yaletown several times to catch some of the jazz festival. The staff was friendly and courteous. They were able to give us an early check-in as we arrived early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and location”
Reviews.Author: kuu-kanko
Reviews.Content: Without the great location, the hotel would be quite basic. It is a bit worn out and the small lobby doesn't have the services that big hotels usually have. Nevertheless, the basic services work fine and the rooms are ok. The rooms in the higher floors have nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Karanszia
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. The rooms were lovely and clean and of a decent size. We were on the 15th floor, (there was over 30). Because of the shape of the hotel all rooms are corner rooms and all have balaconys. I'd love to stay at this hotel again. It's right on top of everything. The staff were very helpful. The pool, while not being the best looking was very good, and is regularly checked by the staff for water quaility.

Reviews.Title: “Great water views”
Reviews.Author: LuvSWA
Reviews.Content: Large windows on two sides of the room made for beautiful views, despite less than perfect weather. Lots of room, very comfortable beds, and a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Robson Street location”
Reviews.Author: mdpooh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue Horizon after a trip to the Canadian Rockies. Walking Distance to waterfront and Gastown, though not as close as Days Inn on Pender Street where we stayed before our trip. This hotel, however, is very convenient to public transportation to all places in Vancouver. It's also on a street with many good, reasonably priced restaurants of all types. Room was large, clean and had good view. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We reserved our room several months before traveling. Make sure you check the rate again before you travel to see if it has dropped, as ours did.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: arnieman
Reviews.Content: As others have noted previously the hotel is superbly situated. It is on mid Robson Street, the city's chief shopping street with everything from high class name brands to tourist "shlock." It is also easily accessible, on foot, to scores of restaurants from value-oriented ethnic restaurants to several higher end eateries. The hotel is also an easy 10 minute walk to Canada Place and Coal Harbour, and perhaps a 20 minutes walk to the English Bay Beaches. The hotel offers superb views, particularly from its higher floors. (We found it worth the extra money for a "superior" room which included a breathtaking view of English Bay an the West End from the 29th floor.) The room had a king size bed with excellent linens, an ample desk for work, and an easy chair. It also included a small fridge and coffee maker. The bathroom is of adequate size, and even on this high floor water pressure was adequate. The hotel is a former apartment building, and the lobby is very small, almost non-existent. Parking is available for, I believe, $14 per night. The front desk staff is friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. I found that the hotel's own web site offered rates that were higher than those offered via Travelocity. (Interestingly Expedia said the hotel was not available for the dates we requested, but I had not trouble booking a room.) The hotel's rates - $150 Canadian per night pretax - for a view room struck me as reasonable. I do not believe that the hotel offers a business center. I did not bring a laptop with me, but I believe that wireless is free. There is an internet cafe about four blocks from the hotel. I also believe that the hotel does not have a fitness center, but that it has an arrangement with a local health club. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel, but we did not eat there. (There is a great crepes restaurant - Le Bretanne - about a block away.) One of the local hop on- hop off tour busses stops in front of the hotel. Given its location, good service, and nice rooms I believe this hotel should be considered for a stay on any trip to Vancouver for any purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Vancouver, met expectations”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettNewJersey
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was not disappointed with the Blue Horizon Hotel in Vancouver. It is centrally located on Robson Street surrounded by fine stores and restaurants. They offer underground parking for $14.00 per day. It appears that parking is difficult to find in the city although they have metered parking on many streets. Our room was on the ninth floor and quite large with a balcony that overlooked the city. By contrast, the bathroom was small. They also provided a small refrigerator and safe . The bed was extremely comfortable and the sheets were of a fine quality and very soft. It was a pleasure to sink into that bed after a long day of sightseeing! There is also a restaurant in the lobby where we enjoyed a nice halibut dinner one evening. The front desk recommended a very good Chinese restaurant very near the hotel. It is called Hon's. Don't be put off by the large open room and lack of ambiance. The food is good and it seems always to be crowded. My only complaint is the many taxes imposed at checkout. They add a government tax, an accomodation tax and they even charge tax on the parking. I booked through hotel.com, and was not advised, although I assume this is true for all of the hotels in Vancouver. All in all, I would return to this hotel the next time I visit Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidBSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of three nights during June 2009. Hotel reception staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. We were upgraded (free) to a family suite on the 29th Floor with superb views across Downtown Vancouver and beyond. The room was large, very large, with two separate bedrooms and bathrooms. Extremely clean, comfortable and well maintained. Our third night was in a standard room on the 9th Floor. Again, it was a good size, with two queen-sized beds and plenty of sitting space. And again it was clean and comfortable. We found the hotel very quiet with minimal external traffic noise and no disturbance from other guests. An excellent Downtown location on Robson St. The Hotel's Inlet Cafe served an excellent choice for breakfast/brunch while great restaurants were within easy walking distance for dinner. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelinbunny
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on price and Tripadvisor reviews. We were only staying for one night, so we didn't have a chance to checkout the amenities of the hotel. We loved our room, though. Having the balcony overlooking Robson St. was a lot of fun. It does get noisy, but it didn't bother either of us. The bed was comfortable and the room was large. We used the parking garage and didn't have any issues. We plan on staying here the next time we travel to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, great value.”
Reviews.Author: sarah711
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue Horizon June 14th - 17th. Had a king bed room on the 18th floor. Arrived at night and was thrilled with the view over Robson Street. Could see beautiful downtown Vancouver, the water and the mountains all from my private balcony. Comfy bed, nice desk, roomy closet and great shower. Elevator is small but quick. Never saw housekeeping but my room was always refreshed upon my return. I heeded the hotel warning about not leaving anything in my rental car and I had no problems. There was a little noise from the busy street below, but nothing to complain about, just part of the downtown atmosphere. Check in & out were both quick & easy. The Inlet Bistro has a great breakfast - try the berry pancakes! Also definitely check out Cardero's for dinner, Section 3 for a great mojito and AfterGlo. Great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bksreader
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at the Blue Horizon for 2 nights following our Alaskan cruise. This was a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again. The location is perfect. It is right in the heart of the Robson St shopping area. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. For good food value, I'd recommend the Red Robin which was a couple of blocks down the street from the hotel. There is also a drug store nearby for any necessities that you might have forgotten. Don't be worried by the worn looking hallways, the rooms are wonderful! They are big, bright and very clean. The beds are so comfortable. Each room is a corner room. We had a room on the 28th floor with a view overlooking Robson St on one side and English Bay on the other. Because the hotel is right on Robson St., it could be a bit noisy at times. I didn't mind it at all and had no problems sleeping. If you are a light sleeper and you go to sleep early, this might be an issue for you. For me, it was part of the experience of being in the heart of the city. The rooms had free high-speed internet, but not wifi. If you need wifi, there are coffee shops on both sides of the corner that were great for wifi. If you are looking for a hotel with great rooms and a central location, the Blue Horizon is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Superb location, Good food.”
Reviews.Author: janevans35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon, Vancouver last week. It was absolutely great. The room was huge, with two king size beds. The standard of cleanliness was excellent. The location was was spot on, on Robson Street, the main shopping street in Vancouver, Lots of eateries around. This hotel has high floors, so we had a wonderful view. The hotel was quiet, and we all slept very well. The beds were super-comfortable. We had some meals in the restaurant, and the food was excellent. Try the triple berry pancakes with maple syrup for breakfast. Superb ! I would certainly revisit this hotel on my next trip to this wonderful city. No hesitation !

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: la808
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on the 5th of June after an Alaskan cruise. Room 1801. During our previous stay to Vancouver we stayed at the Hyatt. I would choose Blue Horizon over the Hyatt primarily due to location. Service: We arrived at 8am and the front desk host was able to check us in. All of the front desk staff was extremely helpful throughout the day. We spoke with several different staff members as the hotel was so convenient that we stopped in during the day. We needed to leave at 4am to catch an early flight and they were helpful in calling a cab and taking care of our bill in the middle of the night. Rooms: Room was spotless. Decorations were quite bland. Ample counter space. No clothes line or towel rack in the shower. Amenities Included a combo soap, shampoo & conditioner wall dispenser in the shower. Bar soap for sink only. Body lotion. Free internet access, safe and refrigerator. Free coffee, tea and hot water maker. Rooms were extremely spacious. Closet was small and the safe was in the closet so that took up room. However the room was so large that you had ample space to make up for the small closet. Common areas: The lobby was small was nicely decorated. the interior hallways were sweltering - I think the a/c was not turned on to save energy costs. Other: This is a stop for the Vancouver HOHO trolley (not the Big Bus). the front desk will give you $2 off coupons. They will also give you detailed city bus directions to all of the attractions and a good map of the city. Location: Ask for a higher floor. I'm not sure how much the Robson Street clubbing noise would affect lower floors. The location of the hotel was excellent. An abundance of restaurants and shops were just outside our door. There is a 7-11 around the corner and a safeway down the hill. Several 24 hour restaurants within a block.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: theknight09
Reviews.Content: I reserve a room at the blue horizon Vancouver for 3 nights two weeks in advance;however, when I arrived there, they surprised me by telling me you can't stay here because you are a Vancouver resident. they discriminate me because i am traveling alone and my age. they asked me to find another hotel . I was so upset because they don't have the right to Prevent me from staying in this hotel. I don't recommend this hotel for everybody because the people who work in the front desk are rude specially the manger P.S I am a international student in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful view, huge room”
Reviews.Author: SuzyCruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver a couple of days after our cruise to Alaska. This hotel was one of the coolest things about our short stay. Although a little dated in decor, the rooms are huge, beds are super comfy, and the view was spectacular. With windows on two walls and a balcony we had a view of the harbor, the city and the snow covered mountain. (25th floor) Robson Street can be a little loud, but if you are in the upper floors, it's not bothersome. The sightseeing Trolley stops at the hotel and hotel staff was very helpful in directing us to restaurants etc. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good view, good location,”
Reviews.Author: kilroywuzhere
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a less expensive than most alternative in vancouver this may be the right hotel for you. , walking distance to downtown.on a busy shopping street, less than a mile to stanley park. spacious room, balcony. not the cheapest hotel in town but i think it gives the best bang for the buck.parking was 14.00 a night and they don"t recommend keeping anything in the car in view . with everything so close we walked everywhere anyway.there is a nice sightseeing trolley service that stops at the hotel every 20 minutes or so.also there a lot of restaurants to choose from nearby

Reviews.Title: “Blue Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Samol
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at the Blue Horizon at the end of an Alsaka cruise, and it was every bit as good as expected. The location on Robson Street is very good, although quieter in one of the rooms to the rear. The reception/lobby is fairly small and unimpressive, something that cannot be said about the rooms. We were not able to work the upgrade miracle and get something on the top-floor, but our 9th floor room was huge, airy, set on a corner, and with a small balcony . By comparison the bathroom seemed small, but like the rest of the accomodation was very well appointed, only missing a retractable clothesline to have it all. The beds were both large and very comfortable, there was a TV, fridge, safe, and complimentary internet, and everything was spotlessly clean. We had breakfast each morning in the Inlets bistro, and again it was top-class in terms of quality, speed, and service. All the staff we met were unfailingly pleasent, friendly, and helpful, whether from the restaurant, reception, or room service. We changed our Vancouver hotel booking to the Blue Horizon on the basis of the TA reports. It proved to be a good decision, and the Blue Horizon fully deserves its high ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value. Excellent location. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: verymodest
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. All the previous reviews are correct. It is situated in the most attractive part of Robson Street, right in the middle of all the excellent shopping and entertainment. If this is your first time to Vancouver, this would be the best location to explore it from. The most impressive thing about Blue Horizon is the value. The price is very reasonable for what you get. The quality of the hotel is exceptional. In fact, I would say it competes favourably with establishments which are twice as expensive. It is clean. The rooms are large, bright and well equipped. The service is great. The views from the rooms are to die for. There is free high speed internet, which is a huge plus. There is a large safe in the room. The beds are comfortable. There is lots of parking available (though not free - $14 a night). One quick tip: before making a reservation, check out the Tourism Vancouver website. It often has special promotion offers which will give you even more incredible savings. We were able to save $50 a night this way and got a spectacular room on the 25th floor with a great view of Robson Street. Overall, I would say this is the best value and the best bang for your buck you can get in Vancouver. Even the most picky travellers should be satisfied. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value & service”
Reviews.Author: kenmkiwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights (9/10 April) and was probably the best value of our Canada/USA holiday. The young receptionist (sorry I dont remember her name) gave us the friendliest welcome possible and had us checked in early (about 11am) and quickly. Room had a great view down Robson St and the harbour. Parking was convenient and the hotel is so central to shops and eateries. Had great value breakfast and lunch and again friendly service, in the dining room adjacent to reception. Excellent value -will certainly stay again if we're back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “perfect everything”
Reviews.Author: lbfoodie
Reviews.Content: My best ever big city hotel stay under $450. Big, light rooms. Every room a corner room with all the goodies. Even the hotel food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: ka058
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at this hotel. Room was huge, much larger than we'd expected and clean. Still cant believe price paid considering location and time of year. Didnt eat at Hotel so cant comment but there are some very good resturants within 5 minutes on Robson Street. Hotel staff were very helpful when out travel plans were interupted by the Sea to Sky Road Landslide. We where able to stay in same room at the same price - no problem! No faults I can think of so overall a great location to explore Vancouver and surrouding area.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Excellent Location - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: mattmc1976
Reviews.Content: After doing extensive research on Vancouver hotels, we chose Blue Horizon based on location, price and previous reviews. Upon arrival we were very pleased. Check in was quick, courteous and helpful. We were more than pleased when we entered room 1804. The first thing we noticed was the amount of natural light from the several windows and sliding glass door leading to the patio. Decor was just average, however, the city views more than made up for it. Our balcony looked right down on Robson ST, across the skyline and over English Bay. We were worried about noise late at night from the amount of traffic on Robson, however, the room must have been soundproofed as street noise was never an issue. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day at getting the room as spotless as it was when we checked in. I must say that the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in! We really didn't take advantage of all the amenities of the hotel. The restaurant onsite was highly reccomended to us, but with all the excellent dining and various cuisine in the area around the hotel, we didn't get to try it. The indoor pool is actually on the 2nd floor above the reception! It looked very inviting; and it must have been as there were always several people swimming and relaxing in the hot tub. Overall, I would give the hotel 4 stars (3 for the room and 5 for the view.) Service was friendly and efficient, the room was clean and comfortable and the views were amazing. We will definately give our reccomendation and we will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “rather rude”
Reviews.Author: langleygirl
Reviews.Content: Upon researching extensively, I decided that Blue Horizon was our choice hotel for a mid week, mid spring break, vacation in our own local big city with my teacher freind and her daughter. The receptionist at the reservation desk informed me that their policy is to not accept "local" reservations on weekends and that I was to call some other manager, leaving my my name and number and she would get back to me on Monday. After doing so, I was perplexed and phoned back and it was explained to me they try to discourage partying in rooms and find that locals would try to bombard the hotel to do so. I told them that our trip was to shop and be a tourist and that I am fifty, bringing my daughter and son. I realized that I was bartering for a room and trying to defend my character. Any hotel that offends their guests in this manner does not deserve my business or any one elses.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Price, Comfort And More .........”
Reviews.Author: BobnOz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Blue Horizon from 6th - 18th December 2008. We could not have asked for a better location for the price and the comfort provided. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a higher room ... the views being fantastic. Our sole purpose for going to Canada apart from the normal sightseeing thing, was to experience snow and Vancouver provided that in abundance and to see it from the balcony of the hotel was magical, seeing the buildings being dusted with snow. There is plenty of shopping close by on Robson Street and nice eateries, eg. Vinada on Robson, Zefferelli's on Robson, Absolute Sugar at the Harbour Centre, as well as Hamburger Mary's and Cafe Luxy on Davie. If you are looking for souvenirs then try Canadian Crafts on Robson, very helpful staff and not a rip off pricewise. All in all the Blue Horizon staff were very helpful and pleasing to see their efforts to reduce costs in regard to washing of linen to help save the environment. We both would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone and will definitely be back to stay again ..... just for the views. Bob.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare.Their left luggage gave our tagged suitcase to another guest”
Reviews.Author: upgardenpath
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here. It was clean, good value but dull.Service at the front desk polite but slow. We left our luggage at the front desk left luggage upon check out , to explore the city before our evening flight to the U.K. It was tagged by staff, and we returned at 4 pm to pick up and catch the nearby 4.18pm pre- paid airporter bus. The suitcase had vanished and was traced to another guest now 3 hours up the coast. If we would like to wait 3 hrs they would get it ! My by now upset and angry wife demanded to see the manager as we were going to miss the bus, and consequently the 5.30pm deadline for picking up rest of our left luggage at the airport. The sales manager said that the bag would be couriered to our home, but refused to put anything in writing for insurance purposes; we were about to miss the bus, which he blamed on us for turning up with 5 minutes to spare ( untrue). The children were now in tears for their lost christmas presents, which he suggested was due to my wife being upset, and he offered us $20 towards the $ 35 taxi fare to the airport. 5 days on, no bag, $ 36 down,no active information from hotel.When prompted, they emailed that they have the bag and "we will be in the process of sending it out" No apology. Really bad customer service from director of sales. How management responds to a problem is the true sign of how good a hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Best you'll find for the price, views are stunning!”
Reviews.Author: MizJames
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I have stayed here on average once a year for the past 5-6 years. What we love: The price, amazing views, balcony for every room, room size is very comfortable for the money, beds are very comfy with good pillows and comfy cotton duvets, room is always clean, there's a pool, staff has always been friendly to us, very centrally located right on Robson in the middle of everything. Note: The place is pretty no-frills, so don't come here expecting some fancy honeymoon experience unless you shell out for one of the premium rooms. The room is nothing fancy, but not horrible ugly either, the tub/shower is serviceable at best, there is no fancy soap or anything like that, the mini bar is pretty lame, no flat screen TV, but the cable is decent with a few free movie channels and good on-demand pay movie service. Bottom line: great comfy place to make a home-base if you're not looking for fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: RosieRed19
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the Blue Horizon before we headed out on a 9 day cruise from Vancouver . Admittedly after comparing this hotel rate with the other larger hotels, we were a little suspicous on what we'd find but the reviews seem to reinforce this hotel had good value to offer. We were pleasantly rewarded when entered our room. I had asked for a room on a higher floor so we could enjoy the view and the management certainly fulfilled this request. The arrival day was a perfect Fall sunny day and being on the 33 rd floor, I couldn't have been more delighted. We could see the city for miles, the balcony allowed us to see a good distances and the room's large picture window provided an extended view of another portion of the city. City transportation is just outside the front door and the hotel is walking distance to various tourist attractions as well as some good shopping and restaurants. Front desk staff were polite and helpful . A heavy rainfall the following morning encouraged our decision to remain at the hotel for breakfast and the food was good. The front desk accomodated our request for an extended check-out time so we were able to use the pool and hot tub. The hotel would be perfect for an extended stay, it has everything needed to make for a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: jojo1015
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Blue Horizon in Vancouver. I requested upper floor room bacause last time I stayed there, it was fantastic!! Accutually, when I got there, my room was not ready BUT they upgraded my room which was more fabulous than last time and gave me voucher for the reataurant. I could see English bay and beautiful night view,and I stayed at very clean and big nice room, I was completely satisfied with it. I highly recommend this hotel for everyone who goes to Vancouver bacause needless to say, the hotel is amazingly nice and located in core of downtown. It's very convinient to go everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stress-free Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: Flip-flopFaye
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception staff, fantastic room. Huge with 2 big comfy clean beds, armchair, plenty of furniture and built in mirrored wardrobes. Modern bathroom. Balcony with fantastic views and we were on the 14th floor. Ask for a high floor like we did. Plenty of lifts so you never have to wait too long. Couldn't ask for a better location. Would recommend this to anyone I know. If I ever find myself in Vancouver again, I would definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aaronbjerke
Reviews.Content: We were incredibly surprised by the breath-taking view, the service, the quality of the room, and LOCATION! Amazing hotel in an amazing part of the city. Highly recommended! They also had wonderful pillows and beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Views, Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tuckmics
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Blue Horizon every October for the last 4 years. It is a great location, right on Robson, close to everything. All rooms have a balcony and the rooms are quite large, though the bathroom is a bit small. They have a parking garage and the staff has always been very helpful and professional. There is a restaurant in the hotel that serves a great breakfast, though with so many options in Vancouver, we haven't eaten there often. We love the convenience and the price (around $130 for a deluxe king). Always request the highest floor possible, as the views get better (obviously).

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazyclb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August. For the price we were impressed with the hotel. Reception staff were polite and helpful. Room was large and more than adequate for our stay. Great location, walking distance to Stanley Park, and downtown shopping on the door step. Great cafe close by serving reasonably priced, hearty breakfast - Coco Rico Cafe Bistro, 1290 Robson Street.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September, 2008. The location was excellent. The hotel upgraded us to room 2806 which provided magnificent views even though the weather was cloudy with rain. We had windows on two sides, a balcony, wet bar and seating area. Although the hotel was designed to provide excellent views from all sides, subsequent highrises have limited views for some rooms. Ask for a room facing Stanley Park. Contact hotel directly for best rate and room location. Access to ice is limited to just a few floors. the 14th floor is highest before paying for an upgrade to superior room. But ask for an upgrade. We didn't have to ask, they just gave it to us but if they don't, ask. Parking is convenient, and bringing your luggage in and out is no problem. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The morning we left for the airport, we ate breakfast in the hotel cafe. We told the waiter we were trying to make a plane and we couldn't believe how fast our food arrived. It was inexpensive and good value. All in all, we would definitely recommend this hotel. Note: if you are interested in using the trolley to get around to the sites in the city, it stops in front of the hotel. You can print a $1 off coupon from the internet and print the schedule. We were glad we just took our car as we had not trouble parking and went places the trolley didn't. Also, the trolley stops running around 5. Also note that there is an airport bus that brings you to the hotel next door for $13.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, services and value”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Lam
Reviews.Content: With the excellent location and great value, you can't find another one at the downtown of Vancouver. It is a few minutes walk from the Stanley Park, the Convention hall and the skytrain station. You may go shopping and have great meal on the Robson Street. I also got an fantastic nightview of vancouver downtown from my room which is located at 24/F too.

Reviews.Title: “Great city views and location.”
Reviews.Author: gertrudesurrey
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in a Superior Room, located on 26th floor, so we could get good views. (Superior rooms are on the upper floors). I am not keen on heights, so didn't venture out onto the balcony, but my husband took a couple of Robson by day and night. Although this is a very busy street, we kept the windows closed and were completely undisturbed. This must have been the largest room of our trip (and we used several hotels of this standard), containing 2 queen beds with lots of space around them. Only one complaint - most hotels give at least 2 coffee sachets, including a decaff option, whereas Blue Horizon only provided one with the expectation that one would pay for another! We used the indoor pool as it opened early one morning and enjoyed the experience. But it must be the smallest pool for a hotel of this size ever! A family of 4 would fill it! We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, prefering instead 'La Bretagne Creperie' which serves the most delicious filled crepes at a good price. To find this gem, turn right out of the hotel and right again at the first corner. It's just opposite the Pallisades Hotel, (outside which the Airport bus stops). The Blue Horizon is a great hotel in a brilliant location - about 20mins walk from Stanley Park which we spent a whole day exploring. We felt it was really good value for Vancouver and will return here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong for the price!”
Reviews.Author: elee099
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about a half dozen times for various work trips to Vancouver and I can't get over how good of a deal this place is for Vancouver. My corporate rate gets me a room between $90 - 129 throughout the year depending on the season. Take a look at the pictures posted by the other reviewers to get an idea of the SIZE of the rooms and the potential VIEWS you'll experience. I love my fine hotels but for the price ... you cannot go wrong with the Blue Horizon.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Robjan
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights after being on RCI Alaska cruise. Got a shuttle bus from the ship to the Hotel took about 25 minutes. We arrived at the hotel before the stated check in time but were able to leave our luggage which was put in our rooms by hotel staff later. Room very tidy, we were on the 26th floor with great views towards Stanley Park, which was 15 minutes walk away. Had lunch in the hotel the day we arrived and breakfast every day, thought standards were good, I can recommend the Bistro Special for breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful in the hotel. The hotel is in a good position on Robson Street close to shops and restaurants; we liked The Keg and Milestones which were both close by. If you like walking Vancouver is great, Stanley Park is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base, for downtown, Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: poppins_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our holiday for 2 nights, we were very impressed, we were upgraded to a superior room at no extra cost. Noisy if balcony door left open at night but what you would expect from a city centre location, loved to hear the hum of the traffic. Very clean and comfortable.
