Used the Bistro for evening meals and breakfast, again very good especially patient and well informed when reguesting Gluten free food.

Reviews.Title: “a great choice”
Reviews.Author: dave_evans
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid evening, and due to a servicability problem with the room we had originally booked on a higher floor, we were upgraded to a family room. It was on the 29th floor, and was wonderful, extremely spacious with two bathrooms, two bedrooms, very clean, with a balcony and large, panoramic windows on two sides with spectacular views of North Vancouver. The beds were extremely comfortable and there was a fridge, safe and ironing board in the room along with dressing gowns for your use. It made our trip really special. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location really could not be bettered in downtown Vancouver, situated right on Robson St., with it's stores and restaurants, and easy walking distance to Stanley Park, the waterfront and the financial district. There is a nice informal and reasonably priced restaurant on ground level serving good food. It was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Blue Horizon Hotel, Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Following the advice of other contributors to Trip Advisor, booked the hotel directly, and was not disappointed. To the contrary, found the hotel not only perfectly situated on Robson Street, but also very comfortable. Two queen sized beds on the 21st floor with a wonderful view. Much larger room than in most hotels; beautifully appointed. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - great location”
Reviews.Author: Tabithay23
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay, friendly staff, VERY comfortable beds, nice size rooms, my only complaint would be that the bathtub/shower area needs to be renovated - it's quite worn.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: NJP1
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel could not be better on Robson Street but be warned if you are on a low floor facing the front the traffic noise is dreadful and also the noise from the night club in the small hours of the morning. The hotel needs an update especially regarding their double glazing they need triple glazing. So ask for a high floor and you should be ok. Also the air conditioning is so loud you could not possibly have it on during the night. A disappointing hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: hikermomma
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 28th Floor did not appear to have been vacuumed and the fridge was sticky. The hotel is centrally located on Robson which is good but also very very noisy as the traffic never stops. We had an extremely obnoxious guest above us that we could hear talking, smell the cigarette smoke from their balcony (in a hotel that advertises as entirely "smoke free")and what sounded like moving of furniture above us.I am always dismayed by the lack of courtesy that people have for their neighbors in hotels. It seems so common in even the "best" of hotels. I would have felt like we had gotten more value if the hotel had offered breakfast with the room rate, seeing how they have a restaurant but this was not the case and neither did they offer vouchers for food. There were no "perks" here. Parking was available @ the hotel for $14/night. It seems that could be included in the room but it is not. Also, apparently theft and break ins are quite a problem as there are signs everywhere , in all the hotels, in the garages warning you not to leave valueables. Thankfull our car was not broken in to. It was a pretty non-descript room and at $200-night I'm sure we'll stay elsewhere on our next visit. There are plentiful and quite a variety of rooms available in Vancouver. On our walks we came upon The Hotel Sylvia, which is on the water, very quaint and inviting looking. We would probably look into that on a future visit and also The Pan Pacific and Westin which were recommended by friends. In my search I also found that The Four Seasons has a package available with nights in Vancouver and Whistler-which I now wish we had booked because Whistler was stunning and we could have split our time between the two places.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like We Needed a Shower After Our Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Greve06
Reviews.Content: We shopped around on our own for a good hotel in Vancouver that wasn't too expensive (we paid about $200 a night which we thought was a lot even before we showed up) and settled on Blue Horizon. All and all, it was "eh" and barely just okay. The bad news: Dirty: We were greeted each afternoon by a fly circulating in our room. The tub had mold/mildew/stuff growing that shouldn't be on the tile. NASTY! Things felt dingy overall, though I do like things tidy so consider that. The workout stuff was very old and odd. We're all about going green but c'mon. Can't provide soap, shampoo and stuff? The restroom was insanely small. Sheets had hair in them (when we arrived, so not ours!) Overall, everything was pretty old and worn (from the tv which had bad reception to the tattered curtains), but I'm told that's the norm in VC. The good parts: the location - right on Robson (they happily accomodated our request for a quiet room, higher up - if you stay here, do the same as most rooms are RIGHT in front of the elevators go for an 01 or 02 room number) the view - very pretty! the bed was comfy We did think of changing hotels but decided to make the best of it; however, neither my spouse or I would ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: WarksTravelplanner
Reviews.Content: Great location on Robson Street with downtown and Stanley Park in walking distance. Excellent views from the rooms on the higher floors. Probably the best value you could get in central Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Horizon is great”
Reviews.Author: Renee26
Reviews.Content: Not knowing anything about Vancouver, I decided on the Blue Horizon for my one night in the city. It was great. I was traveling alone and felt safe in the area, it was close to many things - a nice walk to Stanley Park, lots of restaurants and shopping, a short drive to Granville Island.... It was convenient, very clean, great views! I'd suggest getting a room on the top half of the hotel - it's only $10 more I think and worth the beautiful views. When I checked in for a queen deluxe in the 15-30 floor range, they graciously offered me the executive suite on the 30th floor, king bed, separate living room, 2 bathrooms. More than I needed, but it was lovely! I'd highly recommend the Blue Horizon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: nejmaps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after a 7-night Alaskan cruise. The room was 3-4 times larger than our cabin! Clean, comfortable with a great view, it was a good way to ease back into "real" life. The staff was very accomodating and helpful. We ate dinner and breakfast in the restaurant in the hotel, and the food was good and the service friendly and efficient. Our biggest mistake was taking the Vancouver Trolley Tour that stops right out front. It was HORRIBLE! One driver actually threatened people with the trolley. I spoke with the staff at the front desk as we were checking out about our experiences, and they listened intently and took notes. Hopefully they won't be recommending it to their guests (it would be MUCH cheaper to hire a taxi to tour the city!) The location is great, staff friendly, rooms comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again very happily!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 4 nights at the Blue Horizon on the 26th floor...Everything about our stay was great...Clean room, nice view, comfy bed..great location, friendly staff...what more could u ask for!! Ate breakfast everyday at the Inlet Restaurant, and it was very good, no complaints. Will stay again at the Blue Horizon when we return to Vancouver (and btw, we just loved Vancouver, such a friendly laid back city!!)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pokegodess
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location! The hotel personnel were absolutely wonderful in every way and so helpful. HIghly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Blue Horizon is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Fly5
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with other reviews on the great location. I found the hotel to be clean and to have good service. The beds were especially nice with white comforters.

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: momToronto
Reviews.Content: great location on Robson. clean large king size room. helpful staff. ask for higher floor the view is amazing. very small and very old workout room. small pool

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: CityGirlDoxie
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location is great, right on Robson. The staff was friendly. But it's really all about the room and the view. The room was spacious and comfortable. The view was breathtaking. Only negative was the tiny one person at a time bathroom. But who cares. I can't wait to go back and stay there again. This is the one place we stayed on our trip that we were recommending to everyone we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: kaudrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of July before our cruise. We had a huge corner room with a little balcony. Beds were VERY comfortable, staff was friendly, small pool and hot tub were nice. Close to Stanley Park, the marina, and a bunch of bars/restaurants - the location was great. It's a great deal for the very expensive Vancouver! We'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Blue Horizon!!!”
Reviews.Author: OZTravelbugs
Reviews.Content: My family & I only spent 1 night here but it was great,. No problems what so ever with checking in or out, and we arrived early. We had a room with 2 queen beds and it was a really good size room, everything we needed. We have 2 young children & there was plenty of room for them. Location was just awesome. Definately would come back here again.!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWearyMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because of its awesome rating on TripAdvisor. It was as we expected! Great location, close to Stanley Park and shopping, easy to get to from Vancouver Airport. Room was spacious, clean, great view of English Bay from our window. Beds were comfy and bathroom had good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “5th time here!!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBender
Reviews.Content: I have been in Vancouver about 6 times, sometimes on conference, mostly vacation ( Whistler,Tofino,Okenagan etc..) and all but one of those times I spent at The Blue Horizon, the one time I didn't I regretted it. No frills, seems to be a converted apartment (?) but wow, you are in the middle of Robson St, the views out to English Bay are incredible and you juct can't beat the price for location. Will be staying again and splurge for the higher rooms but make sure you ask for a view of English Bay

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: labern116
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of the Whistler Mountaineer tour. Hotel was a good location. Room was big but not the cleanest but it served its purpose. Bathoom was on the small side. Took the shuttle from the airport for C13.75 per person but made a lot of stops. Took a cab back to the airport for C32. Spent our day by taking a train to the waterfront, then a ferry to North Vancouver. Took a bus to Stanley Park and got on a free shuttle bus around the park. Ended the day by walking down to English Bay Beach and had a nice dinner at Milestones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sophisticato
Reviews.Content: The highlight of our trip was staying at Blue Horizon. The service was excellent as well as the location. The staff were not overbearing and were very helpful. Excellent gelato place across the street and around the corner there is an excellent Chinese restaurant, Kirin. Do not go to the Whole Foods store, Capers. It is expensive and the staff are rude. Best coffee is next to the Fairmont Hotel - a cafe called Argentios. If I am ever in Vancouver again, I will stay at Blue Horizon. Very comfortable bed and excellent views from the room too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MCastle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our Canadian tour and was generally very pleased. The hotel is right in the centre of all action with plenty of restaurants and shops on the doorstep. The restaurant in the lobby was also very good and reasonably priced. Our room on the 26th floor was spacious, pleasant and clean with fantastic views although the bathroom and corridors were much smaller. Staff were helpful despite long queues to check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “An all-round fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PeteSouthportUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a month in British Columbia, culminating in five nights at the Blue Horizon. What a fabulous hotel! Our visit did not start well, as our credit card was refused at reception (entirely the fault of our credit card company) but instead of making us feel embarrassed, the hotel staff could not have been nicer!. Our room was out of this world, with two huge beds, a great lounge area, and magnificent views. The restaurant was well run, with excellent food, and great views of the tree lined street, so we could eat breakfast and dinner whilst watching the world go by. As Vancouver is still my favourite city in the world, we will be returning, and will make a point of going back tio the Blue Horizon. - Pete Stephenson, Southport UK

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bubbavon
Reviews.Content: THe Blue Horizon is just like described in previous reviews. I can add a few things. We were on the third floor facing Robson. Although we had our patio door closed most of the time and the AC on, we did not hear any street noise that disturbed us unlike a previous review. Staff were very courteuos. Rooms had nice robes, safe, fridge, coffes pot and teas pot, hairdryer. TV was small at 20 inches. The main doors lock at 11pm and the only way in is on the side with your room key. I had mine evrerytime but the front desk staff are a skeleton screw after 11pm. If you forget yours there is no buzzer and I wonder as to how loud you will have to bag on the door to get lt in. This is intended as a security feature but a buzzer to the front desk would be nice. Again it was never an issue for me but it made me wonder. Only 2.5 blocks from the sky train. If you want a better than average hotel in the heart of downtown, that is walking distance to everything, at a reasonable rate, I whole heartedly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: JenC-7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! It seems to be reasonably priced for the area. The location is perfect, right on Robson Street, which is the main drag for restaurants and shops downtown. Local buses stop along the street frequently, but the hotel is so central that we walked almost everywhere. The hotel is modern and clean and our room was quite large, though the bathroom could have been bigger. There is a restaurant/bar in the lobby which was convenient, we ate breakfast there and it was pretty good. The hotel has a parking garage attached, which was nice since we had a car. It is $14 a day, so not cheap, but parking is at a premium downtown so relatively speaking it is not a bad value. The staff was very helpful and friendly, though my husband and I are pretty "low maintenance" and didn't ask for much other than for directions a couple of times. The absolute best thing about our stay was the balcony off our room. The view was GORGEOUS! We were out there every night of our stay with cocktails to watch the sunset. There is a liquor store a few blocks away, so we bought some beer and were able to keep it cold in the room since the minibar had plenty of room. Other reviewers have mentioned that they had a problem with street noise; our room was on the 19th floor and we had no problem, couldn't hear a thing! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's pretty nondescript style-wise, so if you are looking for a charming or stylish hotel it might not be for you. If you are just looking for a central, clean, medium-priced hotel with good amenities it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I chose Blue Horizon!”
Reviews.Author: angiebombshell
Reviews.Content: I chose the Blue Horizon for a 2-night stay in June based on reviews from tripadvisor. We were on a 2-week road trip around the Pacific NW and were trying to keep a decent budget, and this hotel looked like the best value. I'm so glad I stayed here! The hotel was centrally located and within walking distance to Stanley Park, lots of shopping on Robson Street, great restaurants, etc. We were even able to walk to the SeaBus terminal which took us over to the bus station up to Grouse Mountain. Basically we could do all our sightseeing conveniently from the hotel location. The room was also great - nothing fancy, but the bed was comfy and the room was clean, which are my two must-haves. They also have balconies in every room with spectacular views!! We were on the 28th floor and it was just awesome. If you are going to be out and about and just need a clean, comfy place to sleep without too many extras, this is the hotel for you! One thing to know is that the parking lot for the hotel is also a public lot and they told us not to leave ANYTHING in our car. They had security, but apparently this is a huge problem in all of Vancouver. Being on a 2-week road trip that also involved camping, we had a full car. We took our valuables up to the room and covered the rest with a blanket and all was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great views, great value!”
Reviews.Author: russellcoombes
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon was recommended to me by a friend of mine who used to live in Vancouver, and it was a worthy recommendation. We arrived and were met my pleasant and helpful staff, who gave us lots of information about Vancouver before leaving us to look around. We were extremely impressed with the room...although it was a little dated, it was certainly better than most, and was clean and extremely spacious. The bathroom was spotless. We had paid for a better quality of room, and I had asked for the room to be as close to the top as possible. The Blue Horizon were only to happy to meet my requests. That meant that my Wife and I were given one of the best city-views I have ever experienced. It was an absolute pleasure to overlook downtown Vancouver early in the morning or late at night. My Wife and I enjoyed the breakfast outside the hotel on various occasions. I wouldn't claim it's the best food I've ever eaten, but the different styles of Eggs Benedict were all extremely well cooked, tasty and good value. We had a very pleasant outside meal for an evening also...during the meal, I literally paid a tramp to dance for us, who was also good value. Overall, this hotel was a great experience and I wouldn't hesitate in going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Ktedwards
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a tour of Canada and this was our first stop for 3 nights and it was a great start to our trip. I did a great deal of research planning the trip and I was so pleased with this choice of hotel. The location is fantastic, right on Robson Street in the heart of the main shops and restaurants. We didn't pay for one of the higher rooms so we were on the 6th floor, this does mean you don't get the amazing views but the room was still great. We had a balcony and huge windows which made the large room really airy and bright. Although we weren’t that high you could still see the mountains and the park from the window. The room had the biggest bed I think I have ever slept in and the comfiest pillows possible. This really is a great hotel for the money, when I was researching the area Vancouver seemed generally really pricey, this hotel is definitely worth the price you pay and you won't be disappointed. Please feel free to ask me any questions about this hotel or Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Central but think if you want to relax”
Reviews.Author: frenchbosh
Reviews.Content: A rather disappointing hotel considering the weather which was not conducive to outside dining..... advertised a pool and disco, restaurant and that it was central.... it was, all true but there was nowhere to sit and relax inside, particularly around reception on a cold rainy evening. Staff bright and pleasant. Spacious, bright room with fridge. tv and the possibility to cater for ourselves but overall general hotel was rather dowdy with small corridors that had no air and smelled of fire. Rooms also need upgrading since rather tired. Great if you just want to sleep after long flight and also very near good restaurants with the buzz of a shopping district. Very good access to trolly 'tourist trams'. Outside pick up the tour which will take you easily to all cultural sights and main districts in central Vancouver for 2 days. The 'hop on and hop off' system is excellent. E-mail ticket was accepted and there were fun commentaries. Altogether a good place to start the adventure of discovering Vancouver but I think there are better places around if you have abit more cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Jane_1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in vancouver as the first 3 nights of our honeymoon. I rang the Blue Horizon and booked the hotel off the strength of the tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. We stayed on the 2nd to top floor, the views (particulary sun set) were amazing. The room decor was a little dated, but the room was big, clean and everything you would expect from the good rating on tripadvisor. We ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning, which had a good choice. We also had dinner one night (something quick), which was ok. There are so many nice cafes/ restaurants close to the hotel on Robson street. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends & family, and we would also stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: RyanK.
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through the Whistler Mountaineer web site (fantastic day trip) and it was the cheapest of all the hotels they recommended. However, being on a budget and seeing the great reviews here I decided to give it a try. Boy am I glad I did! Spectacular views of either the city or the bay with a true walk out balcony. *My room was very clean. *View of the city from the 30th floor is beautiful even if you are surrounded by some other high rises. *Check in staff were very friendly and efficient. *I got to check in early 9:00am *Large spacious rooms with lots of windows *Mini bar prices were actually reasonable *Fridge could have been a little colder but no big deal. If I am every back in the area I will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Traveller50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old but the location on Robson Street is within walking distance of many good restaurants like the Keg Steak House and Moxie's. We stayed on the 27th floor with a stunning view of the water and mountains. The queen bed was comfortable and the room was a good size but as I said it was tired looking due to its age. The elevator thankfully worked well and sped us from ground floor up with no delays. There is a cafe on the ground floor with indoor and outdoor dining which is very convenient for a quick breakfast if you are in a hurry. We paid CA $179 which for a large city is a bargin. I would definitely stay here again. Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Qestia
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why other tripadvisor members, who seem like a picky bunch, are raving about this hotel. It could be that it's the best downtown Vancouver has to offer. We were disappointed and almost checked out early. Still, when we lowered our expectations the stay was pleasant enough. First of all, the hotel is in an extremely busy downtown section of Vancouver, which may suit some people, but it's not what we were expecting. We were warned repeatedly while checking in not to leave anything in our car, as car windows have been smashed in to steal a quarter. Wow. Not a great introduction to our stay. The room was nice enough, clean, but the decor throughout the building was wildly outdated. The fridge in the room was so warm a quart of milk spoiled within the day. The views from the room were good, but blocked by the many neighboring tall buildings. The pool was the size of a large bathtub, and stained. Our 3 year old enjoyed it though, he was about the only one who could fit in it. If I'm ever in Vancouver again I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: coxo66
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place AND really great value, when you consider the other deals on offer. Great location right on Robson, near loads of bars, restaurants. (Try Moxies and the Red Robin) just across the street. (much better then some places twice the price) Definately worth the extra $10 for the higher rooms. Fantastic place

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: happywiner
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Friday before Memorial Day on the way to an Alaska cruise and upon our return for four nights the following weekend. First night on 29th floor with harbor view. Magnificent! The return four nights on floor 9. The first room on floor 10 had an unpleasant odor and the staff moved us immediately and were very pleasant, as they were our entire visit. Agree it is somewhat outdated but still well worth the price for location and service. The street noise on lower floors of Robson Street side can be quire loud on Friday and Saturday nights, uppers not so bad. Their coffee shop is a great place to have breakfast (eggs benes are especially good) before hitting the sights; Vancouver Aquarium, Capilano Bridge, Granville Island...we ran out of time. What a beautiful city. Recommend renting a car to get to more sights. The trolley looks like fun but takes more time to get around, $37.00 for a two day pass with the dollar off coupon from the hotel front desk. Moxie's across the street has great dinners and the Greek restaurant two blocks up (I forgot the name) had very tasty lunches.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: katie26
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the other comments- a superb hotel with excellent service.and great location When we arrived to check in we had been upgraded to the 29th floor and had the most lovely suite. After leaving a small cruise cabin it seemed very spacious. front desk staff could not have been more helpful and food we had in legends was very good. if you want a fantastic local brunch i would recommend joe's Grill on Davie street as this was recommended to us by a store assistant and was fantastic. very cheap and really busy probably as aresult of the wonderful brunch. they close every day at 5 but well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a first-time trip to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LadyoftheMoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Memorial Day weekend (US), and its a great hotel for a first time traveller to Vancouver. As others have said, its a great location, a nice hotel under $300 a night, and is very comfortable. All of that aside, the best part of the room is the view. It was amazing, and we spent tons of time out on our 29th floor balcony drinking it all in. Stay on the Robson St. side of the hotel (we had 2905) for the best view. Our friends had 2908 which was on the opposite side, and while lovely, could not match the dramatic harbor view that we had. I think the hotel tries to make up for the lack of a view, though, in those "lesser view" rooms as it was somewhat larger than mine, with more floor space and two chairs, compared to our one. The rooms are somewhat dated, you can really see how they've updated somethings (new bathroom vanity) but not others (bathtub was shallow and pale pink, with a damaged finish). This aside, the "'datedness" was not so dramatic that I had that icky wonder-how-many-thousands-have-been-here-before-me feeling, if you know what I mean. Good stuff about the hotel was the room, the view, and the location. It was very quiet, and for a busy weekend I had no complaints at all about noise. Negatives, which are more inconvenient than anything else: tiny elevators -- more than once on the way down we were too full to take any more passengers; the very small lobby means check-out is a zoo, and lastly, I'm not sure how the hotel handles room assignments but it seemed a bit odd to me -- when they made the reservation my friend got the impression they were assigning us specific rooms right then, and she was told we would not be on the same floor (you can't reserve through the hotels website and have to call directly). Then they arrived before us, and were told their room wasn't ready, so when we arrived about 20 mins later and were immediately checked in (same room type, same floor) I found that a little odd, and potentially frustrating for guests traveling together. Her room wasn't ready for another 2 hours. All in all though, this is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and quality base for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dedicatedtraveller
Reviews.Content: Room 1602, not surprisingly was on the 16th floor! it was very large with 3 sets of windows and a door leading onto a small balcony - as a result it was very light and airy. The views from the balcony were good. The beds were very comfortable (man made duvet though) with assorted types of pillows to satisfy all tastes. The room was quiet and we slept very well, only occassionally hearing traffic noise outside but never enough to really disturb us. The room had a fridge, coffee maker (one sachet of coffee given) and sachets of milk powder - no liquid milk. Reception provided a kettle but as these are limited suggest taking a dual voltage travel kettle if tea or instant coffee required. The London Drug Store, literally a stones throw from the hotel (turn left as you exit the main entrance) sold milk, coffee, tea bags, biscuits, soft drinks etc The bathroom was very small - strange when the room was so enormous - but was perfectly fine. Water was always hot. All fixtures and fittings in both the room and bathroom were in a very high state of repair and everything was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was available in 'Inlets' just off reception on the ground floor. We found the service to be very friendly, efficient and helpful. A very good range of hot and cold items/dishes/combinations offered at incredibly good prices. All the food we had was piping hot, generous in portion size and very tasty! Blue Horizon is sited in an excellent location on Robson Street - we were able to walk easily, to everywhere we wanted to go around the city. We would go back to Blue Horizon and room 1602 without hesitation. One thing I'd recommend any traveller to Vancouver to see - The Butchart Gardens on Vancouver Island - breath takingly beautiful, plus Victoria is a delightful little city to walk around afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: christine5502
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! i loved it for the price it was absolutely worth it. great area. the beds were great the pillows also great. the only thing that was pretty dated and old was the bathtub/shower. we were on the 30 floor very worth it. highly recommended plus around the corner there is a great thia restaurant try the pad thai..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a vibrant City”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon sits in an enviable position along Robson Street in Downtown Vancouver, only a few minutes walk from many of the City's major attractions, as well as the port, Stanley Park and Seaplane terminal. The Lobby area although small, is smart and attractive; staff very professional and courteous; the 4 lifts quick. I'd requested a high floor room with a view when booking, and was not disappointed. My room was 2904 (29th floor) and I had a superb view of the South & East of Downtown, as well as English Bay. The room was almost perfect, good size, huge windows, a balcony, desk. wardrobe, large screen TV, coffee maker, en suite with tub & toiletries...and the most comfortable bed I've slept in for some considerable time. The only omission was double glazing - perhaps a problem for those on lower floors. There is a small pool, sauna and fitness room on the 2nd level and a restaurant on the ground floor - breakfast here was nice, and I tried something different each of the 4 mornings during my stay. There are so many hotels to choose from in Vancouver, but the Blue Horizon represents good value in my book, and if you're lucky enough to get room 2904, you'll appreciate your choice even more as you watch the sun set across English Bay with a cup of coffee in your hand. A great find. I'm sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKiwi
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, great location. Good views from the rooms. Didn't notice any street noise etc. Had some problems checking in: Noted on the reservation that there would be two of us, one turning up earlier than the other, however they had no record of this and got highly confused. Also had our check-in/out dates incorrect (we were to be there for 3 nights, but already had us checked out when we turned up). After much searching for the still missing original booking (wouldn't accept our printout confirmation), decided they would only charge us for two nights as we'd already been charged for 1 (cancellation fee). When we went to check out there was no record of the above at all and they were determined to charge us for all 3 nights. In the end we only paid for the 2 nights (& confirmed credit card had already been charged). Would be very careful about booking if I were to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMPPerth
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, brilliant location right on Robson Street. Very close to all the shops and downtown. Rooms were huge & lovely and the view from the Balcony amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: Comox123
Reviews.Content: I am in Vancouver a lot and have stayed at many of the downtown hotels. This one is clean, has comfortable beds, snuggly robes and complementary internet access (which many hotels charge an arm and a leg for). It does not have room service but there is a restaurant downstairs and lots available on the street. It was relatively quiet and has a parking garage (charge extra). All in all I would stay here again and feel this hotel provides good value - especially for the internet price of $109.

Reviews.Title: “Money Stolen In the Room Safe”
Reviews.Author: Mineiro66
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good rooms, good facilities, located in a very privileged area where you can shop and move easily to the town's best attractions. I had some money kept in the room safe that was stolen. I was pretty sure I have left it there and very well locked all the time. Talked to the manager but the whole staff seemed not to believe my story. They didn' t give a damn. Better spend a bit more in a safest place. Run away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: salleeanndevon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in the middle of March, at the beginning of our trip to BC. Our room was on the 26th floor (of 31) and had great views over the city towards English Bay. The room was large with good facilities and a decent sized bathroom, although we found the bath was very uncomfortable to lie down in. Mini bar, hair dryer,coffee making facilities provided although no kettle to make an 'english brew'! We weren't affected by any road noise but we were very high up! Reception staff were average i.e. no offer of help with luggage, constantly answering phone calls whilst dealing with checking us in/out, perhaps they were short staffed? Breakfast was very good,if using the restaurant in the evenings make sure that you check the closing times as we went in at 8.30 and they were closing at 9pm so no time for pudding! Shananigans the bar next door is a little tired looking but does great food and drinks and has great cheerfull service. The Hotel is situated right on Robson, one of the main streets in downtown Vancouver therefore fantastic for shopping, eating out and general sightseeing. One of the sightseeing tourist buses stops right outside the front. We hired a car from Thrifty whose offices were 5 mins down the road (based at the Landmark Hotel) this worked out fine as the hotel has parking if you need, which is charged on a daily rate or there is on street meter parking. We also caught the airport transporter bus from Vancouver Int which pulls up around the corner outside the Palisades Hotel, this is worth doing as they run very frequently and are good value for money (we got a return ticket for $16), its a great way of seeing the city when you first arrive. Vancouver is a great city to walk around and the Blue Horizon is a practical and affordable choice situated in a perfect location, not far from Stanley Park or the waterfront where the Expo/conference centre and cruise ships are.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: AmyLJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue Horizon for 2 nights and cannot find any faults whatsoever with this hotel! We paid for a superior room to get a great view but even we were amazed by the view that awaited us of Robson Street, the mountains and the harbour from the 23rd floor - see attached pics. Very large, immaculate room with all the amenities you could need. Truly wonderful location, we walked to Stanley Park in only 20 or so minutes and Canada Place & Coal Harbour only a 10 minute walk. Previous reviewers have mentioned the beds and I must agree that it was the most comfortable bed I've slept in at a hotel and I've stayed in quite a few 5 star hotels. Parking very convenient and the hotel restaurant, Inlet's Bistro, served a delicious breakfast (not included in price of room though). Reception were very friendly & were most helpful regarding our lost luggage. I spent a lot of time researching our accommodation for Vancouver and am very glad I chose the Blue Horizon. All in all, most highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Irelandsandyireland
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed six nights at the Blue Horizon. We were in Vancouver for a wedding. On arrival the reception staff were very friendly and welcoming which was great after a long flight. We got a great room with a fab view of the city and harbour in the distance. It was a large room with all the usual facilities and a balcony. The bed was so comfortable and definitely the best bed I have come across in a hotel. After the long flight it was great to have such a comfortable bed and a quiet room. The location of the Blue Horizon is on the main shopping street in Vancouver. We were within walking distance to most of the sights. Breakfast wasn't included in our rate but there are plenty of nearby cafes etc. We didn't eat in the hotel but there is a restaurant off the main reception. We went there one evening, were shown a table but ended up being ignored and never got to order etc. After being reminded the waitress promised she would be with us in a few minutes but failed to turn up so needless to say we left!! But that was the only bad experience we had in The Blue Horizon. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody. It is very reasonable and in a great location. The staff are so professional and made are stay very relaxed. If we ever return to Vancouver we will return to The Blue Horizon for definite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elmoj25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. Came over to Vancouver with a friend who was not used to the city. Check in was very good, quick and friendly. We were upgraded to almost the top floor facing towards Robson St. The room was fairly nice and large. A balcony which was nice but did not venture out there. We had a ton of windows which gave us lots of light and view of the city. A balcony which was also nice. The bathroom was average, the beds average, the room just average. But I beleive you get what you pay for. The location and views are worth the price of your room which is not very much. The accomodations are pretty basic if that is the kind of thing you are looking for. A pretty basic hotel to suit your needs for a night or two in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: clare-paul
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, located in the center of all the shops, 5 minutes drive to stanley park. we stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, the hotel lobby was really clean and the staff were nice. we stayed very high up on the 29th floor, great views but a litlle scary looking down. didnt attemp it to much!! the room was clean, a little dated compaired to other hotels we stayed in on our visit but was fine. bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: MandyPB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blue Horizon for 11 nights in January 2008. The rooms are excellent and spotless and come equipped with a fridge, safe and tea/coffee making facilities. Beds, pillows and linen are very clean and comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. The only drawback is that the pool looks dirty and the exercise room consists of a few bits of equipment next to the pool. I did not use these facilities and instead resorted to long baths in the very clean bathroom. Locations is excellent - close to shopping, Stanley Park, ice skating rink and these is a good supermarket about a 5 - 10 mins walk away. Also, there is a very cheap internet cafe across the road (it is upstairs in an Asian grocery stall). If you are coming from Vancouver airport, the shuttle will drop you at Pacific Palisades which is round the corner to the Blue Horizon (about a 2 min walk and I made it OK with 2 huge suit cases!) I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. At CDN 109 a night for a single room, it is 5 star comfort without the price tag. Beware of other cheaper hotels this end of Robson Street as they cannot compare with the quality of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Montalivet2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights on the 19th floor before off to Alaska. Great views over the city. Room was top notch, clean with two large doubles and staff could not have been more helpful. Ate in the restaurant which was very good and waiter even went off to get information for us about cold climate clothing for us, while we ate. Is situated on the main Robson Street and walking distance to many places such as China town and Old gas town whilst also walking distance from the Sky Train which gets you to most other places cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Beamerjo
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, close to Stanley Park, Robson Street and lots of great restaurants. The rooms were spacious and clean, the view from my 20th floor room was spectacular, the service was great, and even the restaurant was good. The best part is that the rates are very reasonable. I never had a problem catching a taxi, there was always one parked out front when it was needed. It's in a very safe area, so walking any time of day or evening was no problem. The rooms had an excellent bed, a sitting area and desk and a large bathroom. I felt like a queen! I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony_au77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem in the city of Vancouver. I came all the way from Australia with no particular place to go, and I stumbled across this hotel with the advice of a taxi driver. We were travelling to the city centre when I made my decision and I am so glad I stayed at this hotel. It was a comfortable and safe place and made me feel very welcome after travelling so far. From the moment I arrived, I was amazed at the great service I received. The hotel desk was extremely punctual and helpful. The hotel guests were also friendly which made me feel right at home. The hotel room I stayed on was the 6th floor which is not that high up, but despite this, the view was amazing. It came complete with its own balcony, HUGE room, great ensuite and bathroom. Two King size beds ..... big tv, great couches and a office desk. It was more than I bargained for. Let me say, I was very impressed. Defintely the best hotel I have stayed at anywhere in the world. Even though you can tell its a 80's hotel from the outside, inside it was clean, new upholstery and incredible views. I will defintely stay here again when I visit Vancouver ! 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the convenience”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingHobo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blue Horizon for a couple nights on a business trip and really enjoyed it. It's easy to miss as it looks like just another storefront on Robson St. but once inside it's quite nice. A lot of the people in my company, located 2 blocks away, didn't even know that it was there. But there are lots of good places to eat and drink within a couple blocks of the hotel and you can make it on foot to pretty much any part of downtown easily. The room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable, which is the main thing I look for in a hotel. Bathroom was small and basic. But the view from the balcony was very nice (though it was freezing in Vancouver, so you didn't want to spend too much time out there). They had a good restaurant downstairs for breakfast, which was a nice touch as well. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska
Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations, Helpful Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: trilobite01
Reviews.Content: It was just alright. You can tell they are doing a lot of remodeling. But somethings just weren't great. The pool area was not in good shape. The hot tub is very old and wasn't very clean. The workout center was literally 2 treadmills and one bike machine. However, the rooms were very comfortable and clean. The bathroom had been remodeled. Not bad, overall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLonorthofsixty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blue Horizon on Robson for 13 nights and have to say that it is a great hotel. I had a room on the 23rd floor with views of the mountains and the ocean! The room was huge and the 2 queen beds were very comfortable. I liked the fact that it is a green, non-smoking hotel and with few rooms on each floor as it has all corner suites. Therefore there was little traffic in the halls. It's right on Robson where you can "shop til you drop"! The front desk staff were very helpful, the restaurant was good for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Although there is no room service you can order and pick-up your food and take to your room. I was too busy to use the spa amenities but they looked fine. Overall I would absolutely use this hotel again when staying in Vancouver. I booked it through the BC tourism site and got a very reasonable rate!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the Bue Horizon....”
Reviews.Author: hardworker
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and in Lonely Planet guide book. I agree that the location is good although situated at the less salubrious end of Robson Street. Great room - I booked a Queen Superior and it was worth the extra for the the view from 27th floor. Size and comfort of room were more than adequate although not the same can be said for the public rooms especially the pool area. The food in restaurant was nothing special although good choice of breakfasts. I did have a fabulous time in Vancouver and if I return would possibly consider Blue Horizon again although i advise single female traveller to take care in its surrounding neighbourhood after dark

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: SmilingSixties
Reviews.Content: Hotel conveniently located for walking to Gastown, Canada Place, museums, and also for Stanley Park. Room was large with huge bed, clean, good views from balcony. Useful to request high floor to reduce street noise. Hotel restaurant good, but wide choice of alternatives right on doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOMMY1959
Reviews.Content: Good hotel cleen with a good restaurant. We stayed on the 28th floor and the views were terrific, We took two rooms one for my wife and I and one for the daughter and her friend both rooms were big with two large beds large cable tv, mini bar, fantastic shower and bath, Most of the staff were very helpfull and friendly. breakfast in the hotel wast great plenty of choice we had ours there every morning mostly full breakfasts to last us until late dinner, and yes some nights we ate in the hotel. anyone going here (VANCOVER) from the UK will find most things cost about the same some cheaper and some dearer but in the case of food the quality is in my opinion fare better for your money, and the restaurants in and around the hotel are great you really don't need to walk fare i hope you find this helpfull.......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmaker4
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights in Sep before going on an Alaskan cruise. Location was very convenient and close too all amenities & shops. Room was spacious, bright & airy. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Love the hotel. Found it through this forum. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “The Blue Horizon was Great”
Reviews.Author: lesbriggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon a couple nights in August 07, and very much enjoyed our stay. Our room was large, comfortable, and clean. The views from our balcony were great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was easy walking distance to almost everything. We will definitely stay at the Blue Horizon the next time we're in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: PharmGal2121
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel and found it to be as expected for $140/night. We requested a room above the 13th floor (for a view) but were told that they were all full, despite seeing 4 other couples come in after us and request rooms above the 13th floor and they all were granted them. The front desk staff was very uptight and would not give recommendations on where to eat, what to do and see, etc. They seemed more concerned about helping the "high class" guests than us. Overall, the room was fine and it was within walking distance to sights, but I would not spend that much on a hotel with poor service.

Reviews.Title: “You could do better, you could do worse”
Reviews.Author: chalfontim
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Blue Horizon for 3 nights at the end of Aug '07. As others have said, location is very good, right in the main shopping district. Hotel itself is OK, a typical 3 star quality hotel which could do with a bit of updating. Room was of a good size, view was OK although you are surrounded by other buildings (a bit obvious that, given it is in the heart of the city), bathroom was quite small and needs modernising. Most of the guests at the hotel seemd to be coach tourists. All in all, its fine if you accept it for what it is and want the location, I think if I ever go back to Vancouver I'll pay a bit extra and try somewhere more upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff whats makes it, Management makes it bad.”
Reviews.Author: hammermill1
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Blue Horizon for many years. People like Todd on the Front Desk makes our stays usually very special as he knows us by name and treats us like VIPs all the time. Little things he remembers makes the difference and he seems to know every restaurant in the city. We have noticed a BIG turnover in staff at the hotel and a lot of unhappy staff there. Seems like a lot of time understaffed at the Front Desk and Inlets. But people like Todd still have a smile of his face and still can laugh. I hope when we go back his smile will still be there. To bad Carmen, Chris and Brian are still not around.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: Mommy126
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Blue Horizon for 4 nights at very end of Sept. Travelled alone with my 2 1/2 year old son. I had reserved a room with 1 queen bed on the upper floors and upon arrival, they gave me a room with 2 queen beds! The room was huge, clean and had comfy beds. The mini fridge came in handy. We were on the 27th floor so it was fairly quiet, and there wasn't much traffic on the floor itself as there are only 8 rooms per floor. The view of English Bay was fantastic. Wonderful location too. I was able to walk with my son in a stroller to the aquarium in Stanley park a couple of times, about a 20 min. brisk walk. Breakfasts at the restaurant were not bad and were plentiful. Had no problems with front desk, everyone seemed pleasant and answered any questions I had. It's a good hotel for families, however if you need to eat take-out in the room with kids it's a bit difficult since there is no little dining table with chairs. Also, my son was able to easily unlock the door and open it, there was no chain-thingy to prevent the door from fully opening. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views, great location”
Reviews.Author: holidaysabroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on arrival in Canada and 1 night in transit for the Rocky Montaineer. Hotel very well positioned on main shopping street, and within reasonable walking distance of central downtown, Stanley Park, waterfront and even English Bay. Clever construction means all roooms have a corner view. Take the advice of other reviews and book a superior room to get a stunning view. If you can afford it, book the best rooms - we got a complimentary upgrade to th 29th floor (next to top) for the 4 nights and the views from there were amazing. Breakfast is OK, pool is nice but limited other facilities

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jillpea
Reviews.Content: We had a superior queen - so two double beds on the 27th floor with free internet access. Great views down Robson Street and across English Bay. Yes there is some noise from the street below, but surely that is to be expected if you are staying in the middle of a city. Some parts of the room and bathroom seemed slightly worn but everything was very clean so no complaints. Prices seemed reasonable too for a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: CHT
Reviews.Content: From my TripAdvisor (and other) research, this hotel appeared to be the best value -- in fact, with its location, I even questioned whether "it was too good to be true." It definitely wasn't. As noted in most previous reviews, the location is great -- right on the best street in the city, and only a fifteen minute walk down to English Harbor. Our double room was good sized, with a very nice balcony. Although some TripAdvisor critiques complain about the noise from down below, we chose to stay on a higher floor so that we would have a nice view, and the alleged noise was no problem. We also found the staff to be efficient and helpful. After arriving on the train from Jasper (after a night with very little sleep), we asked if we could have a room as soon as possible (at 10:30 A.M.) In a half hour the staff had arranged for our room. There is also a nice indoor pool area in the hotel. There is no real difference between a "Standard" Double and a "Deluxe" Double except for the view -- The "Deluxes" are above the 14th floor, and very much worth the slight extra charge for the two reasons discussed above. We had a room on the 20th floor looking down on Robson St., and, in the distance, English Bay. If you are in Vancouver in late July/early August, you can actually sit on your balcony (if you have a room facing Robson St.) and watch the International Fireworks Competition a mile away as we did -- what a felicitous perk that was!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulInOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon from 9/13 through 9/15/07 as part of a trip through Seattle/Vancouver/Victoria. We selected the Blue Horizon based upon recommendations at Tripadvisor.com. The best part part about the Blue Horizon is its location in downtown Vancouver on the busy hub of the shopping/dining district on Robson Street. It was easy to walk to most destinations, and the ethnic restaurants in the area were outstanding -- everything from French crepes to Japanese sushi to Chinese noodles to Indian curry. The best part of the hotel was the beds -- easily one of the most comfortable mattresses we have every slept on! Our bed was actually a queen-sized bed, though advertised as a king. You could select synthetic or down pillows, too! The room was fairly large, with a chair, desk, full closet, and in-room safe. There was also a coffee pot and a minibar/fridge, which was a little hard to use to store your own stuff. We were on the 29th floor which had a great view of the harbor, and even (curiously....) an open balcony. However, the room seemed old and a little dingy/worn. There was free wired internet available in the room (not wireless) and the hotel included the CAT 5 cabling. The elevators were a little small and few in number, so you have to wait for elevators sometimes. The hotel lobby was small and a little cramped. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants so we can't comment on that. The hotel had parking, but charged $17 a day and also warned about frequent break-ins. We did not experience any problems, but cleared out the car just to be safe. The garage did not have any gates. There were carts available, but when we checked in (late, to be fare) we didn't see any bellboys on duty. Front desk check-in and check-out was quick, friendly, and efficient. We took a Grey Line tour of the Grouse Mountain/Capillano bridge which picked us up right out front of the hotel, which was convenient (and we highly recommend the tour....) Overall, we thought it was a little expensive for what we received, especially since parking was extra. However, the location was outstanding and the hotel room was comfortable and quiet. Especially since the room came equipped with an air purifier that, when turned up, also acted as a sound conditioner. The room A/C was on a motion sensor, so when we left the room, it shut off. However, it cooled down quickly so this was not a real problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat combination of location, comfort, service”
Reviews.Author: kaibab1
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon proved to be an ideal home base for a comprehensive visit to Vancouver. It is conveniently located on Robson St. (one of Vancouver's trendy thoroughfares) from where one can easily walk to downtown, Stanley Park, the waterfront, etc. Ask for a room in one of the upper floors (the property has 30 floors) to enjoy a panoramic view of one of the world's most scenic cities. As far as we could tell, all rooms here are corner rooms (of a decent size) with balconies and there are only eight per floor, so it's hard to miss a superb panorama. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom up to date and spotless. In addition there was a fair-sized desk and large screen tv. Also, there is a convenient coffee shop/restaurant/bar on the ground floor; it serves great breakfasts at reasonable prices. While there is no doorman-bellman, front desk service is impreccable and the housekeeping beyond reproach. Bottom line: in a city of pricey inns the Blue Horizon provided a very pleasant reasonable base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel (not upscale) - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Galdo
Reviews.Content: - Although not upscale/luxury, the rooms are huge (ask for 2 double beds), tidly presented, and bright and airy. Most (if not all?) have a balcony too. - The location is second to none. Right in the heart of downtown on Robson Street (the main shopping drag). - Make sure you get a room above the 10th floor (to reduce street noise). Sure, if you can get a room at the Sheraton, Fairmont, Pan Pacific, or Marriott for the same price, stay there. But if you get a good price (as we did) it is 100% worth staying here if you're visiting Vancouver as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: mocarr
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a 4 night stay at the Blue Horizon. Family of 4 enjoyed a western facing room on the 25th floor - great sunsets. Clean modern rooms. Great location...lots of pedestrian traffic on the street, variety of restaurants, shopping, and coffee shops. Didn't use the restaurant although it seemed very busy all the time. Used the small lap pool and hot tub - warm and clean. Not the quietest location as you are on a busy street in downtown Vancouver but the white noise from the room air conditioning helped drown things out. Would stay there again and recommend to others looking for a decent quality hotel at a reasonable price. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to saty for the money”
Reviews.Author: chowskee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Tripadvsior reviews. Blue Horizon is centrally located on the busy Robson Street. There are many restaurants up and down the street. Across the street is a small Japanese market with cute Japanese girls behind the counter :D. Above the market is an internet café. If you enjoy a bustling city and don’t mind the noise, this hotel is a great place to be. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed. The swimming is a bit small, but hey what do you expect for a busy downtown hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Great value and the location for the money you will be paying. Book now!

Reviews.Title: “BLUE HORIZON - Skip It”
Reviews.Author: gooooogirl
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hype! There is nothing special about the Blue Horizon. It is run like it is an upscale hotel when indeed it is not, even though it cost as much! The room was clean, but noisy from street traffic and rundown. The bathroom and the SHEETS smell like sewer. It was difficult to fall asleep with that smell. Peeuu! The internet access was supposed to be free according to the website but it was $10.00 a day. The front desk staff was snotty and unaccommodating. When requested a late checkout, Dan, the front desk agent was not helpful. We had intended on staying at the Blue Horizon after our return from our cruise, but canceled our reservation. Not worth $150 a night! Please save your money and go somewhere else. Anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: beanstock
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is excellent. I believe it's one of two hotels on Robson St. You'll find plenty of stores and restaurants on this busy street. You can easily spend a half day going through all the shops. We had a queen superior room and were on the 22nd floor. You get great views of downtown Vancouver as well as the English Bay. We had an enjoyable stay at the hotel. The lobby is very small and there's no business center. Depending on what time you check in/out, it gets extremely crowded. There's only a couple of elevators so sometimes you'll have to wait. I believe parking was ~ $15/night. Stanley Park was a few blocks away. We drove to it rather than walk. Granville Island isn't too far either. Beds were comfortable. If you don't mind paying $200/night, you'll enjoy this hotel. Try Flavors of India (we didn't go to Original Flavors of India that's directly across from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel2112
Reviews.Content: We booked the Blue Horizon after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Everything met are expectations.....staff was very friendly, views from the 17th floor were awesome. Although we could only see a slice of the Bay, the people watching was lots of fun. The Beds were evidently put in about a month before our stay and were extremely comfortable. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Thank you Blue Horizon!

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the Bay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel042
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! I was delighted to find out we were on the 30th floor with a great view of the bay. The room had large windows on two sides with a balcony and was very clean and newly remodeled. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is in a great location, right on Robson Street, near Stanley Park, Vancouver Art Museum, and lots of shopping and restaurants. You do have to pay to park in the garage, but you have to pay to park anywhere in Vancouver. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best views ever”
Reviews.Author: paulandsarahthomas
Reviews.Content: We loved the views from the 20th floor! Location was good -- a great people watching scene. Beds were comfortable, and the rooms were well kept up. Very friendly front desk staff and convenient on site parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: SilverFoxAlberta
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon on Robson was a pleasure all around. The beds were exceptional comfortable, the view stupendous, the shower excellent and the service way above average. I think its going to get harder to book , its that good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: kj2k
Reviews.Content: Following other reviews of this hotel, we (family of 4) just stayed at this hotel before embarking on a cruise to Alaska. We found the hotel well-located right in the heart of the city (we could walk to Stanley Park and many other locations); rooms are well-sized, clean, and open-looking with balcony/large-lookout-windows on 2 sides. The staff is quite helpful, and their restaurant is also good - certainly good for breakfasts. Overall, imo, this is one of the best hotel values in Vancouver. There certainly are some better hotels there - but they are also a lot pricier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OG07
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent two nights at the Blue Horizon recently and were extremely impressed with the cleanliness and comfort of the room and the location of the hotel. Our room was spacious with two double beds and would easily have accomodated four people without feeling cramped. The hotels location is great for exploring Vancouver, located right on a lively shopping street and within easy walking distance of most of the citys attractions. This is the perfect place to stay for those that expect high standards but don't want to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Scooby353
Reviews.Content: Very impressed, staff very friendly, room clean, bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sunnysheffield
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! We found the Blue Horizon by accident. we initally checked into our pre booked hotel further up Robson (which was really quite awful). The Blue Horizon staff did their very best to accomodate us and let us look around a room first before we booked it, we got 7 nights with them, the rooms were clean and spacious. There was hardly any noise that you might expect with it being on the main road, and the balcony meant we could see the fireworks in the distance at English Bay, Would definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel111
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our cruise left the next day. Very clean, nice rooms. Spacious with a kitchenette and seating area in front of the sliding doors to the balcony. Wonderful view. (strip below, bay in the distance) I would suggest the higher level floors. It was around a 45-minute cab ride from YVR, and just minutes down the road from the cruise pier (Canada Place) Great location for walking to everything. I would definitely stay here again. (We had dinner in the restaurant - nice)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kikatika
Reviews.Content: This summer we traveled to Vancouver, BC and stayed at the Blue Horizon Hotel, we chose this hotel because of the great reviews, and truly it is was wonderful. The hotel is located in the heart of Robson St. a very popular place for shopping and dinning, full of life. The room was very spacious, confortable and clean, the view was amazing, we stayed on the 24th floor, looking towards English Bay, and we were able to enjoy the fireworks festival from the confort of our balcony. The restaurant by the lobby had great food, and the staff was very nice. I would gladly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Horizon was awesome”
Reviews.Author: bgaile
Reviews.Content: I had checked out this hotel on this website and actually changed my booking from where we were going to stay to this based on previous reviews. We were not disappointed! Hotel was beautiful, views of bay were awesome, location to all of the day and nightlfe was outstanding. In addition, the staff is unbelievably friendly and helpful (but not too much) We checked in early, no problem, they even gave us an upgrade with a better view without asking! The rooms are not large but are efficient, and sufficient and have a balcony for looking at the nightlife and the bay and the beautiful sunsets. The Blue Horizon is right on Robson Street and is close to restaurants, shopping, and you can walk down to the park at the end of Robson or take the trolley. If we ever go back to Vancouver, Blue Horizon will be calling our name.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: korro
Reviews.Content: Everytime we stay in Vancouver we stay at the Blue Horizon. My husband also uses this hotel for business travel. The service is consistently excellent, rooms clean and spaceous. The Inlets Bistro restaurant is also a consistent quality and I notice how they discretely separate the business breakfasts from the tousists and children when necessary. Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and what views!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_rocks
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Blue Horizon twice and this second visit proofed that the hotel is as good as I remembered. Firstly the location on Robson Street is great; lots of shopping and dining options right outside the hotel front door. Secondly the rooms are very big and nicely updated, we had four people sharing for three nights and there was plenty of space for everything and everybody. We had great views from our balcony (22nd floor). Hotel does not look that amazing from the outside and the public spaces are a little dated, but as said above, this does not apply to the rooms. Parking is a bit expensive, but I guess you can expect it as the location is so central.

Reviews.Title: “My Vancouver Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: John-in-Reno
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon Hotel is my home away from home in Vancouver. I've stayed there more than ten times since first discovering it in a AAA guide in 1997. My room at the Blue Horizon always feels more like my private Vancouver apartment rather than a hotel room. I'm always pleasantly welcomed by the staff, and the rooms have always been very nice. The Blue Horizon is located in an ideal spot in Vancouver, directly on Robson Street. The major sites of Vancouver are within easy walking distance: Stanley Park, Canada Place, Coal Harbor, Granville Island, the Seabus terminal, etc. The Blue Horizon is designed so that all rooms are corner rooms. Depending on your room, you might look across Burrard Inlet to the North Shore mountains, down Robson Street all the way to Mt. Baker in Washington, toward Stanley Park, or to the northwest overlooking English Bay with Vancouver Island in the distance. All rooms are large and provide wonderful views regardless of the direction they face. Facilities at the hotel are well-maintained. Superb dining choices are found throughout downtown Vancouver, but it's always pleasant to enjoy a few meals downstairs in the Blue Horizon's restaurant, Inlets Bistro. Sidewalk dining is provided during the warmer months of the year. Transportation to and from the hotel is ideal. I usually take the YVR Airporter, which stops one block from the hotel. After spending a few days enjoying Vancouver on foot, I pick up a car rental from one of the nearby agencies. Afterward trips further afield, such as drives to Whistler or Vancouver Island, are possible, plus rental costs are far less with downtown agencies than at the airport. My most telling endorsement of the Blue Horizon: a booking agency once placed me in a downtown five-star hotel. After one day of disappointment, I cancelled the remaining days and booked the rest of my stay at the Blue Horizon. The Blue Horizon remains one of my favorite hotel finds of all time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: spitty77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on arrival in Vancouver from UK. Front of House staff friendly and helpful. Bonus was the great views (29th floor) and, clean comfortable rooms. Embarked on a 2000 mile tour by car. On return to Vancouver we looked for accommodation without reservations and were disappointed with the hotels available, so returned to Blue Horizon-they remembered us from earlier stay and were extremely helpful, even gave us a discount on rooms on the 8th floor!!! Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: wanda91
Reviews.Content: This hotel has modern, clean rooms and is located in a perfect spot on Robson Street, right in the middle of shopping and restaurants. For the price, this hotel is high end. A great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ageing but worth the view.”
Reviews.Author: Travelscan
Reviews.Content: Well situated on the better end of Robson St in downtown Vancouver. This hotel is ageing but rooms are clean and a good size with balcony. Great views to Stanley Park and the harbour. Some traffic noise even on the 12th floor but expected in the city center. Bed was comfortable and the room had the usual TV, fridge, room safe and coffee making machine. Staff were helpfull. Breakfast was a la carte and pricey. Better value down Robson St. Try the Bread Garden on the diagonal corner. The hotel has a resturant but with all the choice down the street I did not try it. Good value, safe central location, great views.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: dayzi71
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the blue horizon in june, I was stunned first by the fountain in the lobby (its gorgeous) and secondly by the view of english bay from my 26th floor room. My room was very clean and well equiped, and the staff was friendly and helpful. I am excited to say that I have booked another trip for the Celebration of Light in august. The fireworks will be phenomenal from the balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent View”
Reviews.Author: skateluv
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel after reading all the glowing reviews here on Trip Advisor. We are very glad we did. As everyone has stated before, the views are simply spectacular. We were in room 2806 and were amazed that we had windows on two full walls. The rooms are very spacious with two queen beds, a desk and chair, mini-bar with refrigerator, 2 drawer chest with swivel TV and stand. The closet had stacked cube shelves, double area for hanging clothes, top layer shelf and a safe. Loved that the hotel is trying to be more green and therefore has a soap dispenser in the shower that they keep full with a combination shower gel / shampoo. Eliminates all those little sample size plastic bottles ending up in the landfills. Great job, Blue Horizon! Close to all the nightlife and shopping on Robson. Lots of great food too. My only negative with the hotel is that the balconies don't have furniture and the railings are not even half walls, but open slats about 10 inches wide. Made me nervous! Would definitely ask for a lower floor if staying with very young children. The sliding glass door that leads to the balcony would be easily opened by a child and the child could probably slip through the railing openings. Just a caution that if you have young children and stay here...you must be fully watchful! Loved Zeferelli's (an Italian restaurant loved by locals) a block north of the hotel and there was a gelato shop across the street that always seemed busy. The gelato shop only accepts cash, so we didn't get a chance to sample it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, outstanding views”
Reviews.Author: NorCalGal03
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stay at the Blue Horizon Hotel - and I strongly urge you to do so during your Vancouver visit - you absolutely must spring for a "superior" upper floor room. I can't stop talking about the amazing view from the 28th floor. While it's very nice, the Blue Horizon isn't an extremely fancy hotel (no designer toiletries, no spa, no room service - reasons why it doesn't quite merit 5 stars). Still, the rooms are spacious and clean, if a bit dated. Front desk service is friendly and efficient, and the hotel's location couldn't be better: right in the middle of the action on Robson Street. Did I mention the view? There's no doubt that I'll stay at the Blue Horizon when I visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: physioT
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel whilst attending a conference at the convention centre. Despite the rather old appearance of the building, we were pleasantly surprised by the room interior, which was clean, modern and specious. We were upgraded to a room on the 30th floor so it was nice and quiet with a good view. Internet speed was a bit slow but quite functional. The air conditioner was a bit noisy but tolerable. The best thing is the hotel's location on Robson St close to trendy restaurants and boutiques. Although there were quite a few beggars on the street, I never felt threatened in any way. I think there were beggars on every street corner from Burkhart St intersection all the way to the hotel. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dudemius
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Blue Horizon in late March. My "superior" room on the 16th floor was of a good size and decently furnished. If you look at the attached photo of this hotel you can see that it is a tall skinny building. This tranlates to a floor layout where many (perhaps all?) rooms are corner units with extra light and views. This is a somewhat unique feature worth noting. The physical location on Robson is good, the area is safe, and there is plenty of dining and shopping in the immediate vicinity. l visited the hotel restaurant twice and while not a bad value for a hotel, service one evening was pretty disengaged. In terms of other housekeeping / service issues, none were noted. Overall I was very satisfied with the Blue Horizon and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CrunchieBite
