Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights (12th to 14th May 2007) with 2 rooms on 16th floor. First room had a pair of queen sized beds while second room had 1 large king sized bed. Both rooms were clean and spacious with all the expected amenities (safe, bathroom, desk, sink etc). Staff were friendly and helpful and we ate in the hotel restaurant on the ground floor several times without any issues whatsoever. We would highly recommend the "Beer battered Fish & Chips" Location is great - slap bang on Robson street and a short walk away from Canada Place, Stanley Park or English Bay..be warned though, the hotel is an up-hill walk from any of these! All in all a good stay without issues!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Girl_from_TO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blue Horizon Hotel for three nights while at a conference in Vancouver. I found the hotel to be in a great location, with easy access to all major attractions in the city. The room that I stayed in (a two queen room on the 26 floor) was bright and spacious. There were lots of windows in the room and a balcony to enjoy the beautiful views! Overall, it was a great experience and I do plan to return to that hotel in the future for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: lce2
Reviews.Content: We had a very large room on 27th floor with great views (except for when the clouds came in). Staff were very friendly and helpful. Given the central location and size of room, I think this hotel is excellent value for money. I would happily stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JMD2007
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon is a great deal--it's centrally located in a major shopping district in Vancouver and it's a close walk to many tourist site, including Stanley Park. The hotel doesn't have a lot of amenities, but my room was large, clean, and comfortable. As a single woman traveling alone, I felt very safe at this hotel and had a very pleasant experience. I strongly recommend the Blue Horizon.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel except for billing”
Reviews.Author: peter84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Dec 27, checking in at midnight with two friends we got a 2 queen superior for just $109 a night from the very friendly desk staff. The room was big like 400 sqft had big swivel tv, chair and footstool, minibar and desks and balcony. Awesome views from 28th floor. However the problems i faced was with the PPV movies we saw a movie displayed as $0.00 so we watched it thinking a movie was free however I was billed for it and front desk manager wouldnt budge or even look into it ie look at the tv itself to see if there was malfunction on PPV just said it cost $15 or whatever then another movie started playing which we didnt order, it would pop up as we were watching cable tv. It gets annoying while watching comedy to have PORN pop up especially if kids were going to be present. So i would advise blocking porn channels.. Again the manager said we mustve ordered it and were billed for 2 movies at over $30. Besides that fact this hotel was great and I would stay again and just not order even 1 movie.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: CRMotorbikes
Reviews.Content: The Blue Horizon Hotel in Vancouver, BC is a great hotel with a great location at a reasonable price. Room 3001 is a spacious Superior King with a window looking to the west and a balcony looking to the north. The hotel is right on Robson Street where the shopping and dining possibilities are endless. The hotel offers parking in their garage, but there is a charge of $12 CDN per day. The hotel staff are friendly and very helpful. We had a noisy baseboard heater the first night, which we mentioned to the front desk and they took care of it promptly. We also had a slow toilet, so we mentioned that to the front desk and it was replaced promptly. The room are updated and spacious. The bathrooms are also updated. We stayed at the hotel for New Year's Eve, which worked out great because you can enjoy the night, but the noise didn't keep you up. I would definitely stay there again. And I would definitely stay there over New Year's Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing Disaster!! Don't stay in room 1104!”
Reviews.Author: dumbchick
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Blue Horizon for 4 nights in Dec/Jan 2006/2007, for the New Year's Holiday. The rooms are more than sufficient, and have balconies. (There is no balcony furniture, however.) The real upside of this hotel is the location. I don't think that you can beat the location for the price. We had a standard queen room for the first 2 nights. On the morning of the 3rd day, I turned on the faucet in the bathtub to take a shower, and what appeared to be feces came out of the faucet. Ewwwwwww! We called the front desk and told them that we needed a plumber. They had 2 staff member up there within 5 mintues to find out what was going on. We showed them the problem and requested a new room, and they told us that someone would call us soon. Within another 5 minutes, a manager called and told us that they would be giving us a new room, and upgrading us to a superior king room at no extra charge. We told them that would be fine. We were seriously grossed out, but I guess plumbing problems happen, and they took care of it promptly. Overall, we were impressed with the service and would call it a good experience. But don't stay in room 1104! :)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: joode
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is brilliant being right on the shoppers paradise of Robson Street. It is just a few minutes walk to Cloud 9 restauarant from wher you survey Vancouver's skyline whilst dining in the revolving restaurant. The hotel bedrooms were huge, light and airy with coffee maker, TV etc. Our only problem was that the hotel cafe closed at 8pm on the Sunday evening which was mentioned nowhere in the hotel room diectory. Hence we had to go out to find an eatery after a long journey.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Heiko_Kretzschmar
Reviews.Content: I spend three nights at this hotel in early September. The location couldn’t be better: on Robson St in central downtown Vancouver with lots of shops, bars and restaurants nearby. The room was of average size. It was clean, but the carpet was a little dated. The view from the balcony is not really a plus, as one looks mainly at other high-rising houses. Due to the construction of the windows, the place was somewhat noisy, even at higher floors, and there was a lot of air pollution, which is true for all downtown Vancouver. Staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast at the restaurant was a good value. There were no obvious shortcomings and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: yaya#1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great downtown location. Right on Robeson which is the Rodeo Drive of Vancouver. It was clean and housekeeping did a nice job daily. It was just as represented and our stay was very comfortable. Easy to get the the downtown bus system.

Reviews.Title: “Central location Vancouver great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brisvegas girl17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Vancouver Visitors Centre over the phone for a 3 night stay in September 2006 with my son and his fiancee. We arrived very late at night from San Francisco and were greeted by name from the check-in desk and asked after our long day how we were. Our room on 21st floor with a small patio (not big enough to sit on) had views of the ocean. Right in Robson street and walking distance or short bus trip in every direction to the main tourist areas. The staff were very helpful in giving information regarding how to get to Vancouver Island our next leg of our trip, how toaccess Capilano SuspensionBridge via the bus network and other information on restaurants. The cafe in the downstairs area does a great breakfast for a reasonable price. The room had a small bar fridge but otherwise was a pretty standard one room hotel room (with two double beds ) We loved the location and the friendly staff. Lamented the lack of laundry facilities as we always seem to need to do a couple of loads of washing and they are never easy to find in a big city. I would recommend the hotel for a couple or small family for a night or two any longer and you would be getting under each other's feet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the night before our cruise. Had a 2 queen room on the 22nd floor with a great view of Robson Street and English Bay! Lot's of room for 2 people, beds were more than comfortable and the bathroom was retro! The hotel restaurant had a great breakfast, and we were sorry we did not eat there for dinner. Parking is a breeze at $12 CAD a day! It was fun to get out and walk Robson Street at night! For the price and location, you cannot beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Traveller555
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly cheap and cheerful hotel in a fantastic location on Robson Street in central Vancouver, a stone's throw from shops and eating places. The rooms are large, decor a little dated but fine, clean and tidy. All roms have great views and balconies - superb to look over the city at night. The bar and restaurant is good value for money and the food is excellent. We have also stayed at the expensive Opus hotel in Yaletown which I believe is twice the price of the BH - the BH was far better. Probably not one for honeymooners or special occasions eg there is no room service and its a great hotel but not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: Gregtheleo
Reviews.Content: After calling the hotel direct and being told they were sold out for the weekend, we booked a room via travelocity and saved 20.00 too! When we checked in late friday night the desk clerk smiled and said " you guys look like you have had a long day, I am going to upgrade you to a superior room, please call the desk and ask for me if you have any problems". Our room was incredible, large, with plush sheets and pillows. The view in the morning was AWESOME! A nice hotel, friendly staff right in the middle of downtown. Greg in New Orleans....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: KCorner
Reviews.Content: A proper tourist hotel, right in the middle of town with good facilities and amazing views (from the upper floors). Our room was on the 25th floor and featured floor to ceiling windows on two sides (one side looked out onto Robson Street so not worth opening the curtains). From our balcony we could gaze at lots of water and mountains - very relaxing, after a mornings hardcore sightseeing. My only complaint (which is easily avoided) is the so-called-Irish pub that is part of the hotel, Shenanigans - avoid at all costs unless you like hanging out in 1970's student union bars. What is the Blue Horizon thinking?! Can't recommend the hotel enough, but make sure you get an upper floor to get the view and avoid the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise Plus”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHyde
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon for 3 days following ans Alaskan cruise. The hotel was recommended by friends who use it frequently. The location is fantastic, on Robson Street, between the best shops and Stanley Park. The rooms are very large . We were on the 29th floor with great views. We paid to upgrade to the Superior rooms on the higher floors. This is well worth doing as Robson Street is a busy road and the lower level rooms suffer traffic noise. We paid 189 Canadian Dollars per night (plus taxes). Loads of bars and restaurants in the area. No hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Blue horizon”
Reviews.Author: GMB2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Centrally located and spacious rooms. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but great location”
Reviews.Author: sandboy
Reviews.Content: On Robson Street the location is great, and the rooms were enormous. It was not that cheap about $200CAD per night and the only fault was that the lifts were a bit smelly - but free hi speed internet was great for keeping in touch with home and our group. The breakfast is a bit pricey and what you'd expect but there are 100's of choices of where to eat on Robson Street and Davies Street is only 2 blocks away for those who are interested in the G&L venues. When in Vancouver hire a bike and ride around stanley park and the city - a great way to see the sights. Loved Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room at Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: GardenTime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Horizon for 4 nights in mid July and had a great room with a nice view of the bay. The corner room we had was quite large and easily accommodated a desk, easy chair & foot rest plus 2 queen size beds. Although we didn't have need for the frig or the coffee pot, they were available as well. Location was great, close to shopping, tons of restaurants, and certainly within walking distance to Gastown and Chinatown. We had a car so the $12/night,Canadian, for parking seemed a bit steep to us, but we didn't have a choice. We didn't try their restaurant, but it was always full and the menu looked appetizing. We'd stay there again if we ever get back up to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBoo
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Blue Horizon and loved every minute. The staff was very polite and helpful. I requested a room with a view and got it. The view was beautiful and impressive. The accommodations were well worth the price, and the room was tastefully decorated and had everything I could need. I was able to easily access the internet with a laptop in my room. The parking lot felt safe and secure. I would definitely stay there again and recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Blue Horizon”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferigor
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Blue Horizon. It is right on Robson Street, which is a good location if you like upscale clothing stores. We stayed on a Saturday and Sunday night and were able to receive a small AAA discount only on Sunday's stay. The room had lots of windows which allowed for a great view. We were overlooking English Bay and could see part of the mountains, although they were somewhat blocked by other high rise hotels and condos. It was a hot weekend and our air-conditioning did not work properly the first night, so they moved us to a room across the hall. It still had great city views, but I'd definitely request a room looking over the bay if you have a choice. Also, because Robson St. is busy and noisy on the weekend nights with party goers, request a room on the 15th floor or above to avoid noise. We didn't have any problem on the 21st floor. I was a little disappointed that our room didn't have a refrigerator, but the room was clean and the hotel staff was polite. Note that Robson is a long street, so plan on doing a lot of walking if you want to see it all. The hotel is towards the north end of the street. Granville (another main street) is a good walk from the hotel, as is Stanley Park, Gastown, etc. The city bus is a cheap alternative to walking. If we went back to Vancouver, I would choose to stay in another neighborhood to try something different. Also, I got a good tip from someone who used to be a resident of Vancouver. If you take a car and drive from place to place, make sure you park in a secure parking garage with an attendant or just leave your car in your hotel's parking garage. Do not park on the street or leave anything visible in your car, as theft is a big problem in the city. Overall, the Blue Horizon is a good hotel for location if you want trendy shopping and restaurants. It is pricey for what it is, but the view is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Srecond Visit and Would Go Back again”
Reviews.Author: almara
Reviews.Content: A great location, super large rooms with terrific views - would recommend one of the higher floors - 14 and above. This was our second stay and would definitely use it again - all round good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale”
Reviews.Author: balderdash
Reviews.Content: Blue horizon is a great place to stay...right on robson st which is where the action is..close walk to Stanley Park...the restaurants are good at the hotel, and the immediate area has great access to other solid restaurants..stayed for about 150 US Dollars..nice lobby...rooms are clean..

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, big rooms, brilliant views. And a breakfast to die for. We would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit....another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sdflyer
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit (see previous review, March 9, 2006.) We returned for our wedding in Stanley Park and booked 5 rooms plus a 1 bedroom suite, all on the 30th floor. Our suite featured a separate bedroom, two bathrooms and a large living room...perfect for hosting our guests during the events. Staying for three nights, here were 11 guests in our party and everyone enjoyed their stay. The rooms are clean and feature updated contemporary decor and free wired internet. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Every room is on a corner with windows on two walls and a balcony so each has views spanning almost 270 degrees. The "million-dollar-views", the location, the staff and the cleanliness of the rooms make this a prime choice with reasonable rates. We are in the airline industry, travel alot and can easily recommend the Blue Horizon as one of our favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: cc41
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leery about the Blue Horizon based on some of the reviews I read, but it was where we wanted to be so we took a chance and glad we did. The desk staff was great from an early check in to restaurant recommendation to early morning check out. Could not have been nicer or more helpful. Room was a bit dated, nothing horrible-just dated, but it was IMMACULATE and very large. I would definately recommend a superior room to be on the upper floors. You'll get a better view and avoid the street noise. We were on the 19th floor and did not hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Old, noisy rooms for more than 200$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights, could not sleep because of the noise from other rooms and the street. I moved to another hoter at the same street, paid half and could sleep....

Reviews.Title: “NIce value”
Reviews.Author: Flxible
Reviews.Content: Was a nice experience. Room was nice, but needed new outlets, the electric cords kept falling out. Was clean and quiet even for Robson Street. Parking was a steal at $10CDN per night. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: remarkable1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better; in the middle of Robeson St, the main restaurant and shopping area, and right in the center of town. We were upgraded to an upper floor; 24th. The room was very large, with windows on two sides and a balcony. Fantastic views, perhaps the best in town! The room was large and comfortable, if not lavishly appointed. The hot tub next to the indoor pool was welcome after a long day's walking. The staff was friendly and helpful. The is both a pub and restaurant right downstairs, and countless choices with a few blcoks walking. All in all, a great value and an exceptional place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and service”
Reviews.Author: johnnietravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very good value for what I paid. I got a rate of $139 from the hotel website. This gave me a room with a 2 queen beds. The rate was low, but the treatment by all staff was first class. It was a dear friend's first trip to Vancouver and we are so grateful that this hotel helped make our time together very special. Maid service was fantastic, front desk was very helpful. The room was very large, and while a little dated it was very comfortable and well looked after. The in room safe, and fridge were handy. I would stay there again and plan to. Very nice people work at this hotel. Great location so many things are within easy walking distance as well.
